Elle sollicite ce crédit pour associer à son ancienne activité la vente de mèche et de produits cosmétiques qui est très rentable afin de pouvoir faire face aux besoins de sa famille et surtout pour la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Albertine A. is married and the mother of three and lives in Aného. Having lost her husband, she is alone in coping with the needs of the family. She does commerce in jewelry that enables her to cope. She is requesting this loan to include in her former work the sale of hair extensions and cosmetics, which are very profitable. She can then address family needs especially schooling the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cosmetics, hair extensions, and jewelry

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith A. is 30 years old and married with four children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She travels to Warri, Delta State to purchase foodstuffs and provisions to sell in Benin City. She needs the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says, "thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Trébol.
Flora es casada, tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, Flora tiene una bodega en su casa ubicada en el distrito de Jesús Nazareno, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días por las mañanas y por las tardes trabaja en un colegio como docente.
Flora necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Flora sueña con mejorar su negocio, su hijos culmine sus estudios y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Flora is an associate of the Cloverleaf Communal Bank. Flora is married, 49 years old and has 3 children. Flora has a convenience store in her house located in the Jesus of Nazareth district, where she sells groceries, vegetables, and fruits, an activity that she carries out every day in the mornings. In the afternoons she works in a school as a teacher. Flora needs a loan of 750 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Flora dreams of improving her business and that her children finish their studies and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar for her grocery business.

loans.name: Lidia Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Sonia es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Sonia vende ropa como buzos de polar que vende al por mayor y reparte a las tiendas, puestos de mercados, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Tacna, sus ventas también lo realiza en otros departamentos. Además Sonia tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa y esta administrado por su hija.
Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantallas de computadora.
Los sueños de Sonia son construir su casa de material noble e implementar una tienda de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Llamkasum communal bank, which works in the Quechua language. Sonia is married, 36 years old and has 4 children. Sonia sells clothign such as track suits that she sells at the wholesale level and distributes to stores and booths in markets. She acquires her products in the city of Tacna and sells in other areas. Sonia also has Internet booths in her house and these are managed by her daughter. Sonia needs a loan of 1500 Soles, which will be invested in the purchase of computer monitors. Sonia's dreams are to build a sturdy house and set up a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of computer monitors

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité  fue la señora Lurde G., está casada con el Señor Carlos A. es madre de 2 Hijos ella es Transportista vive en el barrio Fátima de C.D.E. A la señora le agrado mucho el Programa de comité e Mujeres Emprendedoras contacto con sus vecinas y amigas  para formar el comité en dicha zona.

El comité se denomina “Maria Auxiliadora”, está constituido  por 21 señoras muy activas y solidA. todas de la misma zona.

Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser Venta de: Pantalones, remeras, zapatillas, tomates, cebollas, maquillajes, polvo compacto, cremas para el rostro,  manzanas, bananas, gaseosas, galletitas, caramelos, melones, sandias, azúcar, leche, aceite y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo.

Las señoras retiran un crédito de Gs 300.000 a 800.000 Gs
El Crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para y artículos de primera necesidad para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lurde G. founded this group. She is married to Mr. Carlos A., and is the mother of two children. She specializes in shipping, and lives in the Fátima de C.D.E neighborhood. She is very grateful to the group's program and to Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) for the contact she has with her neighbors and friends to form the group in this area.

The group is called "Maria Auxiliadora," and it is comprised of 21 active, united women, all from the same area. They all work in different fields, including sales of pants, t-shirts, shoes, tomatoes, onions, makeup, powders, facial creams, apples, bananas, sodas, cookies, caramels, melons, watermelons, sugar, milk, and oil, while other will begin a new line of work and rely on a fixed income.

The women are taking out a credit of $3050, which will be used to purchase merchandise and necessities for their sales.


Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for retail activities

loans.name: Rasoolan M. Iqbal Group

texts.en:
'My name is Rasoolan and I’m 45 years old and married. I have resided in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 10 years. I am married to a man whose name is M. I. and he is a ticket checker in the railway. I have two kids: one son and one daughter. My son manufactures plastic bags. My daughter reads in 8th standard. I am an older lady and my family suggests I do household work. I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy plastic beans to expand my son’s plastic bag-making business.

I am the group leader for some more women from my locality. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy cloth and colored thread for her boutique. Parveen Akthar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport. Nusrat Bano baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy paint to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy plastic beans for making plastic bags

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: El sr. Cesar es un cliente antiguo de la institución, trabajó con un grupo solidario “los Cumplidos”, se individualiza y ahora solicita su crédito paralelo para  cancelar del saldo en la compra de una movilidad. Vive con su esposa la sra. Julia quien tiene un puesto de venta en la calle Garcilazo de la Vega, popular feria de la ciudad de La Paz, lugar muy comercial. Tienen tres niños en edad escolar, ambos se encargan de los gastos de la casa. Clientes responsables y conocidos por la zona.
texts.en:
Cesar is a longtime client of Emprender. He used to be part of the "Los Cumplidos" group, but now on his own is asking for a loan to finish paying for the purchase of a vehicle. He lives with his wife, Julia, who has a stand on Garcilazo de la Vega Street, in a popular market in La Paz. They have three school-age children and both of them take care of household expenses. They are responsible clients and known in the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay off the balance on a vehicle.

loans.name: Inomjon

texts.en:
N. Inomjon is a very courageous man who is characterized as someone who can manage tough jobs like raising livestock. He's the father of three children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need.

In spite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, Inomjon has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of animals to breed on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Inomjon comes to IMON International for loans for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia es NORMA, vecina del barrio de ucchullo por el mirador del Cusco, ubicada a 45 minutos de la plaza principal del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 26 años ella es conviviente tiene 1 hijo de (3 años), ella a estudiado enfermería técnica en un instituto superior y actualmente trabaja en su carrera, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su profesión, la socia requiere el préstamo para apoyar a su pareja en la compra de los repuestos para el auto que ellos tiene, su pareja la apoya económicamente con el taxi de servicio público, que él mismo maneja diario.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y así mismo esta comprometida a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
This client is Norma, a resident of Ucchullo neighborhood by the view point of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the Main Square of Cusco.

Norma is 26 years old and lives with her one child (3 years old) and her common law husband. She is studying technical nursing in college and is currently working on her degree. She alternates between her household duties and her profession. Norma needs a loan to support her husband in purchasing spare parts for the car they have. Her significant other supports her economically with the public taxi service that he himself drives everyday.

Norma values and appreciates the granted loan and she is committed to fulfill the payment of her debt on the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lee Bruner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her taxi

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 34-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Mahmoud has been working as a taxi driver since 1995. Mahmoud requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car and pay his car debt. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
Mahmoud is special in his work because he has a clean car and he knows how to treat his clients well. His clients can be anybody. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. Mahmoud decided on doing this business because he didn’t continue his school education. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by purchasing another taxi car and renting it.

loans.use: Car maintenance and debt on his car.

loans.name: María Isidora

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, la señora María Isidora C. se dedica a laborar muy esforzadamente para lograr su sueño de mejorar las condiciones de vida tanto de ella como de su familia. 

Es de relevancia destacar que hoy en día la señora María C. es soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres hijos y su anciano padre. Por este motivo ella requiere un crédito y ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así salir adelante en el negocio.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica of the city of León, Maria Isidora C. works hard to achieve her dream of improving her own and her family’s quality of life. It is important to emphasize that currently Maria C. is single and has the responsibility of supporting her three children and her elderly father. For this reason she needs a loan and has sough Ceprodel to be obtain a loan to purchase construction materials to be able to move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Cette femme a commencé l’année dernière le commerce des produits cosmétiques, son commerce a déjà pris un élan remarquable, compte tenu de cela elle veut agrandir son stock de marchandises pour mieux satisfaire ses clients. Elle sollicite a lors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des produits de beauté, des parfums, déodorants, mèches et perruques.
Elle est mariée, et avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce, elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Last year, this woman started doing commerce in cosmetics. Her business has already achieved remarkable momentum. Given this, she wants to expand her stock of merchandise to satisfy her customers better. So she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy beauty products, perfumes, deodorants, hair extensions, and wigs. She is married, and with what she earns from her commerce, she helps to support her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice B. is a baker and sells bread at Amissano in Elmina. Beatrice has received junior high school education. She is married and has 5 dependants. Her husband is a teacher. Beatrice has been selling bread since 2006. She is responsible for buying books for the children. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar and margarine and other ingredients for the baking of the bread. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and margarine and other ingredients for the baking of the bread.

loans.name: Kodjo Prosper

texts.fr: Cet homme habite le quartier SOUZA Netimé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé et exerce comme activité la couture. Il est marié avec un enfant à sa charge. il sollicite un prêt à WAGES pour l’achat d’une machine à coudre boutonneuse et une autre surfileuse pour satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle sans cesse croissants.
texts.en:
This is a man who lives in the SOUZA Netimé district on the outskirts of the city of Lomé. His business involves making clothing. He is married and has a child to support. He is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy a sewing machine which can sew buttons or button holes and another machine for overcasting cloth, so as to satisfy his ever-growing needs of his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines

loans.name: Tep's Group

texts.en: This group of three provides a service of hand-making bamboo baskets. The group is led by R., 28, who is the mother of three children who are still young and attend school.  They are looking for a loan to invest in their handmade baskets service. R. is married to Sovann who helps her business through the nearby villages.

loans.use: To invest in their handmade baskets service.

loans.name: Nargiza's Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Nargiza, a 30-year-old woman with a strong character. She is divorced and has raised two children on her own, both of whom are at school. Even though her family consists of just three members, Nargiza has to work hard to provide them with a worthy life. She makes a living by selling video and audio CDs, DVDs and mp3 players. Sometimes, she even manages to trade in cattle. She is very fortunate to have a caring brother, who is always by her side at difficult times. When Nargiza leaves her stall to transport goods, he replaces her so that trade is not interrupted.

Two years in business have brought her evident results: purchase of a car for transporting goods, and some convenience goods for her home. Her original investment was $70 USD, and her current monthly income is around $480 USD. Nargiza's plan is to build a house and set her children on their feet by providing them with a good education. For this, Nargiza needs a loan to purchase video and audio CDs, DVDs, children’s school uniform, table napkins and diapers, as she has noticed a growing demand for these goods.

Nargiza’s partners are Nariste, Baktygul, Larisa and Nurlan. Nariste, 26, is married. Her husband is a security guard at a casino, whereas she buys milk products wholesale and sells them at the market. She needs a loan to buy butter, cottage cheese and sour cream.

Baktygul, 34, has two children. She sells foodstuffs in a small shop. In addition, she sells chewing gum, cigarettes and vitamins, at the city market. Baktygul needs a loan to purchase school equipment, cereals, soft drinks and ice-creams.

Larisa, 34, is married and has three children. She trades in fish, and her husband is a minibus driver. Larisa needs a loan to purchase frozen fish, school equipment and clothes for her children.

Nurlan, 30, is married with one child. He works as a security guard at two locations. In addition, he manages to keep cattle. He needs a loan to buy a calf.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and to view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan, at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase video and audio CDs, DVDs, school uniform, napkins and diapers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Acheter des une machine à coudre

loans.name: Rosito

texts.en:
Rosito B. is from Brgy. Puga-an, Iligan City. He is 44 years old. Rosito is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosito owns & operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Rosito has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosito is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Puga-an, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en una pequeña casa junto a sus 2 hijos; Wilson de 22 y Gerber de 20 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

En el tiempo que Narcisa viene realizando la crianza de ganado, ha podido forjarse una vida digna, ella realiza esta actividad desde que era muy joven y actualmente se ha convertido en una de las ganaderas más solicitadas, debido a las grandes reses que lleva a vender a la ciudad de Juliaca.
Narcisa es natural de Taraco (distrito de la provincia de Huancané) y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es criar su ganado, ya que sabe que mientras mejor los cuide, mejores pagos le darán por sus reses. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar las reses hasta el lugar de la venta, puesto que es una actividad que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo. 
Para más adelante, desea poner una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le pueda generar ingresos adicionales y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Este es el primer préstamo de Narcisa con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida debido a la alegría que le pone a las reuniones. Con los mil soles solicitados  comprará una vaca, pero para completar el costo total está dispuesta a poner dinero de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Narcissa is 44 years old and a loving mother. She lives in a small house with her two sons, Wilson (age 22) and Gerber (age 20), who are the reason behind all her efforts.

Narcissa has been raising cattle in order to forge a decent life for herself. She learned how to take care of animals at a young age and now her cattle are some of the most sought after livestock being sold in the city of Juliaca. Narcissa is a native of Taraco (a district in the province of Huancané). She enjoys caring for her animals because the more attention she given them, the higher the prices she can command. For 30 years, Narcissa has been at her job and says the most difficult part for her is transporting her animals to market because it demands much time and effort. At some point in the future, she would like to open a grocery store so that she can generate additional income and improve her family’s quality of life.

This is her first loan with MFP. Narcissa feels the responsibility of making her payments on time because she does not want to get in trouble with the other members of her Communal Bank. She is adored by everyone else because she brings much joy to all of their meetings. Narcissa will use her loan of 1000 soles to buy a cow, but she needs to save up some additional funds in order to complete the purchase.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Mrs. Moun Sott Group

texts.en: Mrs. Moun S. lives in Tuol Kdei village in Kandal province, and is part of the Mrs. Moun S. Group. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare field of land where she cultivate rices. She is requesting a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizers for rice cultivating. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living with this loan. Mrs. Moun S. is a widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another attends the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizers for rice cultivating.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina A. is from the village of San Carlos, Valencia City. She is 41 years old. Marcelina is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marcelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Marcelina's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María
texts.en: María

loans.use: For her son's graduation.

loans.name: Elueteria

texts.en:
Elueteria P. is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old. Elueteria is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Elueteria operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Elueteria has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately $75 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Elueteria joined the Kiva field partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elueteria is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma D. is from the village of Camiguin. She is 52 years old. Erma is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Erma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Erma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Erma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erma is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to expand her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Erma from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Am

texts.en: Mrs. Am N., a widowed mother of four children, three married and one single, is a temporary laborer who is also hired by villagers to decorate or cook for their parties. She also relies on the income from two of her children, one a used-goods seller and the other a crop-planter in the village. Her single son is soon to wed, and Am N. is asking for a loan to help with the wedding party.

loans.use: Wedding party

loans.name: Eva Ramona

texts.es: La Sra. Eva Ramona E., es de oficio profesora de educación secundaria, es madre de un hijo en edad escolar, actualmente esta estudiando una carrera universitaria y parte de este crédito lo utilizara para financiar sus estudios aunque la mayor parte es para mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eva Ramona E. is a high school teacher and she has a school-aged son; she is currently studying in college and she will use part of this loan to finance her studies, even though most of it will be used for house improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials such as bricks, sand, cement and roofing materials.

loans.name: Melvin Armando

texts.es:
el joven Melvin Armando A. C. tiene 28 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para damas, caballeros y niños en la ciudad de nacaome y en las comunidades cercanas.
anteriormente hacia esta actividad junto a su esposa Oneyda Almendares pero adquirieron un local en el mercado municipal e instalaron un comedor el cual ella atiende.
el trabajo de ambos les ha servido para poder construir su casa la cual estrenaran en mes de abril del 2010 y por lo cual dicen sentirse muy contentos y felices.
las ganancias que obtenga las nececita para cubrir con los gastos de su nuevo hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Melvin Armando A. C. is 28 years old and sells new clothing for men, women, and children in the city of Nacaome and in surrounding areas. He used to do this with his wife, Oneyda Almendares, but they then obtained a business space at the municipal market, where they set up a small restaurant that she now attends to. Their work has helped them get a chance to build their own house, which they will be occupying for the first time in April of 2010. For this reason, they state that they are very happy. The profits that he earns will be used to cover the new house expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shirts, undershirts, blouses, pants, jeans and skirts

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Sabali est un regroupement de 5 femmes (3 mariées et 2 veuves) ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur premier  prêt. 
Elles font la vente de condiments alimentaires, de cola et de  chaussures.
Avec leur prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 1panier de cola et 5 douzaines de paires de chaussures en plastique. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à domicile, dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Sabali is a grouping of five women (three married and two widowed) who average 37 years of age and have an average of three children; the majority live in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy their customers' needs and are on their first loan. They sell condiments, cola and shoes. With their loan they are planning to buy three packets of condiments, one basket of cola and five dozen pairs of plastic shoes. They get their supplies at the big market in Sikasso town and in the neighboring villages. They sell at home, in markets and walking around the districts, for cash and often on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. They envisage making an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA each, of which part will be used for savings and family needs, and the rest invested in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Dayawathi

texts.en:
Dayawathi is a 40-year-old married woman living with her two children. Her husband is currently living and working abroad.

Dayawathi sews clothes as her business, and she has been doing this for a year. She is hardworking and very enthusiastic.

Dayawathi has requested a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to purchase cloth to help her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama I. is married to a driver and blessed with a child called Mohammed. She has no educational background. Mariama sells onions in both smaller and larger quantities at Abura. Mariama uses her income to help take care of the home. Mariama will use the loan to purchase more onions and other foodstuffs such as cassava, plantains and sweet potatoes for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mariama plans to save to get a shop in the marketplace where she can sell more of her goods.

loans.use: purchase more onions and other foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 38 years old, married to Patrick Yator, and they have three children. For the last two years, Grace has run a business raising livestock. She buys and rears different types of animals and sells them later at a profit.
Grace was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to buy two calves and sell them later at a profit. In the future, Grace plans to start dairy farming as she already has experience dealing with animals and can supply milk to the local market.

loans.use: To buy two calves for future resale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with a daughter named Svetlana. She lives in Vasilyevka. She runs a women's underwear sales business in the local mall. Victoria always offers good quality items, which attracts female customers to her outlet over and over again. She has been in this business for over six years. Currently, Victoria has over 10,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory.  

Victoria is seeking a loan of 5,000 Grivnyas to diversify the assorted merchandise for sale in her outlet in the local mall. She loves working indoors instead of having to stand outside in the open-air market all day long. Victoria has a true enterprising spirit. She is willing to move on and never stop in her business progress. She is hoping to see her business succeed and bring her stable income for years to come.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
Tý Nguyễn Thị is 51 years old and lives in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She leads a seven-person L. group. While each member of the group receives an individual L., they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this group is Đông Mai nhóm 02 (Nhóm 02).

Tý is married, has one grown child, and makes a living by raising chickens to sell.  She has been in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from her work.

In 2009, Tý joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous L. of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA, and used it to buy more livestock to raise. She is now requesting a new L. of 7.840.000 VND to buy feed and other supplies.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this L. to continue expanding her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  Ngô Thị T. is 45 years old and requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her furniture-making business.

2.  Ngô Thị L. is 26 years old and requesting a 7.392.000 VND L. to support her furniture-making business.

3.  Ngô Thị Phố is 47 years old and requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her furniture-making business.

4.  Nguyễn Thị L. is 29 years old and requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her retail store.

5.  Nguyễn Thị H. is 40 years old and requesting a 6.944.000 VND L. to support her furniture-making business.

6.  Ngô Thị Huệ (0) is 24 years old and requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her furniture-making business.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tý Nguyễn Thị (20211010016) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Tý là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Mai nhóm 02 (Nhóm 02).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  Tý thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tý kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Tý đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tý đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô Thị T. (0) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


2.  Ngô Thị L. (0) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Ngô Thị Phố (0) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


4.  Nguyễn Thị L. (0) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


5.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


6.  Ngô Thị Huệ (0) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to support several small businesses

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Âgée de 30 ans, Madame Mariam Traoré N. est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle vit dans une famille monogame à Médine-Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée il y a deux ans environs à cette activité d’achat et de vente d’oignons au nouveau marché dont elle dispose d’une table où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son  premier prêt individuel, qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter, 15 sacs d’oignons de graines différentes (9 sacs de petites graines et 6 sacs de grosses graines) auprès des producteurs. Ses marchandises sont vendues au comptant à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes de ménages.
Avec ce premier crédit elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariam Traoré N. is 30 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives in a monogamous famly in Médine-Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run several businesses without success, around two years ago she started the business of buying and selling onions at the new market where she has a table. She is much sought after by her customers for the quality of her products. In order to satisfy her growing clientele, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution; this is her first request for an individual loan. This loan will be used to increase her working capital in order to purchase 15 bags of different varieties of onions (9 bags of small varieties and 6 bags of large varieties) from producers. She sells her merchandise for cash to a customer base composed essentially of housewives. With this first loan she anticipates realizing an average monthly profit of 90,000 CFA that will be used principally to increase her working capital, contribute to the family’s expenses and to pay the interest on her loan.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase onions

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La Señora Leonarda C. tiene 38 años de edad y vive en union libre con el Señor Rodolfo Rivas quien trabaja en la Empresa Nacional Portuaria. El le ayuda economicamente ya que tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella. Leonarda alquila casa ya que no tiene casa propia. Leonarda es muy emprendedora y con deseos de salir adelante tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y productos de consumo popular. 

Leonarda utilizara el prestamo para la compra de pantalones, faldas y ropa interior femenina para incrementar sus ventas ya que han estado bajas este año. Ella invertira las ganancias en la construccion de su propia casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonarda C. is 38 and lives with her common-law husband, Mr. Rodolfo Rivas. He works for the National Port Authority and he helps her financially with her three dependent children. Leonarda rents a house since she doesn’t have one of her own. She is very hardworking and wants to get ahead and thus has a business selling clothing and popular consumer items. Leonarda will use her loan to buy pants, skirts, and ladies underwear to increase her sales since they have been low this year. She will use the earnings to build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new clothing

loans.name: Hamad

texts.en: Hamad H. is a married man with a small business. He runs a foodstuff shop in Kitunda ward, Dar es Salaam. He purchases goods from the foodstuff suppliers and from the wholesale shops. The goods he sells include wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil and groundnuts. He opened another business selling green vegetables and fruits behind his shop. He meets his family's daily needs and generates capital from his business income. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Tanzanian shillings to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene P. is from the village of Bayabo East. She is 37 years old. Mylene is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mylene owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mylene has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Mylene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mylene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mylene is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Mylene from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Martha Sofia

texts.es:
Martha Páez S. vive en el barrio Santo Domingo al sur occidente de Barranquilla, caracterizado por la celebración de fiestas como helados bailables, bazares y bingos comunitarios; ella es propietaria de la confección Martha que tiene hace mas de seis años, su  condicion de mujer casada y   madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 16 a 24 años hace que dia a dia multiplique sus esfuerzos domésticos y productivos para educarlos muy bien al lado de su esposo. Empezó con una maquina familiar y ha ido surgiendo a través de los años; en la actualidad su negocio es muy prospero y con  el apoyo de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ha comprado maquinaria para organizar mejor su taller, que funciona en su casa donde confecciona vestidos para damas en la líneas que ellas soliciten.
El Credikiva es  su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues requiere invertir en materia prima, telas, hilos, botones y elásticos y así gradualmente cumplirá  su sueño es ampliar su negocio y algún día ofrecerle posibilidades de empleo a otras personas que viven en su alrededor, para que sus familias prosperen también. Su mayor desafío ocurre cuando aparecen clientes muy exigentes pero esa experiencia seguramente será su base para ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Martha P. S. lives in the Santo Domingo district, to the west of Barranquilla. It is well known for its fairs where you may find ice cream, bazaars and community bingos. She has been the owner of Martha's Workshop for the past 6 years. She is a married woman and the mother of 3 children, between the ages of 16 and 24 years old. She works every day in the home and in her business to educate her children alongside her husband. She started out with the family's sewing machine but she has been improving over the years. Her business has grown to be very prosperous and with the support of Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) she has been able to purchase the equipment she needs for her shop. The shop is located inher house where she fashions dresses for ladies in the style they request. This loan is the second through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She requires this new loan to invest in materials such as fabrics, threads, buttons and elastic materials. She will gradually achieve her dream of expanding her business and to one day be able to hire others in her neighborhood, so that their families will also benefit. Her greatest challenge is meeting the expectations of some client's very high expectations. But this experience will surely be the way she can improve her level of service.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in materials such as fabrics, threads, buttons and elastic materials

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. A widowed mother of eight children, one of whom is in school, Margaret has been operating a chicken-selling business for two years, working six days each week. Margaret, who sells her products from home, is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more chicken. She also generates additional income through selling water and owning rental housing.

The main business challenges for Margaret are defaulters and the transportation of chickens from the villages to her stall in Nalukolongo. Her goals for her business include expanding further, increasing sales, and starting to rear chickens. Margaret lives in a home that she owns and has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more chicken  for resale

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever de 43 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, él tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas que es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta. El negocio lo inicio después de trabajar por varios años en un taller similar que tenía un amigo, él logro su propio taller y lo tiene en su casa de habitación, no tiene horario fijo para hacer su trabajo.
El solicita un préstamo para mejorar el techo que cubre su taller pues el que tiene ya no está en condiciones para soportar el invierno, Este préstamo ayudara a que compre los materiales necesarios como laminas para reconstruir el techo y mejorara la apariencia del taller dando una mejor atención y mayor comodidad a los clientes.
Sus proyecciones son ampliar su taller, atender más clientes y mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia abriendo la oportunidad a sus hijos para que estudien y puedan ser profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Ever is 43 years old and resides in El Transito in the Department of San Miguel. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 5 and 3. Ever has a workshop where he creates metal structures. This business is his only source of income. He started this business after he had worked several years at a similar shop owned by a friend. Ever was able to set up his own workshop in his home, but he does not currently work on a set schedule.

The loan he is requesting will be used to improve the roof that cover his workshop since it can no longer withstand the winter conditions. With the proceeds, Ever will be able to buy the necessary materials such as laminate to rebuild the roof and improve the appearance of his workshop. As a result, he will be able to provide better service and greater comfort for his customers.

His plans are to expand his workshop, attract more customers, improve the living conditions for his family, and create opportunities for his children to study so that they can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: Purchase materials to repair the roof of his workshop

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca R. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Francisca is widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Francisca owns & operates a business making and selling a variety of food products in the local community. Francisca is just starting this business.

In 2008, Francisca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Francisca from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: Maura, de 28 años, vive en casa de su suegra al lado de ella, de su esposo Juan de 29 años, que es chofer y de su pequeña hija; cada día es de lucha constante para esta emprendedora familia. Y por eso que se esfuerza por trabajar y salir adelante junto con su esposo. Cada día desde muy temprano empieza con la venta de diversos comestibles en su tienda ubicada en su casa, y dice que le gusta mucho su negocio ya que obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ostentar una vida cómoda. Atiende sola desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, y se entretiene con sus clientes que le compran con frecuencia, pues saben que ella en la tienda puede encontrar los más variados productos comestibles. Dice que la única preocupación que tiene en la actualidad es que su pequeña se encuentra algo delicada de salud, pero sabe que con esfuerzo y dedicación logrará sacar a su familia adelante. Para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar más su negocio para mejorar sus ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Maura tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en comestibles ya que quiere surtir mejor su negocio para ofrecerles lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en: Maura is 28 years old and lives in her mother-in-law's house with her mother-in-law, her husband Juan, 29, who is a driver and their small daughter.  Every day is a constant struggle for this enterprising family.  For this reason, Maura works very hard, together with her husband, to get ahead.  Every day from very early in the morning she starts selling groceries in her store which is located in her home.  She says that she likes her business very much because she makes a regular profit which enables her to live a comfortable life.  She works alone in the store from 9 in the morning to 8 at night.  She enjoys the company of her customers who buy from her very frequently because they know that they can find a wide range of food products in her store.  She says that the only worry she currently has is that her little one's condition is delicate but she knows that with effort and dedication she will succeed in getting her family ahead.   In the future she is planning to expand her business further in order to improve her profits.  This is the first loan which she has had with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner since she doesn't want to let down the people who made the loan possible.  The loan will allow her to continue working in search of progress.  Maura is planning to use the loan she is requesting to buy a larger quantity of groceries so that she can better stock her business and be able to offer the best to her customers.

loans.use: To buy a range of products to stock her store

loans.name: Uyanga

texts.en: Uyanga B. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her husband operates a transportation service using his own car and in summer months, he trains a racehorse. Her two children attend a local school. The family moved to their current town in 2001 after working and living as a herder in the countryside between 1995 and 2000. Uyanga graduated from a hairdresser training course in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. Since 2002, she has been working as a hairdresser. She is a friendly and open-minded woman. In the future, she plans to purchase the necessary and latest tools and equipment for her hair salon and provide good service for her customer in a comfortable environment. Uyanga says, "I want to save my business earnings and buy a new house and fence for my family." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase tools and equipment for her barber shop.

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom S. is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in Takhmao City. She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on her land, such as cabbages, cucumbers and morning glories, which she sells every two or three months when the plants mature. 

Mom S.'s husband is a construction worker in and around her community. The couple has four children; all of them are single. 

Mom S.'s motorbike is old and she needs to repair it very often. Because her savings account is not enough to buy a new motorbike, she is requesting some money to add to her personal savings so that she can buy a new motorbike to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to replace the broken one

loans.name: Shakirt

texts.en:
Shakirt T. is a 56-year-old single father who lives with his three children in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own fenced house. His youngest, a daughter, attends the university. One of his sons is a taxi driver in the town and the other is unemployed. 

Shakirt operates a chicken and cow farm. He owns three cows and ten chickens, which gives him milk and eggs to sell. His three cows produce nine liters of milk in one day and he sells the milk by the liter to his neighboring households with a price of 1,500 to 2,000 MNT. He sells eggs with a price of 300 to 500 MNT each. His daily sales income is between $16 and $25 with a 25-30% net profit. In the future, he plans to increase the numbers of his cows and chickens. 

Shakirt is an honest and hardworking man and says, "I want to support my children using my business profits." He is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan in order to buy more hay for his cows and feed for his chickens.

loans.use: To buy more hay for his cows and feed for his chickens

loans.name: Dunia Mayela

texts.es:
Dunia es una pequeña comerciante que se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, iniciando  desde joven al comercio para equilibrar los gastos de la familia.
Cuando comenzó lo hizo con pocos ahorros que su compañero dio, lo que vino a reforzar su inventario con préstamos que Afodenic dio mediante el financiamiento a plazo. Obteniendo mejores resultados de venta como la captación de clientes.
También a través de estos préstamos está mejorando su vivienda, lo que para ella es de gran satisfacción. Con este nuevo préstamo comprara láminas de zinc, perlines, soldadura,  diluyente, para cambiar el techo de la cocina. Logrando una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Dunia is a small business owner who sells clothing, shoes and from a very young age she has had a trade to help meet her families’ needs.

When Dunia began her business, she started with very few savings that her partner gave her and she used them to stock her inventory and with the loans from Afodenic (Kiva’s field partner) given to her in a previous loan. Dunia has had better sales and more customers.

Dunia has also been using the loans to make improvements to her home which gives her great satisfaction. With the new loan she will buy zinc sheets, tile, solder, and solvents to change her kitchen’s roof. This will allow her to have a better home.

loans.use: She will change her kitchen’s roof and will buy zinc sheets, tile, soldering, and solvents to change her kitchen’s roof. This will allow her to have a better home.

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita C. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 51 years old. Erlita is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Erlita has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Erlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Erlita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Erlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion S. is 60 years old and has six children. Her husband passed away already, so she is the one providing for the needs of the family.  To make a living, she has a farm and also raises hogs. Salvacion's older children help in maintaining their farm. 

She is asking for a loan to buy rice and corn seedlings for her farm. She will also buy fertilizers after planting the seeds for a good harvest.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kanyshai's Group

texts.en:
Women entrepreneurs need more care now, since their role in developing countries is starting to become more equal with the role that males have traditionally played. It’s time to promote women’s interests in the area of business.

Kanyshai B., 24, is the treasurer of this group. She cannot imagine her life without dance and fitness. She believes in the saying “Healthy spirit is in a healthy body.” She owns a fitness club, where she teaches ladies of all ages how to stay fit. The idea of opening this club was her husband's. He is also an experienced businessman. While on maternity leave, she wrote a business plan for a fitness club. Fortunately, her funds managed to cover all of the expenses, including attracting customers, advertising, and equipment. The income from the business was used to purchase a small piece of land where Kanyshai would like to build a shop. She requests a loan to purchase equipment for running. It is the only thing she lacks in the fitness club. Her dream in the future is to build a health club for women. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase rhinestones and thread

loans.name: Elia Group

texts.fr: Lwanda M.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Elia, âgée de 39 ans, femme vivant seule, mère de 3 enfants dont  2 étudient et l’autre a volontairement quitté le rang scolaire pour ses raisons personnelles. La  cliente  Lwanda M.  est vendeuse des pagnes (habits dames africaines). Elle expose ses marchandises au marché central de Virunga.il ya 20 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu d’un membre de sa famille. Vers 2009, elle bénéficia de premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima pour  renforcer  son capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises des habits dames (20 pièces de pagnes).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise. Selon elle, le crédit de Hekima lui a servi d’améliorer sa maison  et de vivre dans des conditions de vie digne socialement acceptables. La cliente Lwanda M.  remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Elia est constitué de 29 membres.
texts.en: Lwanda M. is an entrepreneur, the leader of the business group Elia, 39 years old, a single woman, and the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom are in school, while the other voluntarily left the scholarly ranks for personal reasons.  The client Lwanda M. sells African print cloth (for African women's garments).  She displays her merchandise at the central market of Virunga.  She has run this business for 20 years.  She started her business with her own funds, received from a family member.  Around 2009, she received her first loan from the IMF Hekima in order to strengthen her capital.  This new loan will allow her to restock with new merchandise of women's clothing (20 lengths of African print cloth).  Moreover, she aspires to grow her business.  According to her, the Hekima loan will allow her to improve her home and to live in conditions deemed socially acceptable.  The client Lwanda M. thanks the IMF Hekima for its actions dedicated to the poor women excluded from classic banks.  The group Elia is made up of 29 members.

loans.use: to purchase 20 lengths of African print cloth

loans.name: Mercy Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora. Mercy B. es socia del banco comunal Virgen de Bronce, vive por el sector de la Virgen del Bronce en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad está bañada por 4 ríos dándole el nombre de  Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, tiene muchos lugares turísticos y su gente es amable, cordial, muy culta y llena de tradiciones.

La Señora. Mercy tiene 33 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 14, 6 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija en una escuelita de la ciudad. Vive en la casa de su papá que es propia.

Doña Mercy trabaja en la venta de librillo (carne para la preparación de guatita que es un plato típico), trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo.

Está en el banco comunal hace 6 años, tiempo el cual los créditos le han ayudado para crecer poco a poco en su negocio,  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de librillo.

Su meta es  viajar a distintas partes del mundo.

Nuestra socia está en la fotografía con su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Mercy B. is a member of the 'Virgen de Bronce' community bank.  She lives in 'Virgen de Bronce' neighborhood, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is home to 4 rivers and is known as 'Santa Ana of the Four Rivers'.  There are a lot of tourist attractions and the people are kind, polite, very cultured and full of traditions.

Mercy is 33 years old.  She is a single mother and has three children aged 14, 6 and 1.  Her eldest son is in high school and her second child (a girl) attends a local elementary school.  She lives in her dad's home which he owns.

Mercy's business is selling tripe (this is used in preparing 'guatita' - tripe stew - which is a traditional dish).  She works from Monday to Friday but doesn't work regular hours.

Mercy has been a member of her community bank for 6 years.  The loans she has received have helped her to gradually grow her business.  She will invest her new loan in buying 'librillo'.

Mercy's goal is to travel to different parts of the world.  She appears in the photo with her young daughter.

loans.use: to buy tripe

loans.name: Esther Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Esther es socia del banco comunal Jesús De Nazaret del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.
Lleva 10 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de plantones de arboles maderables (maderas), negocio rentable que le representa buenos ingresos porque lo hacen a pedidos y trabajan con instituciones del estado.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 kilo de semilla de capirona, 1 kilo de semilla de marupa, 1 kilo de semilla de caoba, 1 kilo de semilla de cedro, 1 kilo de semilla de bolaina.
Con sus préstamos ha logrado tener una buena cantidad de plantones para que pueda abastecer a sus clientes, como proveedor necesita tener una buena cantidad de plantones como reserva. 
Todavía tiene un hijo que está cursando estudios superiores en una universidad particular, con su trabajo puede pagar ahora la mensualidad de su hijo sin ningún contratiempo. Agradece a Manuela Ramos porque ya tiene 2 hijos profesionales y  solo le falta uno por sacar adelante.
texts.en:
Esther, 53, is a member of the “Jesús de Nazaret” communal bank in Yarinacocha District, Ucayali Department.  She’s married and has four children.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for 10 years.  She sells shoots from hardwood producing trees, a profitable business that represents good income, because they do it based on prior orders and they collaborate with state institutions.  She will use her new, 3000 new sol, loan to buy the following:  1 kilo of capirona tree seeds, 1 kilo of marupa tree seeds, 1 kilo of mahogany seeds, 1 kilo of cedar seeds and one kilo of bolaina tree seeds.

With her loans she’s managed to obtain a good quantity of shoots to supply her customers.  As a supplier, she needs to have a good amount of shoots in reserve stock.

She still has a son who’s studying at a private university.  Her work allows her to pay her son’s monthly tuition problem free.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos because she now has two children who are professionals and she just has one still left to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy seed.

loans.name: Nuon's Group

texts.en:
Eleven people make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Nuon is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members of the group. 

Mrs. Nuon, who was born in 1969, is married to Mr. Oem, who was born in 1970. They have three children; one sells fruit and the other two attend the local school. Mrs. Nuon's husband is a motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to help support the family. 

Mrs. Noun earns a living by selling fruit. Since this business is going well, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to expand her business activities.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to expand her business activities

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase an electric embroidery machine.

loans.name: Apple Grace

texts.en:
Apple Grace is from the village of Barangay 18, Gingoog City. She is 26 years old, married, and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Apple Grace owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling used clothing or ukay-ukay products in the local community.  She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Apple Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

Apple Grace is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to purchase additional stocks of used clothing. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to resell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 34-year-old, married man with three children.

To earn a living, he works in the welding industry. He has been in this line of work for 11 years. He works with seven employees in his business. In addition to his welding work, he farms sugarcane to supplement his income.

Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his finances and to save for his family's future wants and needs. He hopes to build his own business so that he can save on rental fees. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 60,000 KES ($700) to buy a water tank because he would like to start a water sales business.

loans.use: To start a water sales business by purchasing a water tank

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 48 years old and is a married woman with 5 children. The oldest child is 27 years old and the youngest is 17. Vicky has had a sari-sari store for 2 years. She sells items like noodles, detergent soap and purified water. She earns about 2000 PHP per month from the store. Vicky also cooks viands that she sells around the neighborhood during lunch time. 

Vicky requested a loan of 5000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as noodles, shampoo and purified water. Vicky hopes to earn better and be able to expand her store.

loans.use: buy more items to sell

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina tiene  52 años, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos. Juntos viven en su propia casa ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de Llochegua. Agustina, se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, recuerda que en su juventud sufrió mucho debido a la perdida del cultivo de cacao, siendo su única fuente principal de ingresos, y por ende se endeudaron. Hoy Agustina manifiesta que ha trabajado mucho para salir adelante. Es así que el negocio que posee es un bar, en donde le ha generado buenas ganancias económicas y ya lleva casi 7 años trabajando de manera constante. Su estrategia de permanecer en un negocio tan competitivo es que siempre las bebidas que ella vende están al alcance del público en general, además de mantener siempre surtido con diversos productos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete a realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles lo invertirá para comprar muebles y acondicionar su local de ventas.
texts.en:
Agustina is 52 years old.  She is a single mother and has four children.  They live together in their own home which is located in the village of Canayre, in Llochegua district.  Agustina is noted as being a hard-working woman.  She recalls that in her youth she suffered a lot through the loss of her cacao crop as this was her main source of income.  As a result, she got into debt.  Today Agustina tells us that she has worked hard to get ahead in life.  Her business is a bar and it has made her good money.  She has been working in this business constantly for seven years.  Her strategy for remaining in such a competitive business is to ensure that the drinks she sells are always affordable to the general public.  She also always keeps her business stocked with a range of products.

This is Agustina's second loan from MFP and she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  She will invest the 2,000 Peruvian soles in buying furniture and fitting out her premises.
