loans.use: to buy furniture for her sales premises

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Moron Group

texts.es: La Sra. Irene   es divorciada, tiene 1 hijos en edad escolar, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Morón” grupo  conformado por 7 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Irene trabaja desde hace  3 años en la venta de prendas de vestir y venta de regalos   en una tienda, este negocio surge a raíz de su divorcio,  ya que ella tenía que trabajar para mantener a su hijo y es así que empezó vendiendo ropa en la calle, poco a poco se hizo de un capital, puso su tienda de ropa. Irene nos cuenta que todo lo consiguió con mucho trabajo y perseverancia ya que su motivación eran su hijo y sus deseos de superación eran más grandes que sus problemas,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, su hijo va a una escuela privada, y sobre todo ella y su hijo tienen una mejor calidad de vida, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercaderia (polos pantalones camisas etc), Sabemos que Irene  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran
texts.en:
Ms. Irene is divorced, has one school-aged son, and is a member of the "Virgen del Carmen de Morón" communal bank, which has seven members who work in various economic activities. For the last three years, Irene has worked selling clothing and gifts in a store. This business had its roots in her divorce, as she had to work to take care of her son, so she started selling clothing in the street. Little by little, she built up some capital and set up her clothing store. Irene explains that she has gained everything she has through a great deal of work and perseverance, and that her son was her motivation. Her desire to succeed was greater than her problems, and thanks to her efforts and dedication, she achieved greater profits, her son attends a private school, and above all, she and her son have a better quality of life.

With the goal of continuing to grow, Irene is requesting a new loan to buy merchandise (t-shirts, pants, shirts, etc.). EDAPROSPO knows that Irene will achieve her goals through her hard work and effort, and that the loans she receives through EDAPROSPO will help her.

loans.use: Para Comprar Prendas de Vestir

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is a 40-year-old lady, married with five children: two daughters and three sons. Her elder daughter is an embroidery expert while the second one sews clothes. Her three sons are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Robina is also an embroidery expert. She receives a good number of orders from her neighboring clients every month and crafts beautiful designs on cloth to attract more customers. Her husband has three buffaloes and sells their milk to community clients for a profit. 

Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her husband wants to buy another buffalo to expand his milk selling business. This will help him sell a larger quantity of milk every day and earn more income. He has been operating his business for the past 10 years and Robina is confident that an investment will not only help her husband as an asset for his business but also increase his household income that will allow his family to live a better life. 

She is new loan user with Asasah and this is her first application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Robina.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan is 30 years old. She is a married woman. She has four children, three of whom are in school. She has a business selling green vegetables in Kator in South Sudan. She has been running this business for five years. Juan requested this loan from BRAC South Sudan to purchase more green vegetables to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to expand her business and to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.en:
Timotea is married with three children. Timotea is 45 years old and lives in Blancia St. Molave, Zamboanga del Sur.

Timotea is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for almost 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy more pigs.

Timotea has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Timotea hopes to improve her living conditions by buying more pigs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy was born in 1977. She lives with her husband and daughter in Xom Trong village. Her husband is a driver and she has a shop in the market where she sells cosmetics and clothes. Thuy has worked in this job for three years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has been a member of Kiva partner, SEDA, since 2007. For her last loan she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid the loan punctually. For this, her seventh loan, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to invest in her shop by buying more shoes and clothes, with the purpose of having a better life.

loans.use: to invest in her shop by buying more shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Kann

texts.en:
From the Reussey Keo commune, Mr. Kann is a humble man who makes an income by working in a garment factory as a sewing worker. He has worked in this job since 2007 and gets a specific salary every month. His wife also generates a little income from her current occupation as a garment factory worker in the same field. 

On average, the couple can earn an income of about $8 per day. They have two children who still are enrolled in school. As they face a problem with transportation needs, they often hire a motor taxi driver to pick up them when they go to achieve their work task or other traveling needs. The couple mentioned that they really wish to buy a new vehicle, but they do not have enough cash on hand to do so. So Mr. Kann and his wife have requested a loan in the amount of $1,000 from Kiva in order to purchase a new motorbike for driving to their job location. Mr. Kann hopes he will use the increased income to expand his old house to a larger size.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for driving to his job location.

loans.name: Uuganbat

texts.en: Uuganbat is a 29 year old divorced father of two children. He is currently living alone. He is a mechanical engineer and has been driving a taxi for seven years.  Even though he lives alone, he is always looking for an advantage – something to increase his earnings. He wants to save more and start a new life. Over the last few months, he has been looking for another opportunity to earn more, and he has found the idea of selling coal during the winter. To do that, the first thing he needs is a vehicle to deliver the coal. He is requesting a loan to buy a mini truck.

loans.use: To buy a mini truck to deliver coal

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Martina tiene 67 años de edad, está casada con el señor Carmelo con quien tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales ya todos están casados y tiene su propia familia, se dedica  a la venta de abarrotes desde hacen 3 años.
Dice que se animo a iniciar con este negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar, para mejorar su calidad de vida y hacerse de una mejor solvencia económica, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: azúcar, sal, leche, arroz, frijol, agua, refrescos, aceite, jabón, galletas, papel higiénico, etc. para tener un mejor surtido. 
Una de las metas que dice tener para su negocio, es la de invertirle mucho mas, para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que quiere ampliar su tienda, para también empezara ahorrar parte de las obtener más y mejores ganancias, para asegurar su futuro junto al a su esposo.
Doña Martina está muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los donadores de kiva, por todo el apoyo y sobre todo confianza que le están brindando.
texts.en:
Martina, age 67, is married to Carmelo, and they have four children.  All of the children are married and have their own families.

Martina has been selling groceries for three years.  She says that she decided to start this business because she wanted to look for a way to help her husband pay the household expenses, to improve her quality of life, and to improve their financial standing.

She will use the loan she received to buy more merchandise like sugar, salt, milk, rice, beans, water, soft drinks, oil, soap, cookies, and toilet paper, etc.  She will do this to be better stocked.

One of the goals that she says she has for the business is to invest a lot more in it.  She will do this in order to make it grow rapidly.  She wants to expand her store, and she also wants to start saving part of her greater and improved earnings.  She wants to do this in order to assure her future and her husband’s future.

Martina is very grateful to the Fundación Realidad and the Kiva lenders for all of the support.  Above all, she is grateful for the trust they are placing in her.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, milk, rice, beans, water, soft drinks, oil, soap, cookies, and toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 44 years old. He is married and a father of two children. Joseph runs a retail shop, a business that has been in operation for the past year. 

He was recently introduced to KADET LTD,  and this marks his first loan to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, soft drinks, and cereals. 

The anticipated profits will be directed into the repayment of the loan and gradual expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, soft drinks, and cereals

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha tiene ya más siete años dedicándose la elaboración y venta de alimentos. 
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en compra de material para la elaboración de los alimentos y realizar algunas mejorar al local del negocio. 
Con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas planea pagar el crédito, ya que su esposo el señor Javier se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus dos hijos con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una compañía de trasportes. 
Doña Martha desea mejorar los ingresos de su negocio con esta inversión que desea realizar y que además no descapitalizara el negocio.
texts.en:
Martha has already been working for more than seven years in the making and selling of food. She is asking for a loan to buy items to prepare food and to make some improvements to the business location.

With the profits that she makes from the sales she will make her payments as her husband Javier takes care of the family expenses and school fees of the two children with his pay that he receives from his work with a transportation company.

Martha wants to increase profits for her business with this loan and not to use all the cash-on-hand for the business.

loans.use: to buy items to prepare food and to make some improvements to the business location

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 42 years old and married with one child.  She works very hard to provide for her family.

Sandra runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her grocery store.

Sandra has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee and more.

In the future, Sandra would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Manasbek

texts.ru:
Манасбеку  43 года, женат и воспитывает троих детей. 19 лет назад, в в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Манабек начал свой бизнес в торговле продуктами и товарами повседневного спроса, используя при этом сумму в 5,000 сом (KGS). Магазинчик Манасбека известен тем, что при хорошем качестве товара, он реализует продукты по низкой цене, что важно для людей с небольшим достатком.  Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду, Манасбек сумел развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом   около 20,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Манасбек обратился  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Манасбек планирует вложить в  расширение торгового места.
texts.en:
Manasbek is 43 years old, married and has three children. Nineteen years ago in search of a source of income for his family Manasbek started his business selling food and basic goods using the sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Manasbek's store is known for good quality products which are sold at a low price, which is important for people with low incomes. Through persistence and hard work Manasbek was able to develop his business with a monthly income of about 20,000 KGS.

In order to further develop his business Manasbek turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to expand the product range. Manasbek plans to invest the income from loan in the expansion of retail space.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: Roy is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. Roy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Roy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Roy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Katalina

texts.en:
Katalina is 38 years old and is married with 5 children. She owns & operates a business venture, selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.    She needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Katalina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Katalina's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: C 1876 Turwanyubukene Group

texts.en:
Vincent is 33 years old and has three children who ages are between 1 and 7 years old and he takes care of four dependents. He sells local drinks and his business is open from 7am until 6pm every day. He currently employs four people to help him. He is the leader of the group called "C1876 TURWANYUBUKENE" in the local language. In the photo, he is the first person on the left side, second line. Vincent has six years of experience.

Vincent has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks. With any profit, he will save money for his future and pay school fees for all the children that live with him.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 41 years old, married to Ochieng, and they have three children. She has been a tailor for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,700. 

She is requesting for her first loan with KADET of Kes 20,000. She plans to use the loan to buy stocks of clothing materials and sewing accessories. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. 

Her hope is to grow her business and employ one more staff.

loans.use: To buy stocks of clothing materials and  sewing accesories.

loans.name: Estrelieta

texts.en:
Estrelieta is 30 years old, married and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Estrelieta has a personal products retail business in the Philippines. Estrelieta requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more items like perfumes, body lotions, cosmetics and other personal products.

Estrelieta has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Estrelieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like perfumes, body lotions, cosmetics and other personal products.

loans.name: Gladies's Group

texts.en:
Gladies is married and the mother of four children. She is known in her community as a very hardworking individual. She is also the leader of a group of eleven farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. With a loan of 1,010,130 KES this group will receive 7.75 acres of land to be enriched with fertilizer and planted with hybrid maize seed. In addition, one member will be using the loan to buy a solar light.

Gladies joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because she wanted to have access to its quality training and learn new farming methods. Her share of this loan will be 91,830 KES. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to save more money. With the profits from the coming harvest Gladies plans to buy a cow.

loans.use: to obtain hybrid maize seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура трудолюбивая женщина ей 49 лет, она заботливая жена и мать троих детей. Она и её муж занимаются колхозным хозяйством. Они выращивают разные овощи,  продают на рынке и с этим доходом обеспечивают свою семью. Для того чтобы прокормить семью Манзура работает днём и ночью без выходных, из за нехватки денег и плохого питания у её младшей дочки начались проблемы со здоровьем. Поскольку у ребёнка уже начались осложнения ей требуется срочно сделать операцию но в данный момент у них категорически нет денег для оплаты лекарственных препаратов и операцию.   Она с мужем решили взять кредит  чтобы вылечить своего ребёнка. Поэтому Манзура обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой и заранее благодарит за поддержку и понимание!!!
texts.en:
Manzura is a hardworking wowan.  She is 49 years old, a caring wife and the mother of three children.  She and her husband work on a collective farm.  They grow various vegetables, sell them at the market, and support their family with the money that they make.  In order to feed her family, Manzura works day and night without any day off.  

Because of the lack of money and poor nutrition, her youngest daughter has developed health problems.  As things are getting worse, she needs to have surgery as soon as possible but the family has no money at all to pay for medications and surgery.  Manzura and her husband have decided to take a loan to take care of their child's health.  For this reason, she has turned to MDO Arvand to receive some financial support and she thanks you in advance for your support and understanding!!!

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's medical treatment.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Irma. I have a busines that sells ears of corn in heavily-traveled areas of my city. I have been doing this for several years and have been able to help my family develop with the income I earned. In my children\\\'s free time, they collaborate with me to create different things from corn.

Loan Use: Purchase of corn, sugar, firewood, salt, other supplies

Hola Mi nombre es Irma, cuento con un negocio de venta de elotes, ubicado en unos de los lugares mas transitados de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad con la que he sacado adelante a mi familia, en sus tiempo libre mis hijos me colaboran en la elaboracion de los diferentes derivados del maiz.

loans.use: Compra de Elotes, azucar, leña, sal,  otros

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Madam Esther is a 50 year-old woman. She does goat rearing on a large scale. She sells to butchers and individuals. She needs a loan of $975 from Kiva to build a large pen to house her livestock since her goats are producing at a fast rate.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rukia N.

texts.en:
Rukia is a mother of one. She is a trained tailor. She is self-employed, and her business involves dressmaking and selling the clothes to willing customers. She also sometimes sells maize through the local cereal board. She has been in the business for two years. Her tailoring shop is in the trading centre, hence she is able to gain access to customers.

With a loan from PEMCI, Rukia wishes to increase her stock in the cereal business. Through her business, she hopes to start training young girls on design and tailoring.

loans.use: To boost her stock

loans.name: Nubar

texts.en: Nubar is an IDP from the war-torn Gubadli region of Azerbaijan. She lives in a hostel in Sumgayit town, together with her two children. Her husband died. She has had a hard life as an IDP and a widow. She constructed a small shed hear the hostel where she lives, to keep livestock there. She buys sheep and calves from wholesalers who bring them from regions and sell them to butchers or other people. She has borrowed three loans from Normicro Sumgayit branch and has a good repayment history. She needs to buy more adult animals and is now applying for the next loan in the amount of $800.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Esmira

texts.en: Esmira is divorced and lives in the Salyan region in Yenikand village. She does not have children. This 39-year-old woman has her own business. 5 years ago she started a farming business. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Bertha Gloria

texts.es:
Bertha is a self-sacrificing 47 year old mother, who despite having being abandoned by her partner has been able – with effort and love – to move forward and become both father and mother for her fifteen year old son who helps her in the completion of her daily tasks.

She has two businesses, internet kiosks which are administered by her son and which already cover the costs of his studies, and the grocery store which she runs which covers household bills. Thanks to these activities, Bertha has been able to also contribute to the household expenses of her mother-in-law, in which they still live.

Bertha wants to own her own house in order to be able to move her business and administrate it more comfortably, for this she needs work and money, money she doesn’t yet have but she continues hoping that one day she will be able to make her dreams come true with much effort and work, and leave a legacy for her son to inherit.

Daily she demonstrates devotion and dedication in her work with the hope of realising her ambitions. She now needs a loan of $200 dollars with which she will be able to buy the various tools she needs to renovate and install the internet cabins and her small grocery store. Let us help this mother and son who are fighting to have their own roof over their heads and a promising business.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva volunteer

Bertha es una abnegada madre de familia de 47 años, que a pesar de sufrir el abandono de su pareja ha podido a costa de esfuerzo y amor, salir adelante y convertirse en padre y madre para su hijo de 15 años quien le ayuda en el desempeño de las labores diarias.

Posee dos negocios, las cabinas de internet que está administrada por su hijo ya que a través de el puede costear los gastos de sus estudios y la bodega administrada por ella para cubrir los gastos de su hogar; gracias a estas actividades, Bertha ha podido también contribuir con los gastos de la casa de su suegra, en la que se ubican hasta el día de hoy.

Ella desea tener su propia casa para trasladar su negocio y administrarlo más cómodamente, para ello requiere de trabajo y de dinero, dinero con el que hoy no cuenta pero mantiene la esperanza de poder hacer sus sueños realidad y tener un patrimonio que heredar a su hijo con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.

Diariamente muestran entrega y dedicación en su desempeño con la esperanza de realizar sus anhelos, ahora requieren de un préstamo de 200 dólares con los que adquirirán diversas herramientas para acondicionar e implementaran las cabinas de Internet y su pequeña bodega. Apoyemos a esta pareja de madre e hijo que lucha por tener un techo propio y un negocio prometedor.

loans.use: Renovation and installation of internet cabins and a small grocery store

loans.name: Nydia

texts.es:
Nydia is 64 years old, is married and has 4 children. She is the owner of a well-stocked grocery store and she has had it for the past 8 years. In addition, she is a retired teacher (she retired 10 years ago).

Nydia would like to use her loan to purchase products in bulk such as sugar, spices, beef, chicken, oil, pasta, rice, beer, soda, and other daily food products. Buying in bulk allows her to keep her store well-stocked, since her turn-over each week is quite high and in the warm season cook drinks are in especially high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nydia tiene 64 años está casada y tiene 4 hijos, ella es propietaria de una despensa muy bien surtida y lo tiene hace más de 8 años, además es jubilada docente desde hace 10 años.

El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de productos en gran cantidad como ser, azúcar, yerba, carne vacuna, pollo, aceite, fideo, arroz, cerveza, gaseosas, entre otros productos de consumo diario ya que la compra al por mayor permite que su negocio se mantenga bien surtido, ya que sus movimientos de ventas cada fin de semana es bastante alto y en temporadas de mucho calor sus productos de mayor rotación son las bebidas heladas.

loans.use: For the purchase of meat, oil, sugar, beer, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor Miguel Alfonzo is single. He has a daughter who lives with him and is in school in the city. He is a hard working and beloved in his neighborhood.

He has a general store in his home, with a well-established clientele, which generates a good income. He has good commercial and personal references.

His goal is to expand his merchandise stock in the area of school supplies, because there are many students in his area and a demand for such products.

The loan will be used to buy school supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Néstor Miguel Alfonzo es soltero, tiene una hija que vive con él y estudia en un Colegio de la ciudad. Es una persona muy trabajadora y querida en su barrio.

Tiene una Salón Comercial en su domicilio, con una buena clientela formada que le genera buenos ingresos. Posee buenas referencias comerciales y personales.

Su meta es ampliar su stock de mercaderías en el rubro de librería, ya que en la zona hay muchos estudiantes y hace falta.

El crédito será destinado a la compra de artículos de librería.

loans.use: Buying school supplies such as notebooks, books, pencils, erasers, rulers, etc, (compra de artículos de librería como cuadernos, libros, lápices, borradores, reglas, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Justina

texts.es:
Nacatamal is Nicaragua's traditional dish. Making it requires dough, rice, potato, onion, "chiltoma" (a local pepper), meat, tomato, and spices. For 10 years, in the city of Chinandega, Maria Justina has made a living making and selling delicious nacatamales, working at home Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays to make them.

It's difficult for Maria Justina, a woman of few resources, to buy the ingredients she needs to make her nacatamales. Consequently, she's come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy the ingredients she needs to make them. It's important to note that she has an established record of borrowing from Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El nacatamal es la comida típica de Nicaragua, este alimento se elabora a base de masa, arroz, papa, cebolla, chiltoma, carne, tomate y hierba buena. En la ciudad de Chinandega, desde hace 10 años la señora Maria Justina se dedica a la elaboración y venta de los deliciosos nacatamales el cual los elabora los días viernes, sábado y domingo en su casa de habitación.

La necesidad que atraviesa la señora Maria Justina es que por ser de bajos recursos económicos, le es difícil adquirir la materia prima para elaborar los nacatamales, es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel para ser apoyada con un crédito para la compra de estos ingredientes para los nacatamales. Es importante señalar que hasta este momento ha realizado un total de 12 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for food business.

loans.name: Happines's Malapa Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Happines E. is 32 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 13 and 10. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 50 and 60. Happines owns a food store where she works everyday from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. and from which she can earn a monthly profit of about $60.

She now hopes for a loan of $275 to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member who has a business selling cloth.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Sampan I Village Bank Group

texts.en: The Sampan I Village Bank consists of 29 people who live along the Basac River. Most of them are farmers, and Mrs. Kimly N., Village Bank President, dedicates herself as a subsistence farmer I. the local village. Mrs. N., 43 years old, is a childless widow who can generate an income of about $1.50 per day through her bean crop.  She and her group are now requesting a loan to purchase more bean seeds with which to cultivate their land.

loans.use: To purchase more bean seeds to cultivate their land.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah A. is fifty years old, married and the mother of three children. She operates a small grocery shop and sells items like bread, pastries, assorted biscuits and drinks. She is very resourceful and supportive of her family’s basic needs. She finances the education of her three children in junior and senior high schools. Hannah believes she can double her sales and income with larger capital. She wants to use the loan to buy additional groceries items to increase her stock. She belongs to the community group called Adoration Trust Group. Members guarantee themselves as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of assorted biscuits and canned soft drinks

loans.name: Perfecto

texts.es:
The primary economy of Paraguya relies on beef cattle an on agriculture. With this in mind, Perfecto P. purchases livestock. In current day he has 20 milk cows, 14 calves, and 4 horses. Perfecto sells the milk and he starts his days in the early hours of the morning to care for his cows and to later distribute and make his sales with a small cart.

Perfecto cares for his animals as if they were his daughters, each one even has a name. Perfecto cares for them with a great leave of love and they always obey him.

In future Perfecto wishes to purchase a car to facilitate the distribution of his milk products.

The funds of the credit requested will be invested in milk processing machines to prepare for sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Las principales actividades económicas del Paraguay son la ganadería y la agricultura. Teniendo en cuenta esto, Perfecto P. compro animales; actualmente cuenta con 20 vacas lecheras, 14 vaquillas y 4 caballos. Perfecto vende leche y se levanta tempranas horas de la madrugada para ordenar las vacas y así después procesarlas para luego distribuirlas y venderlas en su carrito.

Perfecto cuida a sus vacas como si fueron sus hijas, inclusive cada una de ellas tiene nombre, y Perfecto las trata con mucho cariño, es por eso que ellas siempre lo obedecen. En un futuro Perfecto desea comprar un automóvil que le facilite la distribución de la leche.

El dinero del crédito solicitado será invertido en maquinas para el procesamiento de la leche para su venta.

loans.use: To purchase a milk processing machine.

loans.name: Yesenia Yulisa

texts.es:
Yesenia is a member of the "Flor Del Cafe" community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "region" of San Martin and earns a living making and selling cakes for events such as weddings, "quinceanos" (a traditional celebration for girls at their 15-year birthday), birthday parties, etc. She also makes and sells "biscochuelos" (a traditional bun maD. with sugar and spices). When Yesenia first started her business, she was a little unsure of herself because she didn't know much about the bakery business. She feared that she would lose her investment if she couldn't sell her products quickly, because they would spoil, but she soon perfected her technique and learned what her customers wanted, and her business has grown bit by bit.

With the S/.1200 (1200 Peruvian soles) loan, to be repaid in 6 months, Yesenia will buy the ingredients that she needs to make her cakes--sugar, flour, eggs, butter, milk and coloring for decorating the cakes, along with ingredients and supplies for making biscochuelos.

Yesenia, 33, has 2 children. She's a woman with a vision of the future and the confidence to overcome any obstacle to her plans to have a pastry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Yesenia Maldonado es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor Del Café” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia D. Moyabamba y distrito D. Soritor, se dedica a la preparación y venta D. diferentes tipos y variedades D. tortas, para diferentes ocasiones como matrimonios, quinceaños, cumpleaños, etc., así como también D. biscochuelos. Aun inicio del negocio ella, sentía un poco D. inseguridad por la falta D. experiencia y conocimiento en dicho negocio, sobre todo por el temor a perder su capital al no vender lo preparado ya que este producto es D. rápido consumo, pero con el transcurrir D. los días perfeccionando su técnica y conociendo a sus clientes, que poco a poco fue aumentando,

Con el crédito D. S/. 1,200.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará los ingredientes que necesita para la preparación D. sus tortas como: azúcar en sacos, harina preparada en paquetes, huevos en jabas, mantequilla en paquetes, leches en cajas y colorantes para el decorado D. las tortas, y demás ingredientes y accesorios para la preparación D. biscochuelos.

Ella tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, es una mujer con mucha visión D. futuro, y segura D. si misma que pueD. vencer cualquier obstáculo, por lo que piensa tener su pastelería.

loans.use: Buy supplies for bakery business.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is 24 years old. She is a single woman. She became a clothes seller in 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Aziza now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Red Cross Makeni Group

texts.en:
These are staff of the Sierra Leone Red Cross Makeni. Makeni is the Northern Province headquarters town, about 185 miles from Freetown. They give vaccines to the people of Makeni against several diseases. They vaccinate against measles for the under-fives, against polio, and against tetanus. They also help in the child delivery process, and in many community development projects.

Notwithstanding all that, this is a volunteer job. They offer all of these services to the people of Makeni without receiving salaries for their services. To make ends meet, however, all of them but two also work at in small-scale businesses (the two who don't plan to use their loans to pay school fees for their children).

Thus they came to SMT for the first time to seek loans to enable them to expand their businesses. Their names are: Annie T., Kaifala M., Matha R. K., Mohamed L. B., Mabel H. D., Zainab T. K., Amie C. Kabia, Richmond T., Fatmata K. and Mohammed B. T..

Annie K. T. is the leader of this group. Annie was born in Fadugu, a village very close to Kabala, Koinadugu District, Northern Sierra Leone. Annie is 46, and her husband works for a local NGO. They have 4 children. Annie now resides with her family in Makeni where she works for the Red Cross and at the same time is in business. Annie will use part of her loan to improve her son's "video-centre" (a cinema, using 4×6 size televisions) and with the balance she will buy an "Okada" (motor-bike used as a taxi).

loans.use: Buy a motor-bike

loans.name: Paulette Lucie

texts.fr: Paulette Lucie S., 48 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois des Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle vend des glaces et des crèmes glacées et élève aussi des porcs en guise d’activité secondaire. Paulette veut acheter du pain de singe et du sucre pour faire des crèmes glacées à vendre et du son de mil pour engraisser des porcs à revendre. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Paulette Lucie S. is 48 years old, married and responsible for 5 children. She has been a village board member of the Catholic Women of Velingara for four and a half years. She sells ice and ice cream and also raises pigs as a secondary business activity. Paulette would like to buy baobab fruit and sugar to make ice cream for sale and millet to fatten her pigs for resale. The profits pulled from this business will permit her to contribute to the family expenses. She is requesting a loan which will be repaid at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of ice cream and raising pigs

loans.name: Juana Feliciana

texts.es:
La venta de ropa es el negocio al cual la señora Juana Feliciana se dedica con el objetivo de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. Todos los días desde que comienza el día ella se prepara para ofrecer la ropa en sui casa de habitación y en ocasiones ella la vende ofreciéndolas en otros lugares donde cree que pueden ser compradas.

Debido a su ardua labor ha logrado mantener su hogar en buenas condiciones y según comenta esto se lo debe a Ceprodel por haberle brindado créditos los cuales los ha utilizado directamente en el negocio. Por esto es que una vez más acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y así mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Señora Juana Feliciana’s job is selling clothes in order to provide for her family. Every day from early in the morning she sells clothes from her home and occasionally takes the clothing around to other places where she believes she will make a sale. Because of her hard work, she has managed to keep her home in good condition. She says that she owes Ceprodel a lot for having given her loans that she has used directly in the business. For this reason she is once again approaching Ceprodel for a loan so that she can improve her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Basangul

texts.en:
K. Basangul works hard daily to increase the family income so that her children can have a good life. Thanks to her industrious nature, she was able to purchase a small plot of land for her and her husband to farm.  However, the yield has decreased and family expenses are using up the little capital they have. Basangul and her husband have decided to plant onions and potatoes, as these crop are sought throughout the year. 

Basangul is requesting a loan of 1400 Somoni (425 USD), with the hope that she will get through these hard times.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Janeth tiene 21 años, está conviviendo con su pareja y tiene un hijo. Siempre a sido muy optimista y esforzada en su trabajo, gracias a ello pudo abrir  una pequeña bodega desde hace 2 años, pero el local es alquilado y ella ansía llegar a tener un local propio, pero sabe que trabajando arduamente, como hasta hoy y disfrutando de vender sus productos, conseguirá crecer, la ventaja es que tiene clientes muy fieles que visitan diariamente su bodega. Pero a veces no se da abasto para atender a todos, por ello tiene que ser muy rápida y amable para no perder clientes, siendo estresante algunas horas del día. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos para su bodega, sobre todo en aumentar la venta de bebidas.
texts.en:
Janeth is 21 years old and lives with her husband and child. She has always been optimistic and hardworking, which allowed her to open a small grocery store two years ago. Her current space is rented, but she hopes to own one eventually. She knows that working hard and enjoying each day selling her products as she has until now, her business will continue to grow--her advantage is having very loyal customers who visit her shop every day. But sometimes assisting everyone is not enough--she has to be quick and friendly in order to not lose customers, which makes for some stressful times throughout the day. This is her first loan from MFP. With this money she will buy a greater quantity of products for her store, increasing beverage sales above all.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products for sale

loans.name: Cheom

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheom B. is a villager in Tuol Vihear village in Kampong Speu province. She and her husband, Mr. Ve Soy, are rice farmers who make a little revenue to support the family. Mrs. Cheom B. is 36 years old and the mother of six children; one is employed in a garment factory, four other children are attending the local school, and the youngest one is just 4 years old.

In addition to the rice plantation, they sell palm sugar in the local village. This business is going well, so they want to expand it. Mrs. Cheom B. is requesting a loan to buy palm sugar to resell.

loans.use: Buy palm sugar to resell.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sorn N., 44, lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She is a mother of six children, two of whom are construction workers while the others are attending the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Heng Hoeng, cultivate rice on a plot of land they own. They are facing some difficulties in their farm because they do not have enough farmhand and inputs to cultivate rice during the dry season. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sorn N. is asking for a loan enable them  to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field, buy fertilizer and pesticides to make the farm more productive. Her husband is with her in the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field and buy fertilizer and  pesticides to increase productivity of the farm.

loans.name: Zenabou

texts.fr:
Cette dame habite le quartier d’agoè démakpoé, elle a pour activité la vente de produits d’alimentation générale et de quelques produits cosmétiques, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1995 e s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé , elle fait son commerce dans sa boutique q’elle appelle ETS MOLA, elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de wages, elle sollicite son premier crédit afin de s’acheter 20 bidons d’huile et 08 sacs de riz. 
Elle est mariée et a trois enfants qui sont à leurs charges.
texts.en:
This is a lady who live in the Agoè Démakpoé district. Her work involves selling groceries and a few cosmetic products. She has been in this business since 1995 and acquires her supplies at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She does commerce at her shop she calls "ETS MOLA". She has never been the recipient of a loan from WAGES and is requesting her first one in order to buy 20 drums of cooking oil and 8 sacks of rice. She is married and has three children, who they support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
CLARA RAMÍREZ D. CÁRDENAS, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza” su casa se ubica en el Jr. 15 D. Julio N° 340 del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 48 años, 02 hijos, su esposo es contador público en esta ciudad.
Ella trabaja en el rubro D. confección con el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles,  compró telas, hilos y otros, para un contrato D. vestidos que tubo.
Con el préstamo que D. S/. 1,500. Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en compra, al por mayor D. telas, hilos, blondas, botones, cierres y otros para los vestidos que ella misma diseña, al gusto del cliente, su negocio ha crecido y tiene 2 ayudantes, D. ese modo está creando nuevos puestos D. trabajo, para sus vecinas y amigas que necesitan una labor.
Está muy contenta con Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que le brinda, no le exigen demasiados requisitos y el préstamo es rápido, hasta el momento le está yendo muy bien.
texts.en:
CLARA RAMÍREZ D. CÁRDENAS, 48, is a member of the communal bank “La Fortaleza” ("The Fortress"). She lives in the district of Calleria with her husband, who is an accountant. They have two children. Clara is a seamstress. The first loan that Clara received (300 soles) was used to purchase fabric, thread and other supplies to fulfill a contract to make dresses. Clara is now requesting a loan of 1,500 soles, which will be invested in purchasing wholesale fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and other supplies for the custom-maD. dresses her clients request. Her business has grown so much that Clara has hired two assistants. She is already creating jobs for her friends and neighbors who need one. Clara is very happy about with the support that Kiva partner Manuela Ramos provides: the requirements are not overbearing, and loans come through quickly. Everything is going well at the moment.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wholesale fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik que significa Nosotros en quechua.
Elena es soltera, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Elena tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende menajes, utensilios de cocina, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Elena necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas, platos.
Los sueños de Elena son mejorar su negocio y tener un puesto propio.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the communal bank Kuskanchik, which means "Us" in Quechua. She is single, is 34, and has two children. She has a stand in the Nery García market where she sells household items and kitchen utensils. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. Elena needs a loan of 900 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of pots and plates. Elena's dream is to improve her business and to have her own stand.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pots and plates

loans.name: Logotaeao

texts.en: Logotaeao B., 20, is married with 1 child.  She has 1 year(s) of experience in the Canteen business. She sells to the School 5 days per week. She has no previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Logotaeao’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase gas stove,sack of flour, sack of sugar, box of mutton flaps

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Para Rosa, es indispensable es el bienestar de sus seres queridos, por ello, en su casa tratan de estar unidos siempre y apoyarse entre ellos, ejemplo que les quiere dejar a sus dos hijos para cuando conformen su propio hogar. Desde muy jovencita le gustó estar bien arreglada y maquillada, y debido a que invertir en la compra de cosméticos es costoso, tomó la decisión de formar parte de las promotoras de belleza de su localidad.  Y desde hace 7 años ha ganado experiencia en realizar esta actividad, ya que para Rosa, el secreto es visitar a varias personas y salir diariamente a ofrecerles productos novedosos a través de catálogos y distribuirlos en las fechas indicadas para tener contenta a su clientela. Ahora tiene la ambición de ser empresaria, pues en las líneas de belleza motivan a las mujeres a no ser sólo promotoras, sino a buscar un equipo a las cuales puedas liderar y capacitar en las ventas, pero sin descuidar sus propios pedidos, por lo que le gustaría tener una tienda para la venta de estos productos. Rosa viene trabajando con MFP, desde hace 6 años, este es su catorceavo crédito, y durante esta temporada ha visto progresar a su grupo, pues tratan de organizarse adecuadamente para evitar circunstancias difíciles. Los 1500 soles que solicita los usará en la compra de productos para las fechas festivas que se aproximan, como el día de las madres.
texts.en:
For Rosa, the well-being of her loved ones is the most important thing, and so in her home they try to always remain supportive of one another. This is an example she wants to leave her children for when they form their own homes. Ever since she was a young girl, she has liked to care for her appearance and use makeup, and due to the high cost of buying cosmetics, she decided to become a cosmetics salesperson in her area. For the past 7 years she has gained experience in this activity. Rosa's secret is to visit many people and go out every day to offer them the newest products by means of catalogs, and then deliver the products by the deadline in order to keep her clients happy. Now she has the ambition to be a business woman, since the beauty products business encourages the women to not only be product promoters, but to look for a team they can lead and equip in sales, but without neglecting their own customers' orders. For this reason she would like to have a store to sell these products. Rosa has been working with MFP for 6 years, this is her fourteenth loan, and during this period she has seen her group progress, since they try to organize themselves in order to avoid difficult circumstances. She will use the 1,500 soles she is requesting to buy products for the approaching holidays, like Mothers' Day.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Nicolaza

texts.es:
Nicolaza es socia D. Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Flor Bella.
Nicolaza es viuda, tiene 78 años y 10 hijos, Nicolaza tiene un taller textil de bordados y tejidos, para lo cual tiene 10 bordadoras, sus productos los comercializa de acuerdo a pedidos y en el puesto de su hija en el mercado Artesanal, también  sus productos los envía a las ciudades de Cuzco y Lima.
Nicolaza necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lanas.
Los sueños de Nicolaza son continuar ayudando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nicolaza is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Communal Bank, which means “Beautiful Flower.” She is a widow, 78 years old, and has 10 children. Nicolaza has a textile workshop where embroidery and weavings are made. She has 10 embroiderers and sells her products by order and at her daughter’s stall in the Artesanal Market. She also sends her products to the cities of Cuzco and Lima. Nicolaza needs a loan of 2,000 soles, money that will be used to buy wool. Nicolaza dreams of continuing to help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, el señor Juan M. se dedica a la actividad de la crianza de cerdos los cuales tiene en su corral y cuando crecen los comercializa con el propósito de generar ingresos.

Hoy en día, el señor Juan requiere del capital financiero para invertir en la crianza de los cerdos como lo es en la compra de alimentos para engorde y cuido de los animales. Por este motivo espera muy confiadamente en Ceprodel para obtener dicho crédito y de esta forma salir adelante en su actividad ganadera.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the city of León, Mr. Juan M. works raising pigs in his corral. When they reach the right size he sells them to earn money. Nowadays, Juan needs finance capital to invest in the pig raising business by buying feed for the animals to fatten and take care of them. For this he trusts in Ceprodel to obtain the loan and to thus be able to get ahead in his livestock business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in pig raising business

loans.name: Akua Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jaqueline G. lives in Cotonou, the largest city in Benin. She is married and the mother of one child, a three-year-old boy. Her husband, David Sossou, is a transit officer in Cotonou.

Jacqueline owns a shop in the Vodje neighborhood of Cotonou, where she sells school supplies. She recently opened her own store after working for several years at another store. She is seeking a loan from Alidé to buy more goods. In the future, Jacqueline hopes to start selling various goods besides school supplies in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase more school supplies for her store

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo quien trabaja como mecánico en una empresa maderera, con su hijo de 22 años que es soltero y trabaja, y con su hija menor de 14 años que está estudiando todavía. Ella mandó a construir un pozo en el terreno frente a su casa para contar con agua potable y de donde brinda el servicio de agua por medio de una red tubular a más de 30 familias de su localidad. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 7 años atrás y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta es que no tiene que hacer esfuerzo alguno y solo debe velara por el mantenimiento del pozo. Sus ingresos son mensuales, por cada familia. Posteriormente, Julia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes porque en su zona no cuentan con una. Este es su crédito número 7 con MFP y le gusta trabajar con banco comunal porque no tienen problemas y todos se apoyan ante cualquier problema. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más tubos para abastecer de agua a más familias, lo que le costará 1500 soles, con lo restante adquirirá materiales de construcción para reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Julia is 46 years old. She lives with her husband, who works as a mechanic in a lumber business, her 22-year-old son who is single and employed, and her 14-year-old daughter, who is still in school. Julia constructed a well in the area in front of her house in order to obtain potable water. The well functions as a water main and provides service to over 30 local families. One thing she likes about her work is that she doesn't have to exert herself physically; she only needs to oversee the well's maintenance. She is paid monthly per family, and this business has gone well for the past seven years. In the future, Julia hopes to run a grocery store since her area doesn't have one. This is Julia's seventh loan with MFP and she enjoys working with her loan group since they don't have problems with each other and support each other whenever problems do arise. With this loan Julia will buy 1500 soles' worth of tubes to supply more families with water. With the rest she will obtain construction materials to repair her home.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tubes for her well

loans.name: Gladis Maria

texts.en:
Gladis has a business selling shoes, clothing, and bedsheets. She is 49 years old and is married with two adult children. Her husband works in a store that sells home goods.

Gladis has been investing in shoes since she first began working with Kiva's partner Manuela Ramos six years ago. She has since expanded her business and now sometimes sells clothing and bedsheets as well. Gladis will use this loan of 2000 soles to invest entirely in shoes. Her customers have already placed orders.

Gladis is a member of the communal bank "Las Colinas" (The Hills). Gladis's goal is to some day have her own store where she can sell shoes and purses. She would also like to have a small grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Elueteria

texts.en:
Elueteria Y. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao Mis. Occ.. She is 55 years old. Elueteria is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elueteria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Elueteria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Elueteria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elueteria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900.00 PHP from PMPC. Elueteria is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Elueteria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn C. is a 41-year-old seamstress from Caloocan City. Her husband, Ernesto, 43, is an electrician. They have two daughters, both enrolled in college. Evelyn has been making school uniforms and other clothes in the comfort of her home for the last ten years. Most of her clients are parents asking her to make school uniforms for their children. She earns at least P8,000 a month. Demand is high during the opening of the school year and dwindles in the ensuing months. Evelyn became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006. She has just finished repaying her previous loan with the cooperative and has applied for a new loan of P16,000 to buy materials for making school uniforms (fabric, thread and other supplies). Evelyn works hard to support her husband in their desire to handle their daughters’ college education. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making school uniforms

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis A. C. tiene la actividad económica de elaboración de fotografía. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este trabajo. José Luis comenzó con este negocio con muy poco capital porque tenía que comprar cámaras de video cámara de fotografía por lo que tenía que tener la mejor tecnología y así ofrecerles a sus clientes productos de buena calidad, el disfruta mucho de su trabajo ya que en lo cumpleaños, bodas, quince años,  bautizos y otros eventos el elabora sus propias tarjetas de presentación y las distribuye a los invitados y es así que ha logrado obtener sus clientes. A pesar de tener las dificultades que ha enfrentado ha sido un fotógrafo reconocido. El financiamiento que ha solicitado es para capital de trabajo para la compra hardware, sistema de impresión, revelado y ciertos materiales para ofrecer una muy buena calidad de fotografías. Su deseo es de mejorar cada día en este trabajo.
texts.en:
José Luis A. C. has been involved in photography for over 20 years. He started his business with very little capital. He purchased video cameras so that he could have the best technology and offer his customers with high quality products. José Luis greatly enjoys what he does and has already performed work for birthdays, wedding, quinceaños (girl’s 15th birthday celebrations), baptisms, and other events. He also makes his own business cards that he distributes to guests at these events so that he can secure more customers.

Despite the difficulties he has faced, José Luis has established a reputation as a recognized photographer. The loan he requested will be used as operating capital to buy hardware, a printer, film developing supplies, and other materials that will help him produce good quality photographs. He hopes to improve each day at his job.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase equipment & supplies

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón Pampuyo” ubicado en el centro poblado de Corazón Pampuyo del distrito Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno; tiene 49 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos, vive en Ticaraya, ella estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 7 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de productos de la región.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar papas, chuño, ocas, habas, quinua, etc. De acuerdo a la temporada, luego los comercializa en las ferias semanales.

Su mayor deseo es agrandar su capital.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y los ahorros

loans.use: Para la compra de papas, chuño, ocas, habas, quinua, etc

loans.name: Evelyntina

texts.en:
Evelyntina O. lives in the village of Brgy. Pandan, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She is 66 years old, but still very determined to improve her business even though she now is a widow. She has five children who help her in running the business. Most of her children have their own family, yet still help her. Her dream is to continue her business to become more progressive and continue to borrow from NWTF-Project Dungganon.

In business for over 46 years, Evelyntina proves her skills in business management because she has remained engaged in business for such a long time. She is very thankful for her business because it contributes a lot in fulfilling her dreams in life. While in business, one may encounter problems, but these also were overcome and as a result helped to make Evelyntina strong. In 2001, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon for the purpose of expanding her business and to have access to capital. She expanded her business by adding a pig fattening business as an additional source of income. In every month she was able to earn Php 8,000. This amount was used to defray household expenses, and build savings. She maintains her good credit performance because of the continuing income of her business.

Previously she borrowed Php 19,500 for her general store and pig fattening. The said loan was fully paid on time. Now she is borrowing the same amount of Php 19,500 as additional capital for her 18th loan cycle. The income from this loan will be used for the expansion of her business and support the daily family expenses.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Kunthy

texts.en: Mrs. Kunthy S. lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ban Popheap, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Kunthy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers and pesticides, and she will use the rest of the money to buy a irrigation machine to water the field. Mrs. Kunthy S. is a mother of a child who is too young to work or study because this child is only two years old.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers, pesticides, and a watering machine.

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.fr: H. Rafiatou est née en 1964 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rafiatou vit depuis une quinzaine d'année à Djèrègbé sur la route de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à VODOUNON Jean, un mécanicien, Rafiatou est mère de quatre enfants. Certains de ses enfants sont scolarisés. Rafiatou vit ensemble avec som mari et ses enfants à Djèrègbé. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Rafiatou n'a pas été à l'école. Rafiatou vend des tomates fraîches et des noix de palme à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est à Adja au Mono, que Rafiatou s'approvisonne. Rafiatou mène cette activité depuis cinq ans environs, et est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. En effet, Rafiatou a obtenu antérieurement deux crédits à ALIDé, et qui ont été bien remboursés. C'est pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et mieux satisfaire ses clients, à travers ses produits, que Rafiatou sollicite ce troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Rafiatou H. was born in 1964 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Rafiatou has lived for fifteen years in Djèrègbé, on the road to Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Married to Jean Vodounon, a mechanic, Rafiatou is the mother of four children. Some of these children are in school. Rafiatou lives together with her husband and children in Djèrègbé. The couple provide for the family together. Rafiatou did not go to school. Rafiatou sells fresh tomatoes and palm nuts at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. It is in Adja, Mono, that Rafiatou obtains her supplies. Rafiatou has run this business for about five years, and is on her third loan through ALIDÉ (one of KIva's field partners). Indeed, Rafiatou has obtained two previous loans through ALIDÉ, which were repaid properly. It is to increase her working capital and better satisfy her customers through her goods that Rafiatou is seeking this third loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets of tomatoes and palm nuts

loans.name: Teav

texts.en:
Teav M. is a 41-year-old married woman with four children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children.

To make a living, she sells vegetables at a local market. By doing so, she is able to earn an income of approximately $1.50 per day. Her husband, meanwhile, is motorbike repairman, and he earns approximately $5 per day. These sources of incomes help to pay for the family's living expenses. M. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living by generating additional income. Therefore, M. is asking for a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase a machine to start a new business: specifically, she would like to charge batteries for the people in her village. This would be her third loan through CREDIT MFI, Kiva's partner.

loans.use: To embark on a new business venture by purchasing a battery recharging machine

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer M. is a businesswoman from the Municipality of Molave Zamboanga Del Sur. When she started her food processing business, she began with limited capital. She joined Paglaum MPC to gain access to financial assistance to help improve her living situation and business situation. Her previous loan of 5,000 was used to expand her business. After having successfully repaid her previous loan, Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 7,000.00 to further expand her business. She plans to use the additional capital to improve her business and family living situation.

loans.use: Additional capital for food processing business

loans.name: Bugoba Group, Mukono

texts.en: K. Justine is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 26 years old and married with one child aged 3 years. She has a bar business in Seeta that she has been running for some time now and she is grateful that with the help of loans. K. Justine is now able to make 140,000 as weekly profits which was not the case before the loans. Justine sells beer, sodas, wines and other brews and she hopes to expand her business further to be able to make more profits. Justine needs a loan to be able to restock her bar with more crates of beer, soda, mineral water and wines.

loans.use: Buying more crates of wines, beer and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy artificial hair in bulk

loans.name: Jaudin

texts.es:
Jaudin P. F., tiene la edad de 22 años, está soltero, y vive con sus padres, dos hermanas  y una sobrina. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante, para darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café, y así lograr una mejor calidad y obtener un mayor ingreso cuando sea tiempo de la cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Jaudin tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jaudin P. F. is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents, two sisters, and a niece. The loan he is requesting will be used to tend to his farm, specifically growing coffee. His plan is to buy compost and fertilizers so that he can adequately maintain his coffee crop, thereby achieving a better quality harvest and more income when he sells at market.

This is the first time he has received a loan from FUDECOSUR and is very happy with the services that have been provided to him. Don Jaudin has a few years of experience working in agriculture. He hopes to provide for his family’s future by giving them a better quality of life and financial stability. In addition, he wants to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Mrs. S. owns and operates a small furniture business in her village, selling items such as plastic chairs, tables, and housing accessories. She has a life partner in her husband who is a temporary construction laborer. The couple helps each other in order to feed their three children, who are students in the local public school. S. will be using her loan to accumulate a larger inventory of furniture. Some of the loan will be used to buy tools to squeeze sugar cane, to earn some extra profit.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger inventory of furniture

loans.name: Ablan Marie

texts.fr:
Cette dame  est âgée de 53 ans, elle a commencé en 2006 le commerce en détail de pagnes, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de détail de poissons fumés. Le stock de marchandises dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante raison pour laquelle elle s’adresse à WAGES pour solliciter un premier crédit afin d’acheter une vingtaine de pagnes et une dizaine de paniers de poissons.
Elle est mariée et mère de 04, enfants, avec le revenu de son commerce elle contribue aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
This lady is 53 years old. In 2006 she started a retail business selling pagnes, to which she added the retail selling of smoked fish. The stock of merchandise currently available does not allow her to satisfy the increasing number of customers. For this reason she approached WAGES to request a first credit loan to buy 20 pagnes and ten baskets of fish. She is married, mother of four children, and with her earnings helps to manage family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pagnes and smoked fish

loans.name: Tovuz

texts.en:
Tovuz S. was born in 1960. She is married and has four children but her husband is dead.

Tovuz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, now settled in Absheron region. She has been in her business for six years.

Now Tovuz S. needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more clothes to sell to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Salaton Ole

texts.en:
Salaton Ole K. is a 30-year-old gentleman. He is married to Ann K. and he is a father of two school-going children. 

Salaton is a farmer who has been farming on his own piece of land for the last seven years.
  
He learned about KADET, a Kiva partner, from a colleague who was already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan. He is planning to plant 20 acres of wheat, which has proved to be doing very well in this area, and keep some sheep for fattening to sell at a later date. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his wheat production and sheep rearing.

He hopes to become a large-scale farmer in both wheat production and sheep rearing.

loans.use: To prepare farm for wheat planting and to buy sheep for fattening

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul has been a farmer for five years. He is 49 years old, married to Joyce Wachuka, and they have four children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 3rd loan. He repaid the previous two loans successfully and on time. He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer and cultivate his land for planting. Paul hopes to become a large-scale vegetable grower and be able to supply his produce to big companies and supermarkets in bulk.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and cultivate his land for planting

loans.name: Erma

texts.en: Erma D. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 52 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Erma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Erma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Erma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Betteh Dae Group

texts.en:
Fatmata C. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Waterloo small-town about 40 years ago. She is married to a driver and the couple has two children, one in Senior Secondary School VI (SSS VI) and the other in SSS IV.

For eight years now, Fatmata C. has been selling clothes. With the help of this loan, she will be able to expand her business and make more sales, consequently improving on her living conditions. She will use her loan of SLL 1,000,000 to further expand her business; she will buy clothes wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: To buy more clothes wholesale to add to her inventory

loans.name: Iganga Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
K. Aisha was a dedicated fruit seller before she had a change of mind seven years ago and ventured into what she rationalized would be a more lucrative poultry business.

Like many of her contemporaries, this 40-year-old found the prospect of bearing a hand in any business a fascinating experience. Most of her close acquaintances had entrepreneurial skills and were doing well in business.

As of now, Aisha is eager to cast her mind to the future, knowing how she has strived and gone out of her depth to establish a niche for herself in the local market in Kirinya, Mukono. She attributes her business longevity and all she has achieved to her sense of hard work and determination.

Aisha’s family have also, in the course of the last six years, basked in the glow of any improvement in her circumstances. This happily married mother has laid great store on the education of her children with earnings from her business. In a week, she is able to make ends meet on profits that add up to 200,000 shillings.

Aisha’s future plans are to expand her business even further with this loan. She primarily wants to buy more chickens that she says she will resell in the course of her transactions.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken that she will later resell

loans.name: La Caridad 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Felicia is the coordinator of her group La Caridad 3, 4 & 2 (The Charity). She makes her home here in a simple structure, being a single mom with one child. She says that her most difficult challenges are to have a successful business in her local village and expand it to other villages in her city, where demands are higher.

Felicia is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business where she sells silver jewelry, other accessories and womens shoes. She will use the profits to buy some school supplies, to eat better and expand her business to other communities in other products. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying cooking for her family and doing her housework. She is excited to have this loan because she wants to invest more, get low interest and save money for the future.

Felicia's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries, the main economic activity is a free trading zone, a cement factory, and others.
