This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and unreliable electricity.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry, accessories and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To establish a poutry farm

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita S. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Rafaela Barrera within Sagay City, Negros Occidental province in the Western Visayas islands. Her husband Felix S., who is 59 years old, works as a personal driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 26 to 32 years old. Clarita earns her living by operating Ready-To-Wear clothing business.

Clarita joined NWTF’s Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from Project Dungganon, Clarita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 18000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 11000 PHP and lifted the family's standard of living.

This cycle loan, her 19th, she is borrowing 18000 PHP to obtain more capital for Ready-To-Wear so that she can continue to save up for future financial needs and to improve their living conditions. Clarita S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet runs Joyous Salon to earn a living. She has had the business for five years. She has three employees. She has been able to grow her busines using the loans she gets from Faulu Kenya thanks to Bumbani Group in Faulu Kenya, of whom she is a member; the group members are her guarantors. 

Violet has requested a loan of 60,000 Kes to buy beauty products. Violet is 33 years old and a mother of two children who go to school, and she is married to a security officer.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is 38 years old and married with three children. For a living, she runs a retail shop where she sells foodstuffs.  Her business is located in the slums.  Therefore, most of her customers are low income earners.  She has been running the business for five years.  She hopes to own permanent rental houses in the future.  She has been an active member of Faulu Kenya and has previously had four loans.  She has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Gloria tiene 44 años de edad, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel donde vive con su esposo tuvieron un hijo pero este lastimosamente falleció, por lo que viven solos los dos, ella tiene un comedor que atiende desde la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y su ventaja con el negocio es que en la zona no tiene competencia pues es el único en el lugar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de alimentos para preparar platillos como pollo, carnes, verduras, jugos y otros que puede ofrecer a los clientes, dicho préstamo le ayudara a brindar diferentes menú y así satisfacer los gustos a quienes le consumen sus alimentos.
Su proyección es lograr un aumento en sus ventas, atraer nuevos clientes, darle mayor estabilidad al negocio y recibir ingresos que solventen las necesidades de ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and lives in the city of San Miguel with her husband.  They had a son, but unfortunately he died, so they live alone.  

She has a restaurant that she works at from the morning until 7:00pm.  The advantage is that it is the only business in the neighborhood, so she has no competition.

Gloria is asking for this loan to purchase food to prepare dishes like chicken, meats, vegetables, juices, and others that they can offer to their customers.  This loan would help them create different menus and satisfy the tastes of everyone who eats their food.  

She plans to increase their sales, attract new customers, give the business more stability, and receive an income that will meet the needs of herself and her husband.

loans.use: Purchase of meats and vegetables to prepare food

loans.name: Yuldash

texts.ru: Рахманов Юлдаш проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян. На полученную прибыль он хочет устроить свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Yuldash R. lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 38 years old. He is married and has four children. He has a secondary education, and works  cultivating crops. He rents a plot of land where he grows wheat. He has been in this line of work for 15 years. He is applying for a loan in order to purchase seeds. He would like to use the profits to pay for his son's wedding.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Mujeres Empresarias Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama MUJERES EMPRESARIAS, se localiza en el Altiplano, dentro de la región geocultural del Valle del Mezquital. El paisaje se forma de grandes barrancas, pertenece al Estado de H. en México. Es reconocido sin duda por  la actividad culinaria, las  chalupas y sopes, rebosados de ensalada y salsa picante. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes. Mireya R. ha vivido en esta comunidad desde hace 11 años, ella se dedica a vender comida en tiendas escolares, actividad que inicio hace 5 años, a los niños les agrada la comida que les vende y el trato que les da. Tiene 32 años de edad, estudió el bachillerato, tiene 3 hijos varones. Quiere este crédito para poderles ofrecer más productos a sus clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga comprarle juguetes.
texts.en:
This group is called MUJERES EMPRESARIAS ('Businesswomen').  It is located in Altiplano in the geocultural region of the Mezquital Valley.  The landscape is made up of large ravines and belongs to the state of H. in Mexico.  It is well known for its culinary activity, its 'chalupas' (tostadas filled with shredded meat, onion, chipotle peppers, salsa) and 'sopes' (thick tortillas with vegetable and meat toppings), fried salads and hot sauce.

The group has 12 members.  Mireya R. has lived in this community for 11 years.  She sells food in school stores, a business which she started 5 years ago.  The children like the food which she sells them and the way she treats them.  Mireya is 32 years old.  She completed her high school studies and has 3 sons.  She would like to use this loan to offer more products to her customers and buy toys with the profits which she makes.

loans.use: To invest in her business and buy toys with the profits

loans.name: Ever Lesmy

texts.es:
Ever es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a su menor hijo de un año en la Campiña Chumpon de distrito de Paiján, una zona situada en la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar labores de transporte)el brinda su servicio en el distrito de Paiján y sus caseríos y gracias a esta actividad puede percibir ingresos estables, los cuales invierte en su sostenimiento. Adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola en los campos agrícolas de la zona.

Ever desea realizar algunas labores de mantenimiento a su vehículo de modo que pueda brindar un servicio de calidad ya que el continuo uso y el mal estado de los caminos ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Ever es una personas bastante responsable y que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y le consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
Ever is a 32 year-old father who lives together with his wife and one-year-old child in Camiña Chumpon, Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, more than two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than five years he has been providing a passenger and freight transport service in his mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with a carriage on the back that is used to transport people or goods).  He works in the villages of Paiján district and, thanks to this business activity, he is able to have a stable income.  He also works as an agricultural laborer in the area's fields.

Ever would like to carry out some maintenance work on his vehicle so that he can provide a quality service since his continual use of his vehicle and the bad state of repair of the roads have meant that his vehicle has started to suffer some mechanical failures.  To achieve his goal he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 nuevos soles.

Ever is quite a responsible person who has a great desire to be get ahead.  The people who know him hold him in very high regard and consider him to be a trustworthy man.

loans.use: Repair and maintenance expenses for his mototaxi

loans.name: John Omondi

texts.en:
John Omondi O. is 24 years old and single. He lives in Lumakanda in Eldoret, Kenya and has been operating a motorcycle transportation business for the past 3 years. He earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000.

John learned about KADET LTD through a marketing awareness program in the area and he is applying for his third loan of KES 48,000 from KADET LTD. He intends to buy a new motorbike for his business and employ someone to ride it for him. He anticipates profits which he plans to use to open a retail shop in town. 
In the future, John wishes to have a pick-up to use for transportation. His deeper desire is to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita I. is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating fishing and fish-selling businesses. She lives in Purok Dungcaan, Barangay Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1994 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending/fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of about $229. Mercedita is borrowing 24,000 PHP to use as additional capital and to purchase fishing supplies. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 21,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Mercedita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. This photo was taken after the center meeting, because fish were delivered early in the morning. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional capital and to purchase fishing supplies

loans.name: Sonia Natividad

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos menores y realizó estudios de educación superior.

La señora se vuelve a reincorporar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer  préstamo  fue  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, invirtió en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir.

Ahora solicitará la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el préstamo comprará doce kilos de lana de todo color, confecciona de enaguas, combinaciones, le ayuda sus hijos y su esposo trabaja en Essalud.

Su sueño es sobresalir en el negocio.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la buena comunicación con las socias y las charlas que brindan.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member to the "3 de Mayo II" Comunal Bank in the department of Puno. She has completed a higher education. She has lived in common law marriage for 34 years and has two young children.
 
Sonia is a returning borrower of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos group. Her first loan was in the amount of $125 which she invested in her clothing business.
 
She is again requesting a loan of $125. She plans to use the loan to buy 25lbs of wool of a variety of colors, make petticoats and slips [women's traditional clothing in Peru] and help her children and her husband who works for Essalud.
 
Her dream is to excel in business.
 
What Sonia likes about her comunal bank is the good communication with its members and the workshops it offers.

loans.use: To purchase 25 pounds of wool of in a variety of colors

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel N. is from the town of Sapangdalaga. She is 36 years old, married, and has three school aged children. Maribel operates a family member's business in the clothing sector, selling RTW's in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maribel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase RTW's for her business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Maribel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase RTW's

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira G. is from the village of Poblacion, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Elvira is married and has four adult children. 

To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, beverages and toothpaste in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the second loan taken out by Elvira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ma.theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is married and lives in San Remegio, Cebu. She earns a living by fishing and fish vending.  Her husband Dionisio, 55, is also a fisherman, who works hard to increase their income and develop their businesses.  They have nine children in the ages between 5 and 35 years. Ma. Theresa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. 

With the last four loans taken from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Theresa has been slowly lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000,  uplifting her family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 that she intends to use for buying fishing nets which should boost her fish vending business. She wants to continue saving up for her children's education in the future. Ma. Teresa is a Dungganon woman who is working hard to fulfill her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing net and equipment

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es:
Doña María de 65 años de edad, reside en El  Transito departamento de San Miguel, su negocio es la renta de locales, ella vive con un nieto ya que sus hijos formaron sus propios hogares, el negocio lo tiene hace 8 años, no tiene un horario fijo y por el momento tiene planes de remodelar las instalaciones.
Por lo que doña María solicita un préstamo para comprar pintura, accesorios y equipo, esta compra le será muy útil para mejorar las condiciones y la apariencia de las instalaciones, también estará mejorando la atención a la clientela.
Ella quiere tener los mejores locales, ser la atracción de los clientes y mantener en el negocio ya que es su fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Doña María is 65 years old and lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel.  Her business is property rental.  She lives with her grandson since her children all have their own homes.  

She has been in business for 8 years, does not have a fixed work schedule and plans to renovate her property.  She needs a loan to buy paint, accessories and equipment in order to improve the conditions and appearance of her property, and to improve customer service.

She aspires to having more appealing property to attract customers and keep the business running, since it is her only source of income.

loans.use: To buy paint, accessories and equipment

loans.name: Elisha Agengo

texts.en:
Elisha Agengo is 50 years old and married to Alice. They have two children who are in school. They live in Vihiga County.

Elisha has a butcher shop and has been running this business for the past eleven years. He makes a monthly income of Kshs 13,500. He is applying for his sixth loan from KADET LTD and has a good credit history with us. Elisha intends to use the money to buy three bulls to add to his stock. This will enable him to serve his clients well. The profits will be used to pay for his children's school fees and also cover the family's needs.

He hopes to establish a cattle ranch in the future.

loans.use: to buy three bulls to add to his stock

loans.name: Norma Jadida

texts.es:
La Señora Norma B. es socia del banco comunal Virgen de Bronce, vive por el sector de la Virgen del Bronce en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad esta  bañada por 4 ríos dándole el nombre de Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, tiene muchos lugares turísticos, su gente es amable, cordial,  muy culta y llena de tradiciones.

Doña Norma tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 9 años que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, con el trabajo y sacrificio conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos y chanchos, actividad que la realiza para ayudar en la economía de su hogar y también así puede estar en casa para cuidar de sus hijos.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la construcción de un galpón más grande para sus pollos.

Su meta es culminar sus estudios de bachillerato.
texts.en:
Norma B. is a member of the 'Virgen de Bronce' community bank.  She lives in Virgen de Bronce neighborhood, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is home to four rivers and is known as 'Santa Ana of the Four Rivers'.  There are a lot of tourist attractions and the people are kind, polite, very cultured and full of traditions.

Norma is 31 years old, married, and has two children aged 11 and 9 who attend school in the city.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Through their joint work and sacrifice, the couple have managed to build their own home.

Norma's business is raising and selling chickens and pigs.  She does this work in order to help with their household finances.  It also means that she can be at home to take care of her children.

This is Norma's second loan through her community bank and she will invest it in building a bigger shed for her chickens.  Her goal is to finish her high school studies.

loans.use: to build a chicken shed

loans.name: Stalin Euclides

texts.es:
Stalin Euclides C. B. tiene 40 años, es soltero vive con el hijo, en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  LA SOLEDAD se encuentra ubicada en el recinto EL TAMBO  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao, arroz, maíz, yuca y además cría aves como gallina y patos.

Stalin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz,  los productos las compras en Chillanes y en El Tambo y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa para el hijo.

Le gusta jugar indor con los vecinos.
texts.en:
Stalin Euclides C. B. is 40 years old, single, and lives with his son in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

'La Soledad' community bank is located in El Tambo, in Chillanes canton.  The group has 12 members who all work in agriculture, growing crops such as cacao, rice, corn and cassava.  They also raise birds such as hens and ducks.

Stalin is a farmer who grows cacao, rice and corn.  He buys his products in Chillanes and El Tambo and sells his products in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

Stalin is requesting this loan to buy supplies for his crops as well as fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his work such as pest infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a house for his son. 

Stalin enjoys playing indoor soccer with his neighbors.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his crops as well as fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en: The eight people we see here are part of a loan group led by Mrs. Chea, who was born in 1965. Her husband, Mr. Seang, was born in 1959 and makes a living by driving a motorcycle. They have three children, two of whom are laborers while the third attends a local school. Mrs. Chea helps support her family by selling soup in a local market. Her business is doing well, and she plans use her portion of this loan to buy more of the ingredients she needs to make soup to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to expand a small business selling home-made soup.

loans.name: Norvel

texts.en:
Norvel is a 26-year-old single man who lives with his family in Liliba Village. Norvel has been running a tailoring business for three years, a skill taught by his mother. From his business income Norvel helps his parent meet their living expenses and finances his siblings who are still at school. But his income is not sufficient to fully support his family. 

Norvel met a TLM field officer who explained about the Individual Lending Program for small entrepreneurs like him so he submitted a loan application to run a retail business to generate more income. Fortunately, there is an empty small building owned by his family in front of his house. He is requesting a loan of IDR 4,000,000 to purchase business stock such as instant noodles, sugar, coffee, detergents, biscuits, etc to sell in his kiosk. Norvel is really hoping that TLM will approve his loan application.

loans.use: to purchase inventory: instant noodles, sugar, coffee, detergents, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and has one child.

A. has been a tailor since 2006. He makes and repairs clothing. He has five years of experience, a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to pay the annual rent and to buy a tailoring machine. He Is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent and to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 42 years old. She is married and has two children, neither of whom are currently in school. Rose has a business selling timber, which she has had for five years. She also has a second business providing rental houses.
To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more timber for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for resale.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is 44 years old and married.  He and his wife are blessed with 2 children.  Noel has been in livestock business (hog-raising) for almost 15 years. His net income last month is 11,000 PHP. He is requesting a loan for 23,000 PHP to purchase additional feed for his hogs. He would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of his business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: purchase more feed for his hogs

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve is 43 years old and married with four children.

Salve works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a 29,500-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Salve has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her rice retailing business for 10 years, and she also earns income from a sari-sari store and from farming rice.

Salve aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Melvin Jose

texts.es: Melvin José es hombre muy trabajador además tiene que trabajar diariamente para poder mantener a su familia. El se dedica a la venta y crianza de pollos, el disfruta de esta actividad económica porque le gustan mucho los animales trabaja todos los días ya que tiene que darles de comer y cuidarlos para ofrecer un buen producto a sus clientes. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de concentrado, focos, productos para fumigar, productos vitamínicos entre otros.
texts.en:
Melvin José is a very hard-working man.  He has to work every day to be able to support his family.  He sells and raises chickens.  He enjoys this financial activity because he likes the animals a lot.  He works every day because he needs to give them food and take care of them in order to offer a good product to his customers.

The loan he is requesting is to buy concentrated feed, light bulbs, fumigation products, and vitamin products, among others.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed, light bulbs, fumigation products, and vitamin products, among others.

loans.name: Ndoro

texts.en: Ndoro is 56 years old, married, has four children and earns a living as a livestock farmer. He has been in this line of work for nine years and is applying for his third loan from KADET. He plans to use this loan to expand his herd by buying more goats. He plans to use the additional profits made possible by this loan to make repayments and further expand his business. His dream is to someday own a very large herd of animals and be a very successful businessman.

loans.use: to expand his livestock herd by buying more goats.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 36 years old, married to Eunice but has no children yet. For the last five years he has been operating an electronics business and making a monthly profit of 19,500 KES.

This is John’s fourth loan from KADET. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES, which he plans to use to buy more plugs, chargers, batteries, fuses, etc.

With the anticipated profits, John plans to expand his business. In the near future he hopes to open a big electronics shop in the CBD (Central Business District).

loans.use: to buy more plugs, chargers, batteries, fuses, etc.

loans.name: Kerto Sato Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut lives in Melaya, West Bali.  She is married and has one daughter who is already married. Her husband works as a carpenter. Ni Ketut often helps her husband. In addition, she raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income. She has been raising pigs for eight years.  

Ni Ketut is the head of the Kerto Sato group, which is made up of 10 neighbors from the same village. This is the group’s second loan with MUK. With the Rp 1,500,000 that Ni Ketut receives, she will purchase one sow for pig breeding. She hopes that the sow will have many piglets, which she will then be able to raise and sell.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to repair her kitchen.

loans.use: To purchase one sow

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en: Ambrose is married to Lilian and and they have three school-going children.  He joined Kiva field partner KADET after being referred by other borrowers and is servicing his first loan.  He has been construction material supply business for six years and makes  a monthly income of about 34,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). Ambrose plans to use this loan of 20,000 KES to buy more construction supplies such as bricks, cement, wood, sewage pipes, and gravel.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as bricks, cement, wood, sewage pipes, and gravel.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 61 years old and married with seven children who are all attending school. She has been in farming for over 10 years in her hometown of Kitale in western Kenya.  Her farm produces vegetables, sugarcane and eggs, which she sells to the local market.

Rose has requested a loan of 40.000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her to boost her poultry farming by buying more poultry birds. She says the poultry business has been the most productive and she hopes to expand her farm and become the major supplier for businessmen in the local markets.

However, she mentions that diseases have become the challenge in poultry business.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 23 years old, and lives in airport community. She is single, and has a five year old child that is currently in school, and lives at home. For the past seven years, she has been selling red oil. She has many customers, and makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business, her plans are to buy her land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El señor Tomas se dedica a la reparación de estufas, microondas,  televisores, equipos audiovisuales y otros equipos electronicos, su taller lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion. Sus principales clientes son las personas de las aldeas y Barrios de Nacaome, este negocio le es rentable y le genera ganancias.
El Señor Tomas se siente muy bien ya que ahora tiene mas clientes, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de construccion, va a remodelar su taller para asi tener mas espacio para guardar los aparatos de sus clientes y asi trabajar de manera mas eficiente.
texts.en:
Tomas repairs stove, microwaves, televisions, audiovisual equipment, and other electronic equipment.  His shop is located at his house.  His main customers are the people from the Nacaome villages and neighborhoods.  This business is profitable, and it generates income for him.

Tomas feel very good now because he has more customers.  He will use the loan to buy construction materials.  He will remodel his workshop in order to have more space to store his customers’ appliances.  Working this way is more efficient.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a farmer living in Litein, South Rift, Kenya. His produce of tea and milk go to the local market. He has been farming for the last 15 years. He lives with his family of three children between the ages of 18 and 11.

Philip has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says he will use the income to pay for the education of his children and to provide for other basic needs. He remains optimistic his business will double in five years. He sees lack of capital as the major challenge.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Teodosa Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Teodosa Lucia es  soltera y se dedica a la actividad de compra y venta de cerámica de barro, con la que ha desarrollado su familia y ha diversificado sus actividades económicas como, venta de una pequeña pulpería y de tortillas las que son combinadas por las épocas del año. 

Una de las necesidades que atraviesa es la de comprar la mercadería de la cerámica como: Maseteras, Pájaros Jarrones Etc., ya que ella viaja a costa rica a vender en la época de verano siendo la fecha  inicial en este mes de noviembre la oportunidad de negocio lo que es el resto del verano, Por eso visitó Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para seguir comercializando, satisfacer la demanda y obtener los ingresos para el bienestar de su familia, ya que esta actividad la ejerce desde hace 5 años, teniendo buenos resultados en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Teodosa Lucia is single and works buying and selling pottery which is a family owned business, and she has diversified her activities by selling tortillas in a little grocery store, according to the season.

One of her necessities is to buy ceramic merchandise such as flowerpots, birds, flower vases, and other items, as she travels to Costa Rica to sell in the summer season, starting in November, in order have the opportunity of doing business through the rest of the summer months. [Late November through April is known as summer in Costa Rica.] This is the reason she visited Ceprodel in order to ask for a loan in order to continue doing business, meeting the demand, and to obtain the funds for the well-being of her family. She has five years experience doing this, and has had good results in sales.

loans.use: to buy ceramics such as flowerpots, flower vases, and little doves

loans.name: Cherry-Ann

texts.en:
Chery-ann's family lives comfortably at the barrio though they are less fortunate. At her young age of 21 she had already been blessed with two children. She only finished high school so Cherry-ann has not able to seek for employment. Cherry-ann helps her husband manage a farming business in the barrio. They had been doing this for almost three years to make a living and earns about P12,000 every harvest season. The harvest season falls during the month of April and November. 

Cherry-ann is now asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

She hopes to produce plentiful harvest and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Saem

texts.en: Saem, 42, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Saem sells Cambodian noodles to her new and existing customers. Saem is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. By doing so, her family will be able to decrease expenses from public transportation. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her third loan from KREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Matilda. She is married and has two children age 7 and 18 years. 

In 2001, Matilda established her cooking condiments business. The business started in a small stall at home, and now has a stall at the central market. 

Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Matilda has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now she requires a new loan in order to buy more cooking condiments for her stall. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Matilda plans to move to a shop, begin to sell wholesale and improve the life of her family.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more cooking condiments for her business.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Mrs. Houn is a humble villager who has been residing in Prey Chor district. She has been involved in 3 businesses: cultivating rice crops, selling fresh fish and raising pigs. Her husband is in the business of trading fish and also helps her to manage all farming work to help her relax from the bustle of her work. This couple is blessed with 3 children, one of whom is already married while the other two are students in a local school. 

Recently Mrs. Houn has applied for a loan of $1,000 to buy a hectare of farmland that can be used to grow dry-season rice because it’s located near the path of the river. She appreciates the constant support of her business.

loans.use: to buy a hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Las Madres Trabajadoras De San Juan Group

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa tiene 52 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 es dependiente. Tiene 7 años siendo cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la confección de zapatos para bebes, negocio al cual le puso el nombre de “Confecciones Rosita”. Tiene 15 años en este negocio, el cual comenzó con la idea de poder abrir un negocio propio de venta de lubricantes para autos y motos, objetivo que ya cumplió desde hace 10 años con su esfuerzo y trabajo. Su plan para el futuro es aperturar un nuevo local para así aumentar su mercadería y obtener una mayor rentabilidad. Actualmente ella cubre los gastos de alimentación, agua y luz; mientras que su cónyuge cubre los gastos del alquiler del local. Tiene 8 meses como presidenta de la alcancía comunal “Las Madres Trabajadoras de San Juan”, el cual está conformado por 6 personas y que se formó por un acuerdo mutuo entre las vecinas de la zona. Rosa piensa usar el crédito en la compra de tela para su negocio y así confeccionar más zapatos, ya que por campaña navideña, sus ventas aumentaron.
texts.en:
Rosa is fifty-two, married, and has two children, one of whom is dependent. She's been an Edaprospo client for seven years and makes baby shoes. Her business is called "Rosita's Shoes"; she's been in business for fifteen years. She started out with the idea of opening her own car and motorcycle lubricant business, a objective she completed ten years ago through her own effort. 

Rosa's future plan is to open a new shop so she can increase inventory and make more profit. She currently covers expenses for food, water, and lighting, while her partner covers the rent. She's been president of her communal bank group, "Las Madres Trabajadoras de San Juan" [Industrious Women of San Juan] for eight months. The group has six members and was formed by a mutual agreement among area neighbors. Rosa plans to use her loan to buy fabric for her business and to make more shoes because sales increase over the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 23 years old, single and supporting three people. She has operated an M-PESA business (mobile-phone based money transfer service) for the last four years, earning a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

She is borrowing her first loan from KADET Ltd. of 30,000 KES. She will use the funds to increase her cash float (the minimum amount of cash to be maintained by each dealer required by the mobile money transfer service operator) for the M-PESA money transfer service. With the anticipated profit, she will employ extra staff. 

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business into a multi-billion empire.

loans.use: to increase cash float for M-PESA (mobile-phone based money transfer service)

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 22 years old and lives in Pan-ay,Clarin. She is married and has two children. 

Arlene has a shop that sells clothes. She has had this business for three years. 

Arlene requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothes items.

Arlene has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Arlene hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothes items.

loans.name: Katty Elizabeth

texts.es:
KATTY ELIZABETH tiene 33 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos en Montalvo provincia de los Ríos.

KATTY ELIZABETH es empleada Privada trabaja en una escuela. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar un terreno. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el terreno poder construir una casita.

La compra la efectuará en Babahoyo. El sueño e spoder tener casa propia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el mal clima.

En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Katty Elizabeth is 33, married and has two children. She lives with her kids and husband in Montalvo in the province of Los Rios. She works at a school.

She would like a loan to be able to buy a piece of land. With the help of the loan she will buy land to construct a small house. She will buy land in Babahoyo. Her dream is to own a home. One challenge she might face is bad weather.

In her free time she likes to rest.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Yorma

texts.en:
Yorma is a married mother with four children, and her husband is a salesman. He lost his job recently when the company he worked for shut down. Luckily, the Alvarezes planned ahead and were able to tap into their savings to open a hair salon where Yorma runs the show. Her husband helps out any way that he can by washing customers’ hair, but this is the only source of income for their family right now. Yorma learned how to cut hair eight ears ago, but only two years ago did start cutting hair professionally. Her daughter who is 17 years old gives manicures and paints nails while her mother cuts hair. Yorma has borrowed from the loan sharks before, but she was hardly able to scrape enough money after having to pay them 20% monthly! This hard-working entrepreneur wants this loan so that buy more products like hairdryers, hair-washing sinks, hair and skin treatments, conditioners, permanent hair dyes, spray, enamel, and acetone. Yorma is hoping that with this loan she will be ready to re-open her hair salon with an improved look and all the tools to make it a professional shop. The months of November and December are usually the busiest, so she is hoping to ramp up quickly before the season starts. 

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: This hard-working entrepreneur wants this loan so that buy more products like hairdryers, hair-washing sinks, hair and skin treatments, conditioners, permanent hair dyes, spray, enamel, and acetone.

loans.name: Balabey

texts.en:
Balabey has plot of land. 
6 years ago he decided to start this business. The soil of his plot of land is salty. He requests a loan of $800 to irrigate his plot of land. 
Balabey was born in 1956 in Khaladj village,Salyan region. He is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: To buy irrigation material

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en: Hasina S. J. lives in District 7 of Kabul Afghanistan. She is 24 years old and lives with four other family members. She is married with two children and is good at knitting. Her husband’s income is not enough to cover all the family’s needs so Hasina would like to develop a knitting business to support her husband’s salary. This loan would help her buy the knitting equipment needed to create and expand her business. Hasina’s entire family is very happy and supportive of her and the loan from AFSG.

loans.use: To buy more knitting materials.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es:
There is very little room in my house and I therefore want to build an extra room for my family as one of my children currently sleeps on the floor as there is no space for a bed. I need $1200 to build this room.

Translated form Spanish by Liz Harvey., Kiva Volunteer

“El espacio en mi casa esta muy reducido por eso quiero construir un cuarto más para la comodidad de mi familia, ya que uno de mis hijos duerme en el piso porque no hay espacio para poner una cama”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto".

loans.use: To build a room/Construccion de un Cuarto

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: Ismayil N. is a taxi driver in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Ismayil is married with three children and has been driving a taxi for ten years. He is looking for credit so that he can make repairs to his vehicle which is his main source of income. This is Ismayil’s second loan with Norwegian Microcredit which means that there were no problems with his first loan of US$600.

loans.use: To make repairs to his taxi

loans.name: María Alicia

texts.es:
A year ago, with the firm conviction to give her youngest son (one of 4) a better future, (since their other three children are already married) Maria Alicia decided to create a small snack shop in her home. The location is great since it's in front of a school, however, she now has a lack of resources and not a great assortment of snacks to offer. So today she is coming to you asking for a loan of $ 250 USD, that she is willing to pay within five months. The loan will be used to buy more products which will help bring in more business, and draw attention to all the students who pass by her house. In your hands is the power to help Maria Alicia.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Hace un año, con la firme convicción de darle un mejor futuro al hijo más pequeño de cuatro que tiene (puesto que sus otros tres hijos ya están casados) María Alicia decidió poner un pequeño snak en su casa. Que está en muy buena ubicación ya que tiene enfrente una escuela. Y a falta de recursos no tiene gran surtido de botanas.

Así que hoy está acudiendo a ustedes pidiendo un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de cinco meses. El crédito es para poder surtir su negocio de mercancía que le llame la atención a todos los estudiantes que pasan por su casa. En tus manos está poder ayudarle a María Alicia.

loans.use: To supplement her snack shop

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is a 35 year-old widow and mother of two minor children. She has owned a butcher shop for the past four years in the Luque city market.

Catalina supplies wholesale meats to merchants, occasional clients, and butcher shops. She sells many different cuts of meat: carnaza (a cut of beef popular in Paraguay), puchero (stew meat), loin, ribs, etc, as well as sausage such as chorizo (highly seasoned pork sausage), morsilla (blood sausage), mortadelas (bologna), etc.

The loan that Catalina requests will be used to purchase pork and sausage casings in bulk. This will allow her to increase her income since the end of the year approaches and there is great demand for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Catalina es viuda, tiene 35 años, tiene dos hijos aún menores de edad. Posee una carniceria en el mercado de la ciudad de Luque hace mas de 4 años

Doña Catalina provee al por mayor, a comerciantes, clientes ocasionales y carnicerías, carnes en los diferentes cortes: carnaza, puchero, lomito, costilla, etc. y embutidos como chorizos, morsilla, mortadelas, etc.

El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de carne de cerdo y embutidos en gran cantidad lo cual le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos atendiendo que se acerca fin de año y tiene mucha demanda.

loans.use: To purchase pork and sausage casings

loans.name: Firdos' Group

texts.en:
I am Firdos A. and I live in Lahore, a big metropolis in Pakistan. I am married and the mother of seven. My husband runs a fruit business and now he requires a loan to buy fruit in bulk for his business so as to increase his income.

Now I would like to introduce my other group members. They are:

Budhan B. who requires a loan to buy a cow.

Koser A. whose husband needs to buy a cow.

Munnawer Gulam F. who needs a loan for their toy business; and

Parveen A. who desires a loan to buy her son a rickshaw.

loans.use: Buy fruit in bulk and expand businesses for four other women

loans.name: Besti

texts.en: Besti is a resident of Saatli town and she is 57 years old. Besti has been running this business for 6 years. She is married and has 6 children. One of her sons (in the picture) helps her with the business. She breeds cows and sells them to the local slaughter house.  Besti wants to increase  her profit buy aquiring more cows. This is why she applied to the Saatli brunch of Normicro for a loan of 500 USD for a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more cows

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.en:
Fransisca, 40 years old and married with 2 children, ages 10 and 7, sells timber, a business that she started in 2004. She works everyday from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.
Previously, Fransisca received a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business, and repaid it in a timely fashion.  She now hopes for a loan of $350 to buy more items for her business

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Innocent Chukwuemeka

texts.fr:
Of Nigerian nationality, Mr. Innocent Chukwuemeka N. was born July 21st in Aba, Nigeria. He has been living in Togo for over ten years. He is married and has seven children. Mr. Innocent Chukwuemeka N. has been doing business selling suitcases, shoes, and television stands in the Assivito neighborhood of Lomé since the year 2000. He manages to meet the needs of his family with profits from his business. The 500,000 franc CFA loan he is seeking will allow him to buy 20 crates of shoes and re-supply his stock for retail.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

De nationalité nigériane, Monsieur N. Innocent Chukwuemeka est né le 21 juillet 1972 à Aba au Nigeria. Il réside au Togo depuis plus de dix (10) ans. Il s’est marié et a sept (7) enfants. Monsieur N. Innocent Chukwuemeka exerce l’activité de vente de valise, de chaussures et de table de pose télé à Assivito à Lomé depuis l’année 2000. Il arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille avec le revenu qu’il tire de son commerce. Le crédit qu’il sollicite d’un montant de 500.000 FCFA devait lui permettre acheter vingt cartons de chaussures et de refaire son stock pour pouvoir mieux vendre.

loans.use: Stock shoes for retail

loans.name: Beat Nassali's Group

texts.en:
Beat is the leader of this group of 5 members. She is 65 years old and divorced. She has 8 children who are working and 28 grandchildren, some of whom she pays school dues for. The community she lives in is semi urban.

Some of the challenges are lack of enough space for all her businesses and disease outbreaks, which sometimes kill many of her chickens.

She was able to pay school dues for her children and is now paying for grandchildren. She also constructed 2 chicken houses.

She plans to increase her stock, start rearing pigs, and acquire a bigger piece of land in order to expand her business.

Beat has successfully paid back more than 15 loans.

loans.use: She plans to increase her stock, start rearing pigs, and acquire a bigger piece of land.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is the youngest of four brothers. After seeing his brothers become independent and leave the family home, this dedicated young man decided to do the same and to take the reins of his life to forge his future. This is why he currently dedicates himself to selling coats for men, women and children. He brings his merchandise from the city of Desaguadero and sells it in his native city of Juliaca. In addition to this business he also tries to take advantage of any job that he comes across. He hopes to be able to count on additional capital for his business. He thinks that increasing the volume of his merchandise will improve his earnings and the possibility that he will be able pursue a university degree.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Juan, es el menor de cuatro hermanos, al ver que estos ya se independizaron y salieron del seno familiar, este joven entusiasta decidió hacer lo propio, tomar las riendas de su vida y forjar su futuro, es por ello que actualmente viene dedicándose a la venta de casacas para caballeros, damas y niños, mercadería que trae de la ciudad de Desaguadero y los vende en su ciudad natal Juliaca, adicionalmente a esta labor trata de aprovechar y ganarse la vida con cualquier trabajo eventual que se le presenta.Él desea contar con mayor capital en su negocio, considera que aumentando el volumen de su mercadería mejorarán sus ingresos y su posibilidad de seguir una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Additional capital to offer a greater quantity of coats.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao L. is a villager in Pon Ley Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She sells clothes and she has a second business making and selling desserts. She used a previous AMK loan to start her dessert business. Her husband, Mr. Im Oeun, is a motorbike-taxi driver. Mrs. Sreymao L. is 21 years old and the mother of two young children.

Mrs. Sreymao L.’s clothing business has improved, so she would like to expand it, but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan to buy more fashionable clothes to sell to her customers.

Her husband appears with her in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more fashion clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.pt:
Jorge Alberto Z. was born in the Bongane district of the Xai-xai Province of Gaza, in the south of Mozambique. He is 32 years old and married with a 2-year-old child. He also takes care of his mother and a nephew orphaned by his father.

Jorge completed basic study at the 7 de Setembro (September 7, Mozambique’s Independence Day in 1974) school in Xai-xai. Because a shortage of vacancies in middle school prevented him from continuing his studies, he had to apply early for a spot as a basic level teacher in 1997. The following year he entered the Matola Primary school for teaching, where he finished in 1999. In 2000 he applied for a teaching position in Catembe and because he had the will to continue his studies he applied to the higher education institute Maria Mãe Africa (Mother Maria Africa), earned his Bachelor’s degree, and continues to pursue a License in Educational Sciences.

Jorge has been employed as a teacher since 2000 and works from 7:00 to 11:45am as a professor, trained by the courses he took. His monthly earnings are 5,246 meticals, and he lives in government housing. This is his sixth loan with Hluvuku (Kiva’s Field Partner) and is for legalization of a plot of land. The other loans were used to buy oxen. In the future he intends to increase his stock of animals with the purchase of goats and to build his own house.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge Alberto Z. nasceu em Bongane distrito de Xai-xai Provincia de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 32 anos de idade é casado maritalmente. Tem um filho de 2 anos de idade e sustenta para alem da mae um sobrinho orfão do pai.

Fez o ensino Básico na escola 7 de Setembro em Xai-xai e por que havia dificuldades para continuar por falta de vagas no ensino médio teve que concorrer desde cedo para uma vaga como docente de ensino Básico em 1997 e no ano seguinte ingressou no instituto de magistério Primário da Matola onde concluiu em 1999 e em 200 concorreu para docente na Catembe e porque tinha vontade de continuar os estudos concorreu para o instituto superior maria mãe Africa, fez o Bacharelato e continua a estudar para concluir a Licenciatura em ciencias de educação.

É docente efectivo desde 2000 e entra das 7:00 às 11:45 a experiencia como professor deriva dos cursos que frequentou. Tem um rendimento mensal de 5.246,00MT e vive na casa do estado. Este é o sexto empréstimo na Hluvuku e é para legalização do terreno. Os outros emprestimos destinou para compra de gado Bovino. No futuro pretende ampliar sua criação na compra de gado caprino e construir sua própria casa.

loans.use: To pay taxes and expenses for land acquisition

loans.name: Mara Susan

texts.es:
Mara is 27 years old, belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Candelarias II” in Huaraz. She hopes to have a boutique and be able to manage it herself while continuing to work in Business Administration, the career she is studying.

Mara tells us that she is single and lives with her parents, her income is sufficient to cover her basic necessities and be able to pay for her studies herself.

She brings clothing from Lima and sells them according to her customer’s orders. With this she earns about 125 soles per week, and in the three years she has had this business is has grown. She began with only 5 orders.

with a loan for S/800 soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will close out her cosmetic product accounts and buy clothing according to her customer’s orders.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Mara tiene 27 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Candelarias II”de Huaraz, espera tener una boutique y poder administrarla directamente e ir trabajando en Administración de empresas que es la carrera que ella esta estudiando.

Mara, aunque no es amarga, ya que eso significa su nombre, nos dice, que es soltera y vive con sus padres, le es suficiente lo que gana para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y poder ayudarse en sus estudios.

Ella trae ropas de Lima y las vende a pedidos a sus clientes ya fijos, con lo cual obtiene una ganancia de 125 soles semanales, en los tres años que tiene en este negocio ha crecido. Ella inicio con sólo 5 pedidos.

Con el préstamo de S/ 800 soles, que lo pagará en 6 cuotas, ella cancelará las cuentas de sus productos cosméticos y comprará ropas de pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy items of clothing

loans.name: Léocadie

texts.fr: Léocadie D., 54ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois des Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter des porcs et des aliments (son de mil) pour les engraisser et les revendre. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Léocadie D., age 54, is married and has five children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara for four and a half years. She want to buy pigs and feed (millet bran) to fatten them and then to sell them. The income derived from her business enables her to help cover family expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru:
Саймуродов Рахмон, 1966 года рождения. Он женат и у них многодетная семья. Вместе с женой они воспитывают 10 детей. Чтоб прокормить большую семью Рахмон решил занятся продажей школьных книг и принадлежностей. Сейчас он в месте со своей женой продают разновидность препаратов для истребления насекомых и грызунов. Продаваемый ими товар всегда в спросе, так как эти препараты часто востребованы в сельской местности. Свои товары Рахмон закупает в оптовом рынке и продает на рынке Мубориз Гисарского района.
Для увеличения товарооборота хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони для закупа препаратов от вредителей домашних животных.
texts.en:
Rahmon S. was born in 1966. He is married and raises 10 children with his wife. In order to support his large family, Rahmon decided to start selling school books and supplies. Currently, his wife and he sell a variety of insect- and rodent-controlling pesticides. The goods are always in demand especially in their agricultural locality. Rahmon purchases his goods at a wholesale market and sells them at the Muboriz market in the Gissar district. In order to increase goods turnover, he wants to obtain a $900 loan for purchasing pest control products for domestic animals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pest control products for domestic animals

loans.name: Eugénie

texts.fr: Mariée, Madame Eugénie G. vit dans la ville d’Aného avec son mari et leurs trois enfants. A 54 ans elle a encore la vigueur d’une jeune fille et jouit d’une parfaite santé. Comme activité, elle tient une boutique d'alimentation générale et de vente des articles scolaires, activité à travers laquelle elle dégage un peu de revenu pour aider son mari dans la gestion des charges du ménage. Elle sollicite ce financement pour redynamiser son activité et dégager plus de revenu qui lui permettra de contribuer davantage à l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Eugénie G. is married and lives in the city of Aného with her husband and their three children. At the age of 54, she still has the vigor of a girl and enjoys perfect health. As for her work, she runs a grocery store and sells school supplies, a business from which she derives a little income to assist her husband in managing household expenses. She is applying for financing to reinvigorate her business and to earn more income, which will enable her to help even more with her children's education.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for her store

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.en:
Maximiliana P. is a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank.  Maximiliana is 56 years old and is separated with four children. Maximiliana sells fish on Saturdays from the door of her house in the San Martin de Porres neighborhood. She also sells fish in the Yanamilla neighborhood.   Maximiliana needs a loan of $700 to buy fresh and frozen fish.  Maximiliana’s dreams are to expand her business, to launch another business, and for her children to finish their studies. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow.

loans.use: Buy fresh and frozen fish

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum V., 34, is employed as a construction worker in his community and lives in Kompong Tom province, Cambodia.  

He is married to Chum Mony, aged 36.  She raise pigs from their home and grows vegetables in a plot of her farmland.  She normally earns the money to support her family's food needs, so she works very hard everyday.  

She is a good mother of two children; both of whom are still young and attend school.  

To begin a new investment and earn additional income, Chum V. has requested a loan as capital to add to his savings to purchase a rice mill machine to provide this service for rice farming.

loans.use: To purchase a rice mill machine

loans.name: Noy

texts.en:
Mrs. Noy M. is a 66 year old widow. She lives in Ampao Prey Muoy village in the Kandal province.

Mrs. Noy M. is a fruit seller. She would like to expand and purchase more fruits to re-sell as her business is doing well. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to re-sell.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena K. is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both boys. According to Philomena, both of her children are yet to start school. She says her husband is a laborer in a road construction company. She lives with the family in a house in a small town called Simpa, a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana.
Philomena enjoys trading very much. She runs a provision store to support her husband take care of the family. She procures her goods from nearby markets at wholesale prices. She says her shop is situated in her house. She has been in business for three years. It has been her desire to save enough to sponsor her children to have the best education. She wants a loan to procure provisions in bulk so she can maximize her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure provisions in bulk

loans.name: Nelly De

texts.es: NELLY ES UNA SEÑORA MAYOR QUE YA TIENE A TODOS SUS HIJOS MAYORES DE EDAD E INDEPENDIENTES, ACTUALMENTE VIVE EN LA CASA DE UNA DE SUS HIJAS. TRABAJA COMO OPERARIA DE COSTURA EN UNA SASTRERIA DE LA ZONA, ADICIONALMENTE EN SU DOMICILIO REALIZA TODO TIPO DE CONFECCIONES Y ARREGLOS DE VESTIMENTAS DE MANERA PARTICULAR. LA COMPETENCIA ES MEDIA EN SUS ACTIVIDADES. EL CREDITO SERA DESTINADO PARA LA COMPRA DE UN NUEVO TELEVISOR. ESTA SERA SU TERCERA OPERACION DE CREDITOS CON LA INSTITUCION, LAS  ANTERIORES LAS CANCELO CON TOTAL NORMALIDAD.
texts.en:
Nelly is an older lady and her children are grown and live independently. Right now she lives in the home of one of her daughters. She works as a sewing machine operator in a tailoring shop. She also makes confections and alters clothing in her home. There is some competition in her activities. The loan will be used to buy a new television set. This is her third loan with this institution, having repaid the others on time.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a television

loans.name: Saili

texts.en:
Saili F., 27, is married with 3 children. She has 2 years of experience in the fishing business. She sells fish to the general public/villagers 5 days per week.

She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~160 USD). SPBD loans are Saili’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to buy material needed for the business only.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and a new fishing canoe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy some necessary things for his land

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
"Before my family is agonizing much on paying high-interest loans from informal lenders. Our income is just enough to pay our loans. What really happened was, my husband and I were not able to provide some of the important needs of our children," says Paz L., a 49-year-old mother of two children.

"Then, I heard about Kiva from Community Economic Ventures Inc. I really need (a) loan to purchase the (necessary) herbicides and insecticides (for) my farm," she said. The loan will truly help her increase her yield and income as well.

CEVI is reaching out to a lot of farmers, especially the poor, to start and have their own businesses. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel D. is 33 years old. He is single and dependent. Samuel is a dealer in mobile phones and accessories. He says the sale of mobile phones has become a very lucrative business in Ghana because almost every Ghanaian desires to possess a mobile phone for easy and fast communication. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. Samuel has been in this business for four years now.

Samuel requests a loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of mobile phones and accessories. He hopes the loan will help him to increase his savings and enable him to expand his shop to include the sale of phone cards.

Samuel belongs to the community group called Thank You Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Juana Angelica

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82750&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Juana se dedica al venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, y venta de lencería por catalogo. Ella tiene una casa propia  y se dedica  alquilar la parte de delante de su casa para tienda y dos habitaciones
Desde que esta en Finca los prestamos han ayudado mucho para cumplir  lo que ella se esta proponiendo.
Juana  necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, terminar de ampliar un para alquilarlo.
Su sueño es seguir construyendo su casa para seguir alquilando, y tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Juana sells beauty products and lingerie through catalogs. She owns her own house and rents the front part for a store and two rooms. Since she has joined Finca, the loans have been of great help to her in carrying out what she set out to do. Juana needs a loan of 1600 soles to complete an addition which she will rent out. Her dream is continue building her house and renting the space, and also have another business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish expanding her house.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 41 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. Mary hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: San Benito Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Benito inicia su Primer ciclo con 16 socios. 
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. ropa, abarrotes en general, comida, artesanía.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 7,500 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. verduras, arroz, azúcar, papa, gaseosas, ropa variada, pescado.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener un local propio, ampliar sus negocios, sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The San Benito Communal Bank is starting its first loan cycle with 16 members.
The members run different businesses, selling clothing, groceries, food and handicrafts.
The members need different loan amounts, like 300 PEN and 600 PEN, making a total of 7,500 PEN in loans from the Communal Bank.
Their loans will be used to purchase vegetables, rice, sugar, potatoes, soft drinks, a variety of clothing and fish.
The members dream of having their own shops, expanding their businesses and their children becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, rice, sugar, potatoes, soft drinks, clothing and fish.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.en:
Angela is 38 years old and is married with three children.  Angela dedicates herself to the sale of beauty products as well as bedspreads, quilts and sheets.  Angela sews the sheets herself.  Her husband works in the timber business.

Angela has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank "Las Colinas" (The Hills).  She plans to invest this loan of 2000 soles in purchasing bedspreads and quilts for sale. 

Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Angela has had more capital to invest in her business ventures.  In particular, she has invested a lot in sewing sheets for sale.  Angela's goal is to have her own home-based shop from which she can sell all kinds of goods for the home.

loans.use: To purchase bedspreads and quilts for sale.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
“Patience and hard work are some of factors to have a progressive life” says Juanito M., a farmer and a responsible husband to Delia. They live harmoniously with their three children at Brgy. Almaguer South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Their children are now in tertiary and secondary education.  The couple are striving hard to earn a living to support the education of their children.

Farming and hog raising are their primary sources of income.  He cultivates their farm twice a year and his crops are rice, corn and some vegetables. He needs financial support and would like a loan of PHP 20,000 from the Kiva lenders.  He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for the maintenance of their farm.  During harvest season, they can earn an average net income of P 15,000.  They budget their income for the basic needs of their family, for the education of their children and as payment for this loan.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam A.  is a Tanzanian married small businesswoman. She runs a business selling second hand and new clothes at Buguruni Ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the business goods and the second hand goods   wholesale and sells retail to customers. She has run the business for five years and its income manages to meet her daily family needs. Mariam needs a loan of TZS 600,000 to capitalize her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Luisdi

texts.es: Lusdi es una persona colaboradora y activa, tiene 34 años de edad, madre de tres hijos, uno de ellos mayor de edad  y dos menores, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, tiene su bodega en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es chofer  de su motocarro (propio).Es socia del banco comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Esperanza”, su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles que invirtió en artículos para su bodega.  Con este préstamo de 1200 soles, comprará bebidas, golosinas, y demás productos que requiera sui bodega. La meta de Lusdi es ampliar su tienda  y poder vender otros tipos de productos como artículos de ferretería y algunas prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Lusdi is a cooperative and active person and a 34-year-old mother of three children, one of legal age and two minors. She sells general groceries and runs a store out of her home. She relies on the support of her husband, who is the driver of a motorcar (of his own). She is a member of the “Nuestra Señora de la Esperanza” communal bank, and her first loan was for 300 soles, which she invested in items for her store. With this loan of 1200 soles, she will buy drinks, sweets and other products that her store requires. Lusdi's goal is to expand her shop's offerings and be able to sell other types of products, such as hardware items and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in drinks, sweets and other products that her store requires

loans.name: Djavharoy

texts.en:
K. Djavharoy is an enterprising, capable, and very hardworking woman. She lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan, and sells women’s clothes. She began her own business because her husband was unemployed for some time. Her work allows her to send her three children to school. It is very important to Djavharoy that her children finish school and become honest, hardworking individuals. She is requesting 3000 TJS to buy merchandise in order to increase sales. She wants to continue to support her children and only wishes to work in order to achieve this. You can help Djavharoy provide for the education of her children – please support her!

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Thelma
