texts.en: Thelma T. is from the village of Dullan. She is 57 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Thelma owns and operates a "carinderia" or eatery business, serving local foods to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Thelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for her restaurant. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios N. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old and married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Remedios owns and operates a business making and selling food. She sells specialty food products in the local community. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is 31 years old and engaged to be married. He has owned a bakery since 2004 and has more than 14 years baking experience. Samir works hard to make enough income to be able to meet his needs. Today, Samir is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase more merchandise so he can increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Chim H. is 26 years old and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh. Since 2008, she has been selling CDs and DVDs from her home to earn a living.  She makes USD $2.50 of profit every day, while her husband sells newspapers and earns USD $3 per day. This couple has three young children. Chim H. would like to take out a loan to invest in a grocery business.

loans.use: to invest in a grocery business.

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en:
S. Iskandar is a loving and self-sacrificing son. Ever since he was very young, Iskandar has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sales of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family.

The desire that Iskandar harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. By doing this, he can create more income for his family. He requests 4000 Somoni. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted son to help him keep bringing well-being and security to the members of his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en: 29-year-old Marivel is a married woman with three children. Her oldest child is only 8 years old. She works hard to be able to earn and save for her children’s future. Like any mother, she also wants to improve her family’s living condition. She has sought the help of MFIs in the Philippines. She is now a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She is currently applying for a loan of Php 8,000, which she will use for the farm. With this loan, she can now acquire farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer and also pay the laborers she hires to help at the farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 55-year-old married man and the father of five children

Mohamad has been working as a taxi driver since 1994 and with his business income he was able to raise his children alone. He works hard and he took up private transportation services upon request of clients, working day and night to earn a good income for his family.

Today, Mohamad is requesting $1,000 to perform maintenance on his taxi after being in bad circumstances.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es: La Sra. Brenda Lucia A. G. es trabajadora activa de la institución, seguro social el dinero los solicita para compra de materiales de construcción arena, perlines, piedra, hierro y bloque, es casada tiene tres hijos en edad escolar los crédito le han ayudado mucho ya que ha podido salir adelante con sus hijos con los pagos del colegio y ha podido ir construyendo su casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
Brenda Lucia A. G. is an active employee of Social Security. She needs funding to buy building materials like: sand, metal, stone, iron, concrete blocks. She is married and has three, school-age children. The loans have helped her a lot because they have made it possible for her to pay for her children's school expenses and she has been able to gradually build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sand, gravel and cement.

loans.name: Susi

texts.en:
Susi N. is 28 and married with 2 children (ages 5 and 8).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Susi has 2 years of experience in this business.  Susi needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Susi joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Susi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Susi N. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Chalgash

texts.ru: Искандаров Чалгаш проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование высшее "Педогог". Преподает в средней школе. Кроме того занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет небольшой участок земли, где выращивает овощи. В этой области уже 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений. Сейчас посевной сезон и клиент хочет закупить качественные семена, чтобы получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en:
Chalgash I. lives near Yavan. He is fifty-one years old, married with five children. He has a degree in Education and teaches in secondary school. In addition to teaching, he is a farmer. On a piece of land next to his home, he has grown vegetables for over twenty years. He is asking for a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Currently, during the planting season, he wants to buy high quality seeds to get a better harvest and sales.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jonathan L.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a primary school in Kapethe village, in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1973 by the Wesleyan Church of Sierra Leone (WCSL) to educate the children of Kapethe village and near-by villages. Currently, the school is staffed with 10 teachers and has 205 pupils.

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise have not being able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Jonathan L. J. is the leader of this group of teachers. The 53-year-old was born in Kapethe village. He is married to a businesswoman and they have five children.  Jonathan, who has been a teacher for thirty years, is requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 in order to pay school fees and other school-related charges for his children.

loans.use: Pay school fees and other school-related charges for his children

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi G. is a businessman who runs a carpentry store in the Longo mhongwe area. He supplements his income by selling secondhand clothes to area residents. He has been in the carpentry business for the last five years and is proud of his work. He is 45 years old. He and his wife, Binti Omar Mohamed, 30 years old, are blessed with four children, all of whom attend school.

Hamisi has been a member of KADET for some time, and he is now accessing his second loan after successfully completing repayment of the first one, which was in the amount of Kshs 11,000. With this second loan, Hamisi intends to devote Kshs 15,000 of the money to restocking timber for his carpentry business and to use Ksh.7,000 to buy clothing supplies.

He hopes to be very successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase timber for his carpentry business and secondhand clothes for sale

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Âgée de 37 ans, Fatoumata Sidibé est mariée et mère 5 enfants. Elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Bougoula Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Fatoumata Sidibé, après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée depuis plus de 10 ans à l’activité d’achat et vente d’habillements (pagnes Wax, tissus brodés) de chaussures,  des savons liquides etc qu’elle achète à Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso). Elle mène son activité à son domicile et de façon ambulante dans la ville de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant cinq  ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires dans un association des femmes de son quartier, elle est actuellement  à son huitième prêt individuel et  tous ses prêts précédents ont été tous correctement remboursés.
 Elle compte acheter avec ce  nouveau prêt, 15 pièces de pagne Wax, 5 complets de tissus brodés et 20 paires de chaussures différentes. Ses marchandises sont vendues en détail, de façon ambulante, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Sidibé is 37 years old, married and the mother of five children. She lives with her husband and children in a large traditional extended household in Bougoula Ville, in the centre of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). After a number of unsuccessful ventures, Mrs. Fatoumata Sidibé began over ten years ago to trade in clothing: pagnes Wax (colourful West African clothing fabric), embroidered fabrics, shoewear, liquid soap, all of which she purchases in Bobo Dioulasso (in the Republic of Burkina Faso). She conducts her business from her home and as an itinerant vendor throughout Sikasso, where she is much in demand due to the quality of her products. To satisfy an increasing customer base, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI some five years ago. Following several group loans as part of a group of neighbourhood women, she is now requesting an 8th individual loan, having reimbursed in full all preceding loans. She intends to buy 15 pagnes wax, 5 complete sets of embroidered clothes and 20 pairs of shoes of different styles. She sells her merchandise as an itinerant retailer, for cash or credit, to mainly women customers. She hopes to attain a monthly profit of 250,000 FCFA which will be used to increase her working capital, contribute towards family expenses and paying back her loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo Y. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro  City. He is 45 years old. Danilo is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Danilo works for a business that provides taxi services to local community members. Danilo has been engaged in this business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Danilo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo is requesting his first loan, for 5000 PHP, to invest in expanding the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: American rice, toilet paper, flour, beans, oil, Maruchan soup, condensed milk and sugar

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn H. is from the village of Christian Village, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 32 years old. Edelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Edelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Edelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Edelyn is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Edelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

location.town: Christian Village, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida F. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Nida owns and operates a business operating tricycle transport services. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Nida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nida is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Tuwisana Plus Group

texts.en:
Papy K., a 31-year-old married man, has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2007. He is the leader of the community bank named Tuwisana Plus that is composed of 22 members united in solidarity with the goal of developing their businesses through loans from HOPE DRC, a partner of HOPE International.

Papy operates a general store in southwest Kinshasa, earning $30 a week. He has acquired solid experience and contacts and maintained good management skills. Papy works hard, hoping to realize his dream of one day achieving financial independence and opening a large store in his neighborhood.

Papy is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE DRC, having five times obtained and correctly repaying loans. With his next loan he will increase his stock of merchandise by buying canned goods, milk, and sacks of rice and sugar and reselling them at a profit.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, milk, and sacks of rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona is from Nocnocan, Talibon. She is 30 years old, married, and has 5 school-aged children. She is involved in fishing. Her husband, who is a fisherman too, goes out fishing and she sells his catch at the market. She also dries fish sometimes and sells it in her community.

Melona joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI, and is now requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This will be Melona’s fourth loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her family’s house.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Mayas Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “MAYAS”, es un grupo que está iniciando el ciclo número 3, consta de ocho integrantes, a la cabeza  se encuentra la señora María Graciela como presidenta. 

La  señora María Graciela, tiene como negocio la confección y venta de chamarras. La venta es realizada de lunes a sábado, de cuatro de la tarde a siete de la noche en la feria llamada "Tihuanacu". Su experiencia en el ramo es ya de siete años.  Su solicitud actual es de Bs. 4500.- para la compra de tela.
Con respecto a su permanencia en Pro Mujer, ella ya está más de un año en su asociación.

Las integrantes A.C. “Mayas” tienen diferentes negocios, entre ellos: venta de polleras y mantas, venta de salchipapas, confección de chamarras, venta de anticuchos y refrescos, producción de peluches, venta de fierros angulares  (Cerrajería), confección de chamarras y tejidos a mano.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Mayas, is a group that is beginning their third loan cycle. It consists of eight members, the head of which is María Graciela as president.

María Graciela has a business making and selling jackets. The sales are done from Monday to Saturday from 4-7pm in a market called Tihuanacu. She already has seven years of experience in the industry. Her current loan (within the group) is for 4500 BOB, for the purchase of fabric. With respect to her continuance in Pro Mujer, she has already been in her group for more than a year.

The members of the communal bank Mayas have different businesses. Among them are: skirt and blanket sales, hot dog sales, making jackets, kebab and refreshment sales, making stuffed animals, selling angular pieces of metal (locksmith), and making jackets and knitted items by hand.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura es una señora de 51 años, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus 3 hijas, la mayor de 18 años y la menor de 7 años, residen en Corinto, Morazán. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, dicha actividad la realiza durante toda la semana en las zonas cercanas a su vivienda, sin tener un horario fijo.
Doña Rosaura está solicitando un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de mas productos como lociones, cremas y labiales. Este préstamo la ayudara a aumentar su negocio y a ofrecer diferentes productos que le permitirán generar los ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas de la familia.
Los sueños son que a través del trabajo y el negocio pueda ayudar a las hijas a terminar los estudios.
texts.en:
Rosaura is a 51-year-old woman who is single and lives with her 3 daughters. The eldest is 18 and the youngest 7 years old. They live in Corinto, Morazan. Rosaura sell cosmetics every day in the zones near her house without a fixed schedule. Rosaura is soliciting a loan to invest in buying more products, like lotions, creams, and lipstick. The loan will help her to increase business, offer different products, and permit the generation of more income to pay for the basic necessities of her family. Rosaura's dream is that by means of her work and the business, she might be able to help her daughters complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MORE PRODUCTS LIKE LOTIONS, CREAMS, AND LIPSTICK TO SELL

loans.name: Ana Mery

texts.es:
Ana Mery es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito agrícola de Olmos, una zona situada en el distrito de Lambayeque, a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la venta de verduras y frutas en un puesto situado en el mercado de Olmos. Este negocio le ha permitido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares durante todos los años que llevan juntos y siempre ha contado con muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes ya que a ese mercado no sólo llegan los pobladores del pueblo sino de los diversos caseríos que lo rodean, muchos de ellos se encuentran hasta a una hora de distancia del lugar.

Ana desea mantener un stock permanente en su negocio para poder responder de mejor modo a la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Ana es una mujer bastante trabajadora y emprendedora. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado reponsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Ana Mery is 32 years old and a mother who lives with her husband and children in the agriculture district of Olmos, an area located in the Lambayeque district, an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

For 10 years she has worked selling fruits and vegetables from a stand located in the Olmos market.  This business has allowed her to help her husband with the family expenses for all of the years they have been together.  She has always had very good reception from customers as this market not only reach the people of the village but from different villages surrounding it, many of which are up to an hour away.  Ana wants to maintain a permanent stock in her business to better respond to the demand of her customers.  Because of this she has decided to request a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Ana is a very hardworking and enterprising person.  People who know her have great esteem and affection.  Previously she has worked with Edypme Alternativa and has proven responsibility with her payments.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables to expand business sales in the market

loans.name: Hamuza

texts.en:
Hamuza K. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. None of his children is currently in school. Hamuza has a retail shop, which he has had for two years.          

To help expand his business, Hamuza has requested a loan of 1500000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items like cassava flour for sale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hamuza hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Hamuza hopes to send his wife back to school.

loans.use: To buy more items like cassava flour for resale

loans.name: Nelson Morcelino

texts.es:
Nelson, es vendedor informal de encebollados (plato típico como desayuno contiene pescado, cebolla). vive en una casa de caña ubicada en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Comenzó a  vender afuera de su casa encebollados (contiene cebollas y pescado) para poder mantener a su esposa y tres hijos que aun estudian. Poco a poco comenzó a tener clientela fija. En la actualidad ya tiene 5 años con este negocio y vende 20 platos diarios, trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta que se acabe el encebollado.  

Para poder agrandar mas su negocio el quiere comprar ollas, pescados y otra parte invertirla en ropa ya que espera de ahora en adelante tener otro ingreso adicional. En el futuro quiere tener su casa de cemento y que su negocio sea mas grande.
texts.en:
Nelson, is in business of informally selling the "encebollados" dish (it's a typical food served at breakfast containing fish and onions).  He lives in a house made out of cane in el Paraiso de Guayaquil (a semi-rural area with dirt roads and houses made partly in the mountains).  He began to sell this area's typical dish outside of their home and slowly began having regular customers.  He has been in business for 5 years and sells about 20 meals per day, and works from 06h00am until he sells all the "encebollados" that he's made.

In order to enlarge his business, Nelson would like to buy cooking pots, fish and invest some money in clothing - this will help him bring in additional income.  In the future wants to have a house made out of concrete, and expand his business.

loans.use: Ollas, pescado, ropa  (cooking pots, fish and clothing)

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is sixty-five years old.  He lives with his wife in the village of El Clacke, which is near the city of Reque, twenty minutes to the south of the city of Chiclayo.  All of their children are adults and live outside of the home.  It is a rural region with small farmers and people who raise animals.  Juan and his wife have lived in the area for over twenty-five years.

The couple raises animals.  Juan primarily raises cattle which from which he harvests milk, and his wife raises fowl which she sells for their meat.  The two are happy to be able to provide for their needs as well as to provide good examples to their children as independent workers.  They hope to be able to retire on their business and in the future provide small inheritances to their children.

The loans will be used to expand their herds and purchase additional feed for their animals.  They hope to be able to increase their herds before the holiday season in order to take advantage of the higher prices during that time.  They also hope to improve their standard of living and better serve their community.

loans.use: Purchase additional feed for the animals and expand his herd

loans.name: Baterdene

texts.en: Baterdene D. is 30 years old and lives with his parents and siblings in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia’s capital city. He and his family live together in their own house. His parents are both retired and all his siblings work. Since 2005, he has been operating a taxi service using his own car. He used his previous loan to complete building his house where the family lives.  He is planning to start a new, meat trading business and therefore he is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to start this business.

loans.use: To start his business

loans.name: Thourn

texts.en:
Mr. Thourn O. (in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Onn Bou, have been married since 1988 and have five children -- four sons and one daughter. The family lives on an island in Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Thourn is a wooden-house constructor. His business is doing well, and he hopes to respond his customers' needs. Therefore, Thourn is asking for another loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to work.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction materials for his construction business.

loans.name: Ardela

texts.en:
Ardela P. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Ardela owns & operates an agricutural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ardela dreams that all her children will finish college and find good jobs. 

Ardela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ardela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia Betsabe; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bazar de regalos, ella vende diferentes regalos como peluches, perfumes, agendas y entre otros regalos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de bazar. La socia solicita el préstamo para  comprar mercadería al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Kantu Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, part of the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Sra. Julia Betsabe.  She is 40 years old and divorced and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her gift shop business.  She sells different gifts such as felt dolls, perfumes, and day planners, among other things.  She wants to enlarge her shop.  

She is applying for the loan in order to purchase inventory at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and promises to make all her installment payments.

loans.use: The member is applying for the loan in order to purchase inventory at wholesale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu S. is 39 years old, married and works hard to make sure that all of her children can attend school. Since 2003, she has made a living by selling beverages, working six days a week and eight hours a day. She has a very good loan repayment history, and is applying for a new one, for Le 5,000,000, to buy more soft drinks to sell to her customers. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to sell to her customers

loans.name: Amarsanaa

texts.en:
Amarsanaa, 40, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They have lived in a house on some land that they own for the past fourteen years. His older son attends college, while the younger two children attend the local secondary school. 

He operates a car repair business and a taxi service. He operates the taxi business with his own car that he bought in 2006 with the money he made from his car repair business. His wife operates a retail trading business of consumer goods which she started in 2001. She operates a rented kiosk at a local market and her working capital is 2,000,000 MNT. Amarsanaa and his wife both work hard to support their family through their business incomes. 

Amarsanaa is a hardworking and active person who drives taxi, repairs cars and helps his wife with her business. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his car and cover the maintenance fees.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Liberto De Jesús

texts.es:
La falta de oportunidades, los escasos recursos de su familia y las ganas de superarse, obligaron a Liberto de Jesús Q. Q. a trabajar desde los 8 años de edad cuando apenas era un niño, empezó vendiendo frutas en el parque del municipio de donde es oriundo y después siendo aun joven decidió buscar otras alternativas y viajó a Medellín-Colombia para continuar su lucha. 

Con los pocos ahorros que tenía montó una carnicería pero ya trabajando empezó a consumir alcohol desmedidamente, situación que lo afectó en todos los aspectos de su vida, fue entonces cuando decidió buscar empleo en una empresa para disciplinarse y tratar de dejar a un lado esta dependencia. Durante 8 años trabajo como empleado y logró superar esta dificultad que como el mismo lo afirma son situaciones para crecer como personas. 

Su vena emprendedora continuaba latente y fue entonces cuando decidió crear nuevamente su propio negocio, ahora una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar se convirtió en su sustento y en el de su familia. 

Actualmente, Liberto necesita de un préstamo para la compra de diferentes productos ya que el dinero que tenía destinado para tal fin lo invirtió en la reparación de un enfriador.
texts.en:
The lack of opportunities, his family's scarce resources, and his desire to get ahead have obligated Liberto de Jesús Q. Q. to work since he was 8 years old and just a child. He began by selling fruit in the park of his native city, and later when he was still a youth, he decided to seek other opportunities, and he traveled to Medellin, Colombia, to continue his struggle. 

With the small savings he had, he set up a butcher shop, but after he started working, he began to drink too much alcohol, a situation which affected all areas of his life. It was then that he decided to seek work with a company, so he could gain self-discipline and leave his dependency behind. For 8 years, he worked as an employee, and he was able to overcome this difficulty, which, as he himself affirms, is the kind of situation that allows people to grow as individuals.  

His entrepreneurial spirit was still latent within him, and he next decided to start his own business again: this time a general store with household necessities, which has become the source of sustenance for himself and his family. 

Currently, Liberto needs a loan to buy various products, since the money he had set aside for this purpose had to be invested in repairing a refrigeration unit.

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Sarah has a cosmetic shop selling all types of body lotion, which she has had for two years.  She also has a second business of selling shoes.  

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more cosmetic lotions and shoes for resale.  With the help of this loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and contribute to paying school fees.  In the future, Sarah hopes to expand her business and also build a house. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by allowing her to become self-reliant.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic lotions and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Alicia Noemy

texts.es: Alicia Noemy D. L., habita en casa propia junto con su hijo y nuera. Como toda mujer emprendedora tiene su propio negocio D. costura en el Municipio D. Santa Tecla del Departamento D. La Libertad que con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado establecer. Tiene 5 años D. experiencia en la costura y diseña cualquier tipo D. prenda D. vestir que los clientes soliciten tales como faldas, vestidos, pantalones etc. Este negocio ha sido para Alicia su principal fuente D. ingreso y sigue confiando que así seguirá siendo. En este negocio lo  más importante es dejar satisfecho al cliente D. esta manera Doña Alicia se ha ganado la confianza D. los habitantes D. la zona que cada día la prefieren mas. Esta señora llena D. sueños solicita este crédito para poder invertir en material para costura: hilo, tela, elástico, botones, etc. Que le permitan ofrecer mayor cantidad y variedad D. sus estilos D. ropa. Y aspirar a mejores ventas e ingresos para poder cubrir sus necesidades y vivir mas tranquila.
texts.en:
Alicia Noemy D. L. lives in her own house with her son and daughter-in-law.  Like all enterprising women, she has her own business.  Her seamstress business is in the Santa Tecla municipality in the La Libertad department.  It took great effort to manage to establish the business.  

She has five years of experience in dressmaking.  She designs all types of clothing like skirts, dresses, and pants, etc.  This business has been Alicia’s main source of income, and she trusts that it will continue this way.  Satisfying the customer is the most important thing in this business.  Alicia has won the trust of the inhabitants of the area.  Every day they prefer her more and more.

This woman, who is full of dreams, is requesting this loan to be able to buy sewing materials like thread, fabric, elastic, and buttons, etc.  This will allow her to offer a greater quantity and variety of clothing styles.  She aspires to have greater sales and income in order to be able to cover her expenses and have greater peace of mind.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials like thread, fabric, elastic, and buttons, etc. to make skirts, dresses, and pants, etc.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AZUCENAS” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Rosario.   Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: venta de dulces, pastelería, chiflería, venta de medias, tejidos de chompa, joyería, taller de electricidad, venta de ladrillos.

La señora Rosario, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que participa hace un año en una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer. En la actualidad la tiene un negocio de joyería que trabaja hace 3 años, inicviando este negocio con su hermana.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra de oxigeno, oro y otras erramientas, posterior a la elaboración de sus joyas las saldrá a vender a diferentes ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concuvinato y tiene un hijo. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The Azucenas Community Bank will be starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the Villa Exaltación headquarters. This group is comprised of 8 members, and its president is Ms. Rosario. These women have different business, selling things like candy, cakes, natural remedies, stockings, hand-woven sweaters, jewelry, and bricks. One member has an electrician shop.

Ms. Rosario, president of the group, states that she has been a part of the community bank with Pro Mujer for a year. She currently owns a jewelry making business, which she has had for three years. She started this business with her sister.

The loan that is being requested will be used to purchase oxygen, gold, and other tools necessary to make jewelry, which she will sell at different markets. This job allows her to generate the funds she needs to support her family, since she has a live-in partner and a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training.

loans.use: to purchase oxygen, gold, and other tools necessary for jewelry making.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in the Sinkor Area. Her husband is a businessman and they have four children between the ages of 5 and 20, three of whom attend school.

Sarah has been operating her charcoal business for the past five years. She enjoys doing this business because she makes a lot of profit. Sarah is requesting a loan to purchase 150 bags of charcoal for her business. She hopes to have her own coal warehouse in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 150 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is from the village of Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is 26 years old, married and has two infant children. To make a living, Joy runs a clothing sales business in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Joy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP with which she will purchase more clothes for her clothing business. This will be her 1st loan taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her clothing business.

loans.name: Asaad

texts.ar: اسعد عمره 24 سنة هو رجل غير متزوج يعمل في بيع وصيانة وتأجير اجهزة الكومبيوتر له في عمله 8 سنوات يحب العمل ويسعى دائما الى تطويره والاعتماد على نفسه في زيادة مدخول عمله وتطوير نفسه وخاصة انه يساعد اهله في تكملة احتياجاتهم فهو محب للعائلة يريد دائما ان يكون الروابط الاسرية بينه وبين اهله يريدم من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة ومعدات للصيانة للمحل له تاريخ جيد في مصلحته حيث انه استطاع ان يطور نفسه ولكن لا ينقصه سوى المادة حتى يقوم بدعم مصلحته وزيادة مدخوله وخاصة انه في طور بناء عائلة هو انسان طموح يتميز عن الآخرين بحبه لهذا العمل وخاصة لقلته في محيطه ولكن ما ينقصه هو المادة فقط يحلم بتوسيع عمله حتى يصبح مركز صيانة كبير يضم جميع انواع الكومبيوترات
texts.en: Asaad is 24 years old and unmarried. He works in the selling, maintenance and leasing of computers and has eight years experience in this. He loves his business and is constantly aspiring to improve it and independently increase his income and progress himself. He also helps towards his family's living costs as he loves them and wants to ensure that he maintains family ties. With this loan he wants to purchase new stock and maintenance equipment for  his store. His business has a good reputation but he lacks the finances necessary to support it and thereby increase his income as he is in the process of settling down with his own family. He is ambitious, and is distinguished from others by his love for his business. He dreams of expanding his it so that it can become a big maintenance and repair centre for all types of computers.

loans.use: to purchase new stock and maintenance equipment for his computer repair and leasing store.

loans.name: Mahabadhan's Group

texts.en:
Mahabadhan is the leader of this group. She is 59 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she has raised two sons; the first son works as a cook in Osh and the second works in a brick factory. Mahabadhan and her husband are engaged in farming. Twenty-two years ago they sold part of their harvest and purchased cattle. Since that moment they have been breeding cattle. 

Mahabadhan applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase more cattle. She believes that the loan will help her to realize the plan and she will repay the loan successfully. In the future she wishes to build a new house for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit lives in Yerevan with her son. She is divorced and she brings up her son herself. Lilit is a chemist and she has worked as a laboratory assistant for a long time.

Because chemistry was not profitable, Lilit decided to start her own business. Since 2009, Lilit has run a confectionery, producing in her own place. She is producing eastern confection and other candies, with the help of her son. Lilit distributes her production to Yerevan food shops, and thanks to profit from her business, she paid for her son’s education and makes their living conditions better.
 
In the next week, Lilit is going to see off her son to the Armenian army, so she said it will be difficult to cope with business alone, but she is confident that she will manage her job well until her son returns from the army.

Lilit asks for a 600.000 Armenian dram loan to buy a new oven, flour and sugar supplies for her production.

loans.use: to buy a new oven, flour and sugar supplies for her production.

loans.name: Uuganbayr

texts.en:
Uuganbayr is 26 years old and lives with his wife and infant child in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in the Hovd province of Mongolia. 

He manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business in 2010 with his truck. He used to operate a car wash service before. At that time he learned to conduct a business operation and gained much experience. 

He is planning to have an auto part selling business soon. His wife will take charge of that business. He is a polite man who is planning to expand his business. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his new business.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Asunción”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 65 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos independientes. No cuenta con estudios.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace cuatro años.  Su primer préstamo, que fue por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, lo invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. animales caseros.  Paralelamente se dedica a la venta D.  juguetes, aunque no es su principal actividad, esta actividad le permite tener otros ingresos.
Con este nuevo préstamo D. S/  1,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará una docena D. juguetes D. todo tamaño.  En el negocio le ayuda su hija.
Su sueño es seguir operando en el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank “Virgen D. la Asunción”, which is located in the district and province of Yunguyo in the department of Puno.  She is 65 years old, married, and has 5 children who are all independent.  She did not receive an education.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 4 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, and she invested this sum in her business selling domesticated animals.  In addition, she has a business selling toys.  Although this is not her main activity, it allows her to have some additional income.

With this new loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles, she will buy a dozen units of toys of different sizes.  Her daughter helps her with this business.  

Juana's dream is to continue to run her business and increase her income.

What she likes most about the communal bank are the meetings.

loans.use: to buy a dozen units of toys of different sizes

loans.name: C4831 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Eugenie is 37 years old and is married with two children aged 13 and 14. Among her family only Eugenie works, so she has to work hard in order to  provide everything that is necessary for her family.

Eugene sells foodstuffs such as bananas, Irish potatoes, and beans. Eugene is also the leader of her borrower group which is called "Tuzamurane." The group is made up of three women and two men and most of them are in the business of selling foodstuffs.

Eugenie and her group have requested a loan in order to buy more inventory so as to expand their businesses. Once they have grown their businesses, they hope to satisfy their customers and to save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, potatoes,beans and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome ao sul de Moçambique, viuva e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 4 são maiores de idade e um esta a estudar. Fez a 12ª classe e se formou como professora. vive na casa propria com a  sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, é professora ha mais de 37 anos e tem um salario de 7.300.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já fez emprestimo no BIM, para iniciar a sua obra e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que também é cliente e este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 17.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao DE CASA PARA HABITACAO(cimento, areia, pedra, vidros, e outros ). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de : 10.300.00mt, 10.400.00mt, 13.500.00mt, e 17.000.00mt, também para a sua obra.  
Sonha em concluir a sua casa e mobiliar, para oferecer melhor conforto a sua familia, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Beatriz was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique.  She completed school through the 12th grade and received a teaching degree.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she does not support anyone else. 

She has never lived anywhere other than Maputo.  She has been a professor for more than 37 years and earns 7.300.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses and savings in her bank account (BIM). 

She previously had a loan with BIM to start her construciton project and she paid it off without any problems.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend sho is also a client.  This is her 5th loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 17.000.00mt, which she plans to use to purchase construction materials for a room in her home (cement, sand, stones, glass, etc.) The other loans were for 10.300.00mt, 10.400.00mt, 13.500.00mt, and 17.000.00mt, also for the construction project.  

She dreams of completing construction on her home and furnishing it, to provide greater comfort for her family.  She plans to request additional loans from Hluvuku for this purpose.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for a room in her home (cement, sand, stones, glass, etc.)

loans.name: Aldarmaa

texts.en:
Aldarmaa is a taxi driver.  She is 39 years old.   She lives with her husband and 4 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She has requested a loan to help her son Zoljargal, 19,  to start his own wheel repair business. Zoljargal has been interested in auto mechanic since he was a child. 

Aldarmaa and her husband always promote the initiatives of their kids. Starting this new business is absolutely important and beneficial for this family's income. But there is a financial issue of purchasing the necessary service equipment.  Therefore, Aldarmaa is taking a loan to purchase the equipment for a wheel repair service business.

loans.use: buy equipment to start a wheel repair business

loans.name: 5 Dong Ve Group

texts.en:
Hà is providing wine to pubs. She is applying for a loan to purchase materials to make wine to sell. Hà has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is her lack of capital.

Hà is 41 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 5 Dong Ve solidarity group. She lives with 2 dependents and works in T. Hoa city, a semi-urban area in T. Hoa province.

This is Hà's first loan with T. Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
 
With her business profit, Hà hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase material to make wine to sell

loans.name: Adriano

texts.pt:
Nasceu na  cidade de Xai-Xai, provincia de Gaza , sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos todos maiores de idade. Fez a 6ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais dois netos que vivem com ele. 
Saiu da sua terra natal em busca de melhores condiçoes de vida, trabalha como empregado domestico, ha mais de 10 anos e tem um salario de 3.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao DE UMA CASA (areia, ferro, chapas, cimento, pedra, e outros.) para dar continuidade sua obra. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 8.500.00mt, e 15.000.00mt para cobrir as dispesas do casamento, seu e do seu filho.
No futuro vai solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua obra e oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Adriano was born in the city of Xai-Xai, in the province of Gaza, in the south of Mozambique, is married and the father of 4 children, all adults. He completed 6th grade and didn’t continue his education due to a lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his family and also supports two grandchildren who live with him.

He left his homeland in search of a better quality of life and has worked as an employee in a private residence for more than 10 years. He has a monthly salary of 3,000.00 meticals (MZN) which he spends on household expenditures and saves in his bank account.

He has never had loans with other banks and heard of Hluvuku through friends who are also clients. This is his third loan with Hluvuku and will be for the value of 10,000.00 MZN, with which he intends to purchase construction materials for a house (sand, iron, sheets, cement, stone and others) to continue his building work. His first loans were for: 8,500.00 MZN and 15,000.00 MZN to cover the expenses of his and his son’s weddings.

In future he will solicit higher amounts in order to complete his construction work and offer his family a higher level of comfort. He will request these loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (sand, iron, sheets, cement, stone and others)

loans.name: Amy Badiane

texts.fr: L'empreuteuse est une femme mariée qui pratique le commerce de tissus et de chaussures. Elle fait aussi de la restauration.Son commerce lui permet d'appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des frais d'entretien de leur famille.Elle sollicite un pret DE 250000 F à l'UIMCEC pour acheter 36 paires de chaussures, des tissus "thioub" et augmenter son fonds de roulement.Cet investissement devra lui rapporter un bénéfice assez consistant de 104 000F.
texts.en:
This borrower is a married woman who sells fabrics and shoes. She also works in the restaurant business. Her activities allow her to help her husband with the family expenses. 

She is seeking a loan of 250,000F from her U-IMCEC branch to increase her working capital and buy 36 pairs of shoes as well as some "thioub" fabrics. She expects to earn a substantial profit of 104,000F.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy 36 pairs of shoes as well as some thioub fabrics

loans.name: Maribel Alexandra

texts.es:
Maribel Alexandra tiene treinticuatro años de edad vive en unión libre  tiene dos hijos, vive con  el esposo y con los hijos de siete y cinco años de edad en el cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
LA VRC SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, Parroquia puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz.
Maribel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol las compras y las ventas las realiza en san Jacinto. Solicita el Crédito para invertir en la agricultura, comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos y posterior venderlos a un buen precio.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá comprar los insumos agrícolas sin ningún tipo de problema.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuente son: la competencia, las plagas, enfermedades que se dan en los cultivos. El sueño para los próximos 5 años es no tener deudas y poder comprar una casa para poder vivir cómodamente  y un carro para transportar los productos.
En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar pelota, coser y tratar de pasar mucho tiempo con los hijos.
texts.en:
Maribel Alexandra is 34 years old and is in a common-law marriage.  She lives with her husband and their two children, ages 7 and 5, in the Ventanas canton in the province of Ríos.  The communal bank San Nicolas is located in the San Nicolás precinct and the Puerto Pechiche parish in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.  The members of this bank work in agriculture and plant short cycle crops such as corn. 

Maribel works in agriculture and grows corn, rice, and beans.  She does her buying and selling in San Jacinto.  She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte [an herbicide], fertilizers, and weedkillers to keep her crops in good condition and thus, sell them for a good price.  The loan will be a great help to her as she will be able to buy the agricultural supplies without any problems.  The challenges that she frequently faces are: competition, insects, and  crop diseases. Her dream for the next 5 years is to not have any debt and to be able to buy a house, where she can live comfortably, and a car to transport her products.  In her free time, she likes to play ball, sew and try to spend a lot of time with her children.

loans.use: buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte [an herbicide], fertilizers, and weedkillers.

loans.name: Wito Group

texts.en:
Audax, who is in his late 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school.  He has had a welding business for nine years now.  He works from 6 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a really good monthly profit.

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to purchase the missing items in his workshop and for household expenses and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to increase his stock of welding equipment. His dream is to one day be able to buy a plot of land.

His will share this loan with his loan group "Wito", which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase welding equipment

loans.name: Jogly Josia

texts.es:
Jogly tiene 23 años, esta acompañado con un hijo.
A la edad de 9 años, él empezó a tomar fotografías y a apoyar a su mamá en la toma de fotografías y video, entre otros.  Jogly tiene 14 años de dedicarse a este trabajo y cuenta que con el transcurso del tiempo ha aprendido mucho, y esa es su fuente de ingresos de la cual mantiene a su familia, al mismo tiempo que trabaja también continua con sus estudios.
Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para terminar de construir una habitación, baños lavables, ducha, una pila, el techo y pago de mano de obra. Estos materiales los comprara en una ferretería de una ciudad del oriente del país.
Con esta inversión Jogly, proporcionara a su familia una mejor condición de vida, podrá tener una habitación mas segura para su hijo de tres años de edad y su esposa. Él actualmente posee un baño de fosa, pero necesita un baño lavable, para mayor comodidad.
Él desea tener su propia fotoestudio, mejorar el equipo para realizar su trabajo, y tener mejor calidad de vida. Continuar trabajando con Fundación Campo y tener una cultura de ahorro.
texts.en:
Jogly is 23 years old. He has a partner and a son. When he was nine years old, he began taking pictures and helping his mother with photography and videography, among other things. Jogly has been doing this work for fourteen years and says that over time he has learned a lot. This is the source of income that he uses to support his family. Along with working, he is also continuing with his schooling. 

He is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to complete the construction of a room, including flush toilets, a shower, a sink, the roof, and labor costs. He will purchase these materials from a hardware store in a city in the eastern part of the country. This investment will allow Jogly to provide his family with a higher standard of living, and he will have a safer room for his three-year-old son and his wife. He currently has a pit toilet, but he needs a flush toilet for increased convenience. 

He would like to have his own photography studio, upgrade the equipment that he uses in his work, and have a better quality of life. He would also like to continue working with Fundación Campo and maintain a savings mindset.

loans.use: to complete the construction of a room, including flush toilets, a shower, a sink, the roof, and labor costs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter a 29 year old man who is married and has two children ages three and seven.  He sells clothes, mainly jean trousers, to earn a living.  He has two years of experience in the business.  Besides this, he does farming for extra income.  Even though he runs his business in a competitive environment, he is able to retain his customers because of his good customer care skills.  He thanks to Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer care. Peter hopes to own a permanent business premise in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy jean trousers.

loans.use: To buy jean trousers to sell.

loans.name: Philoméne

texts.fr:
Philomène est une mère de famille âgée de 33 ans et mère de 3 enfants.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis 02/09/2008 et fait parti du groupe de solidarité  sope sa jeker.

Philomène pratique du petit commerce plus précisément  la vente de céréales( mil maïs arachides)
elle vend également des habits déjà confectionnés.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 250.000 francs Cf a elle va acheter du mil , du maïs 10 paires de chaussures et 10 habits pré-confectionnés  destinées à la revente.

A l'aide de ses bénéfices elle va acheter du riz de l'huile et du sucre à la fin de chaque mois pour ses enfants. 

Elle va également acheter des médicaments pour sa famille en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
Philomena is a 33-year-old mother of three children. She has been a member of the local "Banc Villageois" association since September 2008 and is part of the "sope sa jeker" solidarity group.

Philomena practices small retail trading, specifically dealing with cereals (millet, maize, peanuts). She also sells ready-to-wear clothes.

With her new loan of 250,000 XOF she will buy millet, maize, 10 pairs of shoes and 10 ready-to-wear ​​clothes for resale.

Using the profits she will buy rice, oil and sugar at the end of each month for her children. She will also buy medication for her family in case of illness.

loans.use: buy millet and maize for resale

loans.name: Raghda

texts.en:
Raghda is a 30-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Raghda sells clothes and she is requesting a loan of 1200 JD to to purchase clothes to sell.

Raghda is looking to open a shop for her business and improve her family life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue, 47, is married and has two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a taxi driver. Hue supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business seven years ago. She sells soft drinks, cakes, shampoo and other household items to people in her community. 

Hue is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, such as cakes and soft drinks, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, such as cakes and soft drinks, to stock her store

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 30 years old single with no children. She is a teacher by profession and it is a job she loves doing. Her family goal is to be able to pay school fees in the future for her children and also upgrade her own studies. Her business goal is to buy land and grow crops. Martha needs a loan to pay her school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks, feed and medicines.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is forty years old, married, and has six children.

Elisapeta owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Elisapeta needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 700 talas or US $292 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Elisapeta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks.  This is Elisapeta's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is married and is 57 years old. He has been a farmer and also business man for all his life. He has a family of 6 children where four of them are married and the other two are studying at the school and help him with the business. Francisco purchases and sells fruit, but most of the fruit is from his farm. In 1996 he started his business, because he learned about business helping his parents since he was a child. He adapts a small store in his home to sell his products and he goes to the city to offer his products in his truck. His family sells in his home, while he goes to the city to offer in small barrels his merchandise to customers. Francisco is requesting a loan of US$ 650 to repair his truck and to makeover his store. He is offering to pay this loan in 6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Francisco esta casado y tiene 57 años de edad. El es agricultor y comerciante de toda la vida, tiene una familia compuesta por 6 hijos, 4 de los cuales ya están casados y los 2 restantes asisten a la escuela y ayudan con el negocio. Francisco compra y vende fruta, mucha de la cual cultiva directamente en su tierra. En 1996 el empezó su negocio, aprendiendo todo este giro desde su niñez ayudando a sus padres. Hace poco adapto en su domicilio un lugar para la venta de sus productos y mientras el sale a ofrecer sus productos en su camioneta en la ciudad, su familia se queda a cargo del negocio en casa, el ofrece en la ciudad su mercancía en cubetas aprovechando la calidad de fruta cosechada en su tierra. Francisco esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 650 para poder reparar su camioneta y mejorar la presentación de su local, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses.

loans.use: To repair his truck and paint his store

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate sells variety of foods in her community, Pantang, Ghana, where she lives. She sells local meals such as rice-and-stew, beans-and-gari, a product from cassava, yam-and-stew, etc.

She sells in a very poor structure, and due to this her clients feel insecure when eating. She wants to build a safe structure where she can sell and serve her customers. She needs a loan of $750 from Kiva to enable her put up this structure.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A., 25, belongs to the Acholi tribe. She was born in Atiak county, Kal parish, in the Amuru district. Beatrice lost her father and an uncle and was forced to flee to Gulu town by the Lord's Resistance Army, which made her face terrible hardships. Beatrice is the firstborn, and she lost her father at a tender age.

Since 1998 Beatrice has been involved in and earned a small living doing voluntary work with the Ugandan Red Cross Society and later with the Charity for Peace center. In 2006, she registered as a Life in Africa member and is currently committed to her work with that community.

Beatrice is single and a tailor by profession. She participates in Life in Africa crafts programmes making bracelets, paper beads, bags fashioned from drinking straws, and so on.

Her plan is to spend 250,000= (shillings) on second-hand clothes. Her younger sister Concy will sell the clothes, and Beatrice will continue with her crafts. This will increase her income by 340,000= per month.

She plans to repay in 6 months.

Below is her budget plan:

A bale of second-hand clothes.......................=180,000=

Loading fee...............................................3,000=

Off loading.................................................3,000=

Market dues..........................................9,000=@month

Salary..................................250,000=

loans.use: Purchasing second hand clothes

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a very active and entrepreneurial woman. She is married and has four children. For five years she has sold curtains and blankets. She started her business because you need it extra income to help her husband with some of the debt of his home. Thanks to the pleasure she finds is selling and to her character that makes it easy to relate to other people, Silvia has been able to grow her business and increase her sales. The assistance of her family has also been an important factor in the development of this business.

Silvia is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise. With this, she expects to be able to meet the demands of her customers and to continue doing what she likes most. She promises to repay this amount in three months. Please contributes to the growth of this business. Silvia and her family much appreciate your trust and help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia es una mujer muy activa y emprendedora, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a vender cortinas y colchas, inició con su negocio ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para poder ayudar a su esposo con las deudas de su hogar. Gracias al gusto que tiene por las ventas y a su carácter que le facilita relacionarse con los demás, Silvia ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar sus ventas, el apoyo de su familia también ha sido indispensable para el desarrollo de este negocio.

Silvia ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, con lo que espera poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar con su preferencia, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, Silvia y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Hidogul

texts.en:
Hidogul R. is a pretty young businesswoman. Her little shop of children's clothes is located in the station ”Abreshim”, Khujand. She is herself a young mother of two. Her younger son is 8 months old.

Hidogul loves children very much and she likes her business. She buys her goods from Istaravshan, and her mother looks after her baby at home. Her husband helps with transportation of her goods. Her turnover is fast because she has many faithful customers. For the coming autumn season she wants to purchase modern warm clothes for children. She is requesting a loan of US$ 1,200 for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal goods to augment her inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria is 60 years old. Through her hard work and sacrifice she has raised her children and given them a good education. Today, she continues tirelessly to proviD. for her grandchildren who live with her. She and her daughter-in-law run a small grocery and butcher shop. The daughter-in-law tends the shop while Victoria handles the business of selling meat. Sadly, the family finances have taken a severe turn recently when Victoria's 8-year-old grandson was diagnosed with leukemia. They have exhausted their small savings taking him to Lima for treatment. Victoria has a plan to finance his treatment but needs capital in order to carry it out. With a loan of $375 hopes to bring meat from Tarma to Lima to sell while she stays with him through his treatment. Please help this family as they hope and work for their grandson's speedy recovery and return home.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Victoria D. 60 años D. edad, es una incansable madre D. familia, que con su esfuerzo y sacrificio, pudo brindarles una adecuada educación a sus hijos y ahora continua con ese mismo ánimo diligente apoyando a sus nietos que viven junto a ella. Ella posee una bodega junto a su nuera, quien generalmente la administra mientras ella se dedica íntegramente a la comercialización D. carnes; la realidad cambió drásticamente con la noticia D. que su nieto D. 8 años sufre D. leucemia, por lo cual utilizando los pocos ahorros tuvieron que llevarlo a Lima para su tratamiento.Con este nuevo reto desea comercializar carne en la ciudad D. Lima, llevándolo desD. Tarma, para así poder contribuir con su pequeño nieto, y también visitarlo periódicamente para atenderlo.
