Para ello necesita la suma D. 375 dólares, con los cuales pondrá en marcha sus planes.Ayudemos a doña Ana para que su pequeño nieto se recupere y pronto pueda regresar a casa con su familia

loans.use: To finance a butcher shop and pay for medical travel.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Trí, 38 years old, joined TYM fund in 1997. Her first loan was 50 usd which was invested in a small pig breeding farm. The result was quite encouraging so she continued borrowing more money from TYM to invest in the business. With time and experience, it has become successful. On top of pig breeding, she also has a fish pond (1 acre in superficial area) and a few dozens ducks. Her revenue is about 125 usd a month. She's requesting a loan of 625 usd to expand her breeding farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1997 với mức vay đầu tiên là 50USD chị Nguyễn Thị Trí, 38 tuổi, đã đầu tư vào mô hình chăn nuôi nhỏ. Kết quả thu được bước đầu từ chăn nuôi giúp chị thêm phần tự tin và mạnh dạn tăng dần đồng vốn vay từ Quỹ. Với những kinh nghiệm tích lũy được chị Trí đầu tư ngày càng có hiệu quả. Bên cạnh việc chăn nuôi lợn chị còn đầu tư vào 1 mẫu ao cá và vài chục con vịt. Hiện nay mức thu nhập của chị Trí là 125USD/tháng. Dự định trong thời gian tới chị sẽ xin vay 625USD để mở rộng chăn nuôi, tăng thu nhập.

loans.use: Buy mash, fishes

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Mrs Basilia formerly worked as a homemaker, but circumstances in her life changed when her husband lost his job. Faced with this situation, she decided to invest her savings in the bulk purchase of onions and peppers. In the beginning, she sold these products in the market bus terminals.

She says that the financial support of CEPRODEL has been fundamental in the development of her business. The unconditional support and financing have allowed her to purchase merchandise, offer a better price to her customers, and now have a small location of her own to sell from.

One of her goals is to improve the conditions of her location, replacing the roof which is now made of plastic, and to improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Basilia anteriormente se dedicaba a atender su hogar pero por imprevistos de la vida su esposo pierde su empleo, ante esta situación decide el invertir sus ahorros en la compra de Cebollas y Chiltoma al por mayor, anteriormente para realizar la venta de sus productos los comercializa ambulante en las terminales de buses del mercado.

Considera que el aporte financiero de CEPRODEL ha sido fundamental en el desarrollo de su negocio quien la apoya incondicionalmente y que través de los financiamiento le permiten la compra de mercadería al contado, ofrece un mejor precio a sus clientes y actualmente cuenta con un pequeño local en donde ofrece su mercadería.

Una de sus metas es mejorar las condiciones de su local, cambiar el techo ya que actualmente es de plástico y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga Portilla is the owner and operator of a small grocery store called, “Lusito.” For five years now she has run this store to help contribute to her family income, pay the bills of the home her and her husband own, and to raise her four children.

Dominga wishes to increase the amount and variety of merchandise stocked in her store. Currently her store is in a good location and she has a good amount of clientele. In order to keep improve business, Dominga is asking for a loan to purchase popular, everyday goods like yerba, sugar, flour, rice and refreshments.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and goods for her store.

loans.name: Bombay 1C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Maureen N.. She is currently in the business of selling milk and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge to increase the quantity of milk sold. Maureen is 49 years old and is divorced. She has 4 children ranging from age 19 to 25 and her children go to school. Each week, Maureen makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Maureen has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Maureen is joined in her small group by Agnes M., Nulu N., Gladys S., and Zula N.. Agnes M. has a business running a retail shop and wants to increase stock. Nulu N. is currently operating a business selling snacks and wants a loan to invest in the business. Gladys S. operates a business of poultry keeping and wants to purchase more poultry birds. Zula N. is currently in the business of selling snacks and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To boost milk business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She needs a loan to purchase merchandise and other products that are on sale.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma has been a member of Banco Comunal Kuskanchik for 3 years.

Vilma is 28 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children. Vilma used to sell food but has her revenue dropped, she started selling vegetables at the Santa Berta market, an activity which she als discontinued as it didn‘t generate sufficient income. Vilma currently sells vegetables wholesale at the Ayacucho forest. She buys her goods at the grocery market in the city of Ayacucho and transports them to the forest in a rental car.

Vilma needs a loan of $1,100 to invest in the purchase of celery, carrots, onions, tomatoes and lemons.

She will use her savings to purchase land and build a house. Vilma has three dreams: to have her own car to transport her goods, to develop her business and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik hace 3 años.

Vilma es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Vilma en un inicio vendía comida pero como bajaron sus ingresos cambio de negocio y comenzó a vender verduras en el mercado Santa Berta actividad que dejo de realizar porque no le generaban buenos ingresos. Actualmente Vilma vende verduras al por mayor en la selva ayacuchana, sus productos los adquiere en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y lo transporta a la Selva en un carro alquilado.

Vilma necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de apio, zanahoria, cebolla, tomate y limones.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará para comprar un terreno y construir su casa. Los sueños de Vilma son tener un carro para transportar sus productos, surtir más su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of celery, carrots, onions, tomatoes and lemons

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is a widow with 7 children. She has sold soft drinks and grocery products like biscuits, candies, bread, etc for 3 years now. She used to be a baker but was advised by medical doctors to stop baking because of the heat. To enable her to earn a living, she started trading in soft drinks and some grocery products. She wants to use the loan to buy more crates of soft drinks and grocery products to expand her operation. Adwoa is a member of the group called Maranatha. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy crates of soft drinks and some grocery products

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud, 44, is a married man and has 3 children who are enrolled in school. He owns a grocery shop close to the place he lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to pay the school bills of his children. This is the second time Mahmoud has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He successfully repaid his previous loan on time.

loans.use: to pay his children's school bills

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 38 years old and is the mother of 4 four children, who are her reason to continue to advance in life. Rosa cultivates camu camu (citrus fruit native of her region), and she has also a small mom and pop shop at her house. Her husband Constantino, supports Rosa on all of her goals and aspirations, he already retired. Rose’s desire is to increase the quantity of seeds of camu camu, and in the future export these products rich in vitamin C. In order to accomplish this she needs a capital investment that will help her make her dreams come true. Let’s support this mother of four, who with effort and earnestness continues to work hard.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa tiene 38 años y es madre de 4 cuatro niños, quienes son su razón de seguir adelante, se dedica al cultivo de camu camu (fruto cítrico nativo de su región), adicionalmente tiene una pequeña bodega de abarrotes en su casa, su esposo Constantino, la apoya en todas sus aspiraciones, él ya se jubiló y es pensionista. El deseo de Rosa es incrementar la cantidad de semillas de camu camu, y en un futuro cercano, exportar estos productos tan ricos en vitamina C, para eso, necesita de un capital que levantará sus ganas de seguir adelante y ver crecer lo que desea. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y ahínco sigue trabajando duro.

loans.use: To purchase camu camu seeds in order to increase production.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
Elida is a businesswoman, married to Juan Valdez, they have 2 school-aged children. They have had a general store located in their home in Luque city for 2 years. There they serve their neighbors and other customers with basic needs items such as: meat, sugar, milk products, rice, noodles, vegetables, and more.

In addition Juan sells gas, which he delivers to the snack bars, restaurants, and private businesses in the truck that they own, thereby helping with the income that supports their home.

The loan that she seeks will be used to buy general merchandise for the store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Elida es comerciante, esta casada con el señor Juan Valdez, tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar, poseen una despensa ubicada en su domicilio en la ciudad de Luque hace 2 años, allí surte a sus vecinos y ocasionales de mercaderías de primera necesidad tales como: carne, azúcar, lácteos, arroz, fideo, verduras y otros.

Además el señor Juan se dedica a la venta de gas, los cuales reparte a los copetines, comedores y particulares en la camioneta que poseen, ayudando con ese ingreso al sustento de su hogar.

El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de mercaderías.

loans.use: Buy meat, beverages, milk products, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Taitu

texts.en:
Taitu S. is a 57 year old wife and mother. She has four children, who are all in school. She has been a food vendor for fifteen years. She prepares and sells wakye, which is a local dish prepared from rice and eaten with all kinds of sauces. It is a delicacy that many Ghanaian enjoy everyday as either breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. With this loan, she wants to buy more vegetables, rice, cooking oil, and assorted meat and fish. She hopes this loan would help her increase her savings to improve her family's wellbeing. She would be very grateful for that assistance.

Taitu belongs to a group called Ntoboase Trust Group, meaning patience. The group members assist one another to repay their loans on time.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, cooking oil, vegetables, meats, and fish.

loans.name: Sabra's Group

texts.en:
Sabra M. is 27 years old and married with two children, ages one and six. She opened her own shop in Zanzibar seven years ago. She sells a wide variety of items, including juice, charcoal, firewood, and food. She is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $60.

Sabra is hoping that her first loan with BRAC Tanzania enables her to expand her inventory and increase her profit. She will use the loan to buy more food and charcoal to sell in her shop. Sabra shares this loan with her fellow group members, Sabiha, Riziki, Zaituni, and Fatma.

loans.use: To buy more food and charcoal to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed is a 52-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh in souther suburbs of Lebanon. Mohamed works in a sewing factory. He has requested a loan of $500 from Al Majmoua to purchase new merchandise.

loans.use: Mohamed needs the loan to purchase more capital

loans.name: Fatou Léna

texts.fr: Cette dame est une maréyeuse. Elle est dpuis plusieurs années dans la vente du poisson qu'elle achéte au quai de pêche de Boudody à l'ouest de Ziguinchor. Avec son commerce elle soutient son mari et contribue à l'entretien de sa nombreuse famille. Elle demande ce crédit pour renforcer ses activités.
texts.en:
This woman is a wholesale fish merchant. For several years she has been in the fish selling business. She buys the fish on the Boudody dock, west of Ziguinchor. With her business she supports her husband and contributes to her large family's upkeep. She is requesting this loan to strengthen her activitivites.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish selling

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Muraho (hello) from Jean N. in Kicukiro District, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Jean is 33 years old and married with 1 child.

This entrepreneur has been a taxi driver for two years and a half but what is amazing is that he has got his own car that he is using as a taxi.

Jean is requesting a loan worth 515 000 rwf, which will help him to replace some spare parts for his taxi. He will be paying back this loan over 8 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: having some spare parts replaced

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Mr. Sao S. lives in Lvea village in Takeo province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Soen Nim, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to grow rice during the dry season. Thus, Mr. Sao S. decided to ask for a loan to help his wife cultivate rice. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan. He is a 29-year-old father of a child who is too young to work or study. His wife is also shown with him in the picture.

loans.use: to cultivate rice in the dry season

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: La Sra Marta tiene 57 años de edad, ella tiene su propio taller de costura para confeccionar prendas, camisas, faldas, pantalones, chaquetas, hace 33 años se dedica a este negocio, ella desde muy temprano comienza con el trabajo para poder entregar a tiempo sus pedidos, ella es muy agradable, sonriente y muy dedicada a su trabajo, la sra a veces solo cobra la mano de obra ya que los clientes le llevan todos los materiales para que tranaje, pero en otros casos a ella le toca comprar los materiales, ella vive con su madre y pasa al cuidado de ella ya que esta enferma, es soltera y necesita el credito para comprar una maquina de cocer nueva ya que se le arruino la que tenia por muchos años, tambien necesita comprar botones, hilos, aceite, encajes, zippers, su meta para este año es trabajar mas y poder contrar una persona que le ayude a la costura.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marta is 57 years old. She has her own sewing workshop, where she makes garments, shirts, skirts, pants, and jackets. She has spent 33 years in this business. She begins working very early so that she can deliver her orders on time. She is very friendly, cheerful, and is very dedicated to her work. She sometimes only covers her labor since her clients bring the materials for her to work on, but in other cases, she buys the materials. She lives with her mother and takes care of her because she is sick. She is single and needs this loan to buy a new sewing machine since the one that she had for many years is ruined. She also needs to buy buttons, thread, oil, lace, and zippers. Her goal for this year is to work more and to be able to hire a person to help her with sewing.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, fabric, brooches, thread, buttons, lace, and zippers

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: KARINA DE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERA Y ACTUALMENTE VIVE EN LA CASA DE SUS PADRES. NO TIENE DEPENDIENTES O HIJOS. PARALELAMENTE A SUS ESTUDIOS ELLA SE DEDICA A COMERCIALIZAR ARTICULOS DE USO PERSONAL COMO MAQUILLAJE, JOYAS Y OTROS. CON LOS INGRESOS QUE GENERA ESTA ACTIVIDAD AYUDA CON LOS GASTOS EN SU CASA Y TAMBIÉN LE SIRVEN PARA PAGAR SUS ESTUDIOS. TIENE UNA EXPERIENCIA DE 3 AÑOS EN ESTE RUBRO. Y SI BIEN LA COMPETENCIA ES ELEVADA LA DEMANDA ES IGUAL YA QUE SU PRINCIPAL MERCADO ES EL FEMENINO. EL PRESENTE CRÉDITO ES PARA INCREMENTAR SU MERCADERÍA. NO TIENE ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS EN EL SISTEMA FINANCIERO.
texts.en:
Karina is 24 years old, single, and currently lives in her parents' home. She does not have any dependents or children. Along with her studies, she sells personal products like makeup, jewelry and other goods. With the income she generates, she helps with the household costs and also pays for her studies. She has three years of experience in this field. If the competition is high, the demand is equal, since her principal market is female. The current loan is to increase her merchandise. She does not have any negative history in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Usmonboy

texts.ru: Усмонбою исполнилось 20 лет, еще не женат и проживает с родителями. После окончания школы сразу начал заниматься бизнесом на местных рынках. Он покупает и продает сухофрукты. Первый капитал для расширения своей деятельности получил от своего отца, который помог ему освоить этот нелегкий бизнес. Узнав о МикроИнвест, Усмонбой решил попробовать получив займ и поработать с ним. На полученный займ собирается закупить компотную смесь, на которую имеет заказ
texts.en:
Usmonboy has turned 20, he is not married yet and lives with parents. After graduation from school he has started his own business selling on the local markets. He buys and sells dry fruits. He got his first capital for start up and expansion of business from his father who helped him learn this somewhat difficult business. When Usmonboy found out about MicroInvest he decided to try to get a loan and work with it. He will use the loan to buy compote mixture for which he already has an order.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en: Dolly is a 38-year-old woman living in Kfarshima in Mount Lebanon. She has been working in handicrafts since 2003. Today, Dolly is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase inventory in order to increase her production.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: "I was one the unemployed Filipinos who wished to achieve something for myself. It’s really hard if you don't have job. You can't support yourself and your children. Now, I am managing a small parcel of land as a rice farm. I used the 1-hectare (approximately 2.5-acre) lot I inherited from my parents,” says Lolita L., 55-year-old mother of five children. Lolita is asking a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase four sacks of fertilizer and seed. The loan will really help her increase her harvest and her income as well. CEVI gives their clients not just loans, it offers training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase four sacks of fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Eder

texts.es:
El Sr. E. tiene 24 años, es soltero, y vive en alquiler en la ciudad de San Lorenzo. No tiene hijos.

Tiene un puesto de ventas de verduras y frutas en la ciudad de San Lorenzo hace 4 años.  Esta actividad lo heredo de sus padres quienes tambien se dedicaban a esta actividad.

Es una persona que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradece a la Fundaciòn Paraguaya por el apoyo que le ha brindado.

Su deseo es seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Mr E. is 24 years old and single and he rents a place in the city of San Lorenzo. He has no children.

He has had a fruit and vegetable stall in San Lorenzo for four years. His parents also ran a fruit and vegetable stall, and they passed down this activity to him.

He is a person who has come very far in life and he is grateful to the Fundaciòn Paraguaya for the support that they have given him.

His desire is to continue making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetables

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es: Un hombre muy trabajador es Claudio, tiene 40 años, vive con su pareja a quien ama mucho por ser la madre de sus 2 hijos, quienes son el motivo de su orgullo. Por ellos se esforzó en hacer su casa propia para que vivan cómodamente. El cultivo de sus plantas es la única actividad económica que conoce, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde pequeño junto a sus padres. Cuando fue joven tenía el anhelo de ser chofer de transporte de pasajeros, pero como era muy apegado a sus padres jamás salió de su pueblo, hasta que se enamoró y se dio cuenta de que era necesario salir del hogar maternal. Desde entonces con perseverancia y empuje, junto a su esposa se propusieron sembrar sus propios cultivos, los cuales le han resultado muy rentables. Gracias al buen precio en que logró vender sus productos pudo comprar el terreno donde hizo su casa a base de madera y donde ahora le brinda un espacio y comodidad a su familia. Durante estos años como agricultor ha ganado mucha experiencia, por ello, aunque a veces no cuenta con los fertilizantes o pesticidas necesarios, se las ingenia en preparar humos o estiércol de vacunos para ayudar a la buena producción de sus plantas, aunque estos preparados no superen a los fertilizantes químicos. Durante los cuatro créditos anteriores consecutivos demostró puntualidad en sus cuotas con MFP, del mismo modo se compromete a ser puntual con este 5to préstamo. El dinero que viene solicitando lo va a invertir en la compra de 30 sacos de nitrato (abono)  para que proceda a abonar sus chacras de café.
texts.en:
Claudio is a hard-working man. He is 40 years old and lives with his wife. They have two children, who are Claudio's pride. He worked hard to build his own house so that his family could live comfortably. Farming is the only profession that Claudio knows, and he's been working at it since he was a small child learning from his parents. When he was young, Claudio wanted to be a taxi driver, but because he was very close to his parents he never left his hometown. He fell in love there and realized that it was necessary to leave his parents' home. Since then, Claudio and his wife have used perseverance to plant and harvest their own crops, which have been very profitable. Thanks to the good prices at which they sell their products, they were able to buy land and construct their home out of wood. They now have a comfortable space for their family. In his years as a farmer Claudio has accumulated experience, and now when he doesn't have the necessary fertilizers or pesticides he's able to prepare smoke or manure to help improve the crop, even though these aren't as good as chemical fertiilizers. During the four previous loan cycles Claudio has been punctual in his repayments with MFP, and has promised to continue this trend for the fifth loan. The money will go to purchase 30 bags of nitrate fertilizer for his coffee crop.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is 48 years old. She is married and a mother of five children. Three are in school and the others are learning trades. She lives with her children at Sefwi Dwinase in the western region of Ghana. 

Felicia works very hard to provide for her children. She is a baker and bakes bread which she supplies to her loyal customers. For the past fifteen years, she has been baking bread, pastries, and other foods as well as taking care of her household. In spite of the challenges she faces she manages to handle the demand of her customers and successfully meet their requests on time. 

Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials, as prices are shooting up. She requests a loan to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and save more for future eventualities. She said your help is much needed in her life and business.

loans.use: Bakery supplies

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda M., from the village of Anito, M. Camiguin, is 46 years old, single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Nelda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop whose main source of income comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Nelda has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In August 28, 2008, Nelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to invest in expanding the business, she is now requesting a new loan, her fourth from HSPFI, of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. Nelda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her child.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Katia Frida

texts.es:
katia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Bellavista”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 18 años de edad, estado civil soltera, sin hijos y tiene estudios de superiores en contabilidad (4to semestre), vive en Barrio Tupac Amaru Jr. Capitán Morante.

Comienza su trabajo con el movimiento Manuela Ramos, es socia nueva y requiere un  préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles,  para la compra de recuerdos en miniaturas, las mismas que venderá en el mercado de Puno.

Su deseo es terminar su carrera y poner su empresa de miniaturas al por mayor.

A ella le gusta la facilidad que dan en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Katia belongs to the Communal Bank “Santa Cruz de Bellavista”, which is located in the Puno District of Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 18 years old, single, and does not have any children. She is currently studying for a degree in accounting (she is in her 4th semester). Katia lives in the neighborhood of Tupac Amaru Jr. Capitán Morante.

She just started working with Manuela Ramos. As a new member, Katia is requesting her first loan of 500 soles to buy miniature souvenirs similar to those sold in the Puno market.

Katia hopes to finish her studies and start a business selling miniature souvenirs wholesale. She enjoys the ease of how the loans were provided.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase miniature souvenirs

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina C. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 50, married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Carolina owns & operates a food stall. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of fish in the local community. Carolina has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Carolina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carolina repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Carolina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Carolina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Adelia Domitila

texts.es: La señora Adelia, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Triunfadoras”, Distrito D. Bagua GranD., Provincia Utcubamba, Departamento D. Amazonas. Es casada, tiene 57 años, tiene 04 hijos ya  independientes y una hija que esta bajo su cargo.Adelia, es una mujer luchadora y con una capacidad innata para los negocios, desD. muy joven se inició con la venta D. refrescos, sus ganas D. sacar adelante a sus hijos le hicieron pensar en alternativas D. trabajo para mejorar la situación económica D. su casa y es cuando deciD. iniciarse en la venta D. refrescos D. cebada y soya, su negocio lo realiza D. manera ambulatoria ya que tiene clientes que  poco a poco ha ido ganando. En la actualidad su producto es consumido con gran aceptación por los transeúntes, que le compran D. manera diaria, por que ven que el producto que ella expenD. es D. buena calidad,  tiene buena presentación y buen sabor, sobretodo por que son atendidos con  cariño y amabilidad que es lo que ella transmite. Con este préstamo D. S/. 800.00, comprará una maquina D.  moler, jora, envases, Baldes, galones, azúcar por sacos, cebada, soya entre otros,  quiere tener todo lo que necesita para la preparación D. sus refrescos que es su fuente D. ingresos. Adelia, se siente con mucha energía, llena D. ánimos y ganas  D. seguir trabajando, y  aportando en su hogar, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse y seguir creciendo como personas.
texts.en:
Senora Adelia is a member of the group Las Triunfadoras, (The Triumphant), in the district of Bagua GranD. in Amazonas. She is 57 years old, married, and has 4 children. 3 of her children are independent, and one daughter Adelia still supports. Adelia is a hardworking woman with a good business sense. From the time she was very young she began to sell soft drinks. The income she earned helped support her children, and she continued to think about other ways she could improve the economic situation of her household. She decided to expand her business to offer barley and soy drinks, and began selling her beverages around the neighborhood until her customer base began to grow. Every day, many people purchase her drinks while passing by. She offers high quality, good tasting beverages and always treats her customers well. With this loan, she will purchase a blender, jars, glasses, sugar, barley and soy, among other ingredients. She would like to have everything necessary to prepare her drinks as they are her main source of income. Adelia, full of energy and motivated to continue working and supporting her home, is grateful to the organization of Manuela Ramos for giving women like herself opportunities to grow as individuals and improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed to prepare her barley and soy drinks

loans.name: Yolita

texts.es:
Yolita es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora ,tiene 44 años D. edad y es madre D. cinco hijos, tres mayores D. edad y dos menores, se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. segundo uso y tanbien a la costura, ella venD. su mercadería en diferentes caseríos alejados D. la ciudad D. Pucallpa. Cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, que se dedica a construir botes. Es socia hace un año y cuatro meses del banco comunal “Las Gemas ll”, su primer préstamo fue D. 300 soles, el cual invirtió en la venta D. jugos.
Con este préstamo D. 1700 soles, que invertirá una parte en la compra D. telas para la confección D. sabanas y otra parte invertirá en prendas D. vestir D. segundo uso que le envían D. la ciudad D. Lima. Su meta es tener un taller D. costura en su casa y seguir apoyando a su esposo en los gastos D. su familia.
texts.en:
Yolita is a dynamic and hardworking woman; she is 44 years old, and is a mother to five children, two of whom are underage and three are older. She sells second-hand clothing and also sews; she sells her merchandise in various communities located at a distance from the city of Pucallpa. She counts on the support of her husband, who is a boat builder. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Gemas ll” for a year and four months; her first loan was of 300 PEN, which she invested in a juice sales business. With this loan of 1700 PEN, she will invest part of the loan in the purchase of fabrics to make sheets, and the other part will be invested in second-hand clothing that she has sent from the city of Lima. Her goal is to have a sewing shop in her house, and to continue helping her husband with the family’s household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest part of the loan in the purchase of fabrics and the other part in second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Loydith

texts.es: La señora Loydith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Rosales”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 32 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.Loydith, se dedica a la venta de Juanes y para venderlos, Loydith, se dirige todas las tardes, por su barrio y reparte a sus vecinos, amigos o familiares. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, aceites en litros, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios de plástico para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, muy bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.

loans.use: Comprará insumos, para preparar sus juanes.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en:
Adriano is 45 years old. He is married to Rose and they live in the village of Larion Alto, Tuguegaro City, where he has served as a village councilor for three years. They have three children: Aldrin, 18, a college student; Jerom, 16, a high school student; Jamaica, 13, a sophomore high school student.

Adriano has been cultivating a vegetable garden in his backyard for almost ten years. This business has been his partner in sustaining the needs of his family. His wife also assists him by selling the harvested vegetables in their village. Adriano is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds. The loan will help Adriano's family achieve a better way of life.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Shelly

texts.en:
Shelly A. is a Tanzanian businessman. He is married with three school-aged children. He runs a vegetable garden at Tabata Kimanga district in Dar es Salaam, where he grows and sells different types of green vegetables.

Shelly purchases vegetable seeds from agricultural seed shops in the city's shopping center and elsewhere. He sells his vegetables both wholesale and retail. With his business profits, he is able to meet his family's daily needs. Shelly wants to increase production by buying an irrigation water pump that can cover a wide area of irrigation. He needs a loan of 800,000 TZS to buy this equipment.

loans.use: To purchase an irrigation water pump

loans.name: Flora Muthoni

texts.en:
Flora is 32 years old and married with one daughter. She makes curtains and sells them in Riruta center. She has been in the business for a period of two years with a monthly profit of about 20,000 Kenya shillings.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend in her group and she has never borrowed from another MFI before. This is her first loan with KADET and she wants to use the loan to buy materials for making curtains.

She hopes to open another outlet where she will be selling furniture.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: Buying materials for making curtains

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un S., age 50, is a widow with five children. She lives in Phnom Penh. To earn a living, she has been selling rice and food and is able to earn USD $5.00 each day. She is aided by her three of the children who are garment factory workers. 

Un S. is asking for a loan of USD $1200 to purchase more tables, chairs and utensils to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase chairs and tables.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very hard-working woman who lives in Ogbomoso town in Oyo state, Nigeria. She is married with 5 children, and she is 45 years old.

Elizabeth processes and sells garri in her town. She has been in this business for over 20 years and with Lapo Microfinance for the past 2 years. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. Elizabeth is soliciting for a loan of 70,000 to expand her business and meet he customers' needs. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to produce garri to sell

loans.name: Setha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Setha N. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members, each of whom will use the loan for a different purpose. This village bank loan, which consists of seventeen members, is located in Tradak Pong village in Takeo province.

Setha is the mother of three children, two of whom are laborers in a garment factory, while the third is studying in the local public school. She is a vegetable seller, and her husband, Mr. Sym Orm, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to support his family. 

This family has a problem because their house is too old to live in, so they must built a new house. However, they have little money to build this house, so Setha decided to apply for a loan to buy additional bricks. 

All seventeen of the members are shown in the photo, but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy additional bricks

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca se dedica a la Artesanía en Macramé para confeccionar mantas de vicuña para su posterior  comercialización; su esposo trabaja como transportista interprovincial; estas actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso con las que cubren la manutención de su familia. Tienen 1 hijo de 5 años de edad. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Retamas I camino a Viacha  de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción (arena, cemento y estuco) para refacción de su vivienda y así poder vivir mejor . 
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro. El análisis socio-económico le permite solicitar este nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Francisca does macrame making vicuña blankets for subsequent sale. Her husband works in interprovincial transport. These activities are their principal sources of income for the support of their family. They have one child who is 5 years old. Their home is located in the Retamas I zone on the road to Viacha from the city of El Alto.

She will use the loan to buy construction material (sand, cement, and stucco) to repair their house and thus be able to live better.

This is her first loan with Impro. The socio-economic analysis permits her to apply for this new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sand, cement, and stucco to repair their house

loans.name: Serapio Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Serapio Jose, tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero y viven en la ciudad de El Alto en casa familiar, tiene como actividad un punto internet con 20 maquinas, además de tener una tienda de articulos para animales, pues está estudiando para medico veterinario ya esta en octavo semestre de la carrera, es una persona responsable y trabajadora ya que estudia y trabaja, uno de sus deseos es salir profesional y muy pronto formar una familia.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar hojas bond por cajas, además de papel fotografico y realizar el mantenimiento respectivo de las maquinas. El internet se encuentra ubicado en la avenida buenos aires cerca a la agencia buenos aires, esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Serapio Jose, 38, is single and lives in the city of El Alto in his family's house. He has an internet cafe with 20 machines. In addition, he has a store where he sells items for animals, since he is studying to become a veterinarian. He is already in the 8th semester of this degree program. He is a person who is responsible and hardworking, given that he both studies and works. One of his wishes is to become a professional and in a short time to form his own family. The loan requested is to buy boxes of reams of paper, photographic paper, and also to carry out maintenance on his computers. His internet business is located on the Buenos Aires Avenue near the Buenos Aires Agency. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy printer and photographic paper, and to do maintenance on his electronic equipment

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina R. is from the village of Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 71 years old, widowed, and has nine adult-aged children. To make a living, Regina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Regina has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2004, Regina joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her 18th from GDMPC. Regina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Silviya

texts.en:
Silviya is married with a child. She is an entrepreneur from Beregovo. Silviya sells women’s clothing in the central marketplace. She has been working with this type of inventory for five years. Currently, Silviya has 12,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her gross income amounts to 15,000 Grivnyas. Net profit is about 4,000 – 5,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Silviya is requesting a 5,000-Grivnya loan to increase her stock. She is hoping to broaden her seasonal merchandise and boost her spring sales as a result. Silviya has always had a serious and responsible business approach. It has helped her build a sustainable venture bringing her stable income. She is hoping to continue expanding her trade in the future.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Yunus

texts.en: Yunus A. Is married and has 2 children. He was born in 1970. Yunus A. and his family live in the Absheron region. He has been in the taxi business for 5 years. Now Yunus needs a loan of 2000 Azerbaijani manat to buy spare parts to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: María Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora  María Guillermina M. es socia del Banco Comunal  Nuevo Porvenir, ella vive en la parroquia Cumbe localidad llena de  paisajes naturales que nos brindan esa paz espiritual alejada del bullicio de las grandes urbes, su gente es amable y cálida con el turista sin importar su procedencia, aquí los  mas adultos y mujeres  se dedican al cultivos de la tierra  mientras que los más jóvenes han migrado para buscar un mejor futuro.

 María Guillermina  tiene 58 años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de esa unión conyugal concibió  siete  hijos, tres  se encuentran casados y dos de ellos viven independientes, mientras que el otro comparte el techo y los gastos tanto con sus padres como son sus tres hermanos solteros que también aportan económicamente con los gastos ocasionados en el hogar y también en los estudios universitarios de su hermana menor,  su esposo trabaja en su propio taller de latonería, y a pesar del esfuerzo de todos aún no cuentan con su casa propia y viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia se encuentra doce años trabajando con su banco comunal manteniendo un excelente vinculo de amistad con todas sus compañeras,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en la feria del ganado los días miércoles y,  los fines de semana en el centro de Cumbe, los otros  días vende cafés con tamales recorriendo toda su comunidad. Con el crédito solicitado va a comprar ollas, cubiertos, platos así como arroz, azúcar, sal, y otros productos necesarios para preparar sus comidas.

Tiene como meta llegar a tener su casa propia en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Guillermina is a member of the Nuevo Porvenir (New Future) Communal Bank. She lives in the Cumbe parish locality, filled with natural rural scenes that offer spiritual peace, far from the bustle of great cities. Its people are kind and warm with the tourist, no matter your origin. Here most adults, including women, dedicate themselves to cultivating the earth, while most young people have migrated in search of a better future. María Guillermina is 58 years old, married, and has produced 7 children, 3 of whom are married. Two of these live independently while the 3rd shares the parent's roof and helps with household expenses, as do the remaining 3 single brothers as well. Besides providing for expenses they also help with university costs for their younger brother. María's husband has his own brass works shop, and despite everyone's efforts, they still can't count on their own home – they live in a rental house. María has worked with her communal bank for 12 years, maintaining excellent links with her fellow members. She sells meals at the cattle market each Wednesday, as well as on weekends in the center of Cumbe. The remaining days she sells coffee with tamales on the streets of her community. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy pots, tableware, plates, as well as rice, sugar, salt, and other products necessary for preparing these meals. Her goal is to finally have her own house in the future not too far off.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING POTS, TABLEWARE, PLATES, RICE, SUGAR, SALT, ETC., FOR SELLING MEALS

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie S., 26, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. She is married to Joselito, a garbage collector, and they are blessed with 3 children. She helps her husband earn income so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own gasoline vending and rug-making business.

Vergie has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow seven times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as additional capital to buy stock and maintain operation of her expanding business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide a happy and comfortable life for her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy stock of gasoline and diesel

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. has been an ASHI member since 2005. During her almost five years in ASHI, she has shown herself to be industrious and determined to make her dreams come true. Her family is very thankful that she has an opportunity to improve their standard of living through the proceeds of her variety store business that she has established with the support of the loans she has requested from ASHI.The variety store business has brought happiness to Evelyn’s family, and especially to her. Because of its profits, she has been able to send her children to school. Being a good mother, Evelyn’s dreams are always for her children and family. She always wanted to support her children to have a brighter tomorrow and a decent life.

With that in mind, Evelyn is requesting a loan from ASHI amounting to 30,000 Php to purchase more supplies for her store in order to attract more customers. Specifically, the amount will be used to pay for inventory of groceries for her store. She is very determined and disciplined to use the money which is lent to her. This would not only provide her with happiness in life, but would also make her business grow and make more profit, which will allow her to support the educational needs of her four children until they graduate from college.

Evelyn is hopeful that her business will grow into a full-fledged mini-grocery store and that someday she will have branches in nearby villages. One of her aspirations is to be able to build a house that is durable and spacious.

Her long-term goals are to purchase a new 'jeepney' (public transport vehicle) and tricycle (three-wheeled motorcycle) so she can expand her business to other surrounding neighborhoods.   By owning her own transportation, Evelyn will save time and money in purchasing a greater variety of inventory.  With her hard work, Evelyn is hopeful that her business ventures will continue to grow and improve the overall quality of living for her family.

loans.use: To pay for groceries for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene 34 años, comparte su vida con su esposo y su hijo, quienes viven juntos en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la venta de comestibles en una pequeña bodega que posee dentro de su casa. Desde ese momento ofrece sus productos con la mayor amabilidad y tranquilidad, además de ello también prepara gelatina, cuya venta la ayuda aumentar sus ingresos. Las ganas de salir adelante, hace que no se limite en una sola actividad, es por ello que desea realizar otros trabajos, con tal de generar ingresos económicos a su familia. En adelante ha pensado mejorar su tienda tanto en infraestructura como también en implementación, pues quiere que sea más amplia y mejor surtida para así ganar más clientes. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y ella se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de productos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia is 34 and shares her life with her husband and child. They live together in their own home. She sells food in a small store in her home. She has always offered her products with the greatest kindness and gentleness. She also prepares jelly, the sale of which helps her to increase her earnings. Her desire to get ahead means that she does not limit herself to one single activity, and so she wants to do other jobs to generate income for her family. In the future she plans to improve her store, both its infrastructure and set-up, and she wants it to be fuller and better-stocked to gain more customers. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with all her repayments. With the requested loan, she will buy a greater quantity of products to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Poultry

loans.name: Gloria Tero Group

texts.en:
Gloria T. is from the village of Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Gloria is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gloria is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business making and selling delicacies in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gloria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Manassé Plus Group

texts.en:
Bibi B. is the leader of this community bank named “Manassé Plus” which is composed of thirteen micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to obtain loans from Kiva through HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Bibi sells salted fish in the eastern area of Kinshasa and has been in business since 1990. Her beginning capital was $30. Currently, through her sales, she makes about $70 per week. Bibi likes selling because it gives her the opportunity to make contacts with many different people, and once they become permanent clients she is able to offer them quality products at a better price.

Bibi plans to use this next loan to purchase seven bags of salted fish to resell in order to increase her income. She is a trustworthy client of HOPE DRC, having six times received and properly repaid loans.

Bibi is 53 years old, is married, and is the mother of two children whose ages are 9 and 14. Both attend school. She dreams one day of building a large business building for rent.

loans.use: To purchase seven bags of salted fish to resell at a profit

loans.name: Rabina

texts.en: Rabina L. is from the town of Talibon. She is 36 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rabina owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rabina has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. Rabina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rabina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rabina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Oscar Omar

texts.es:
La persona que aparece es la esposa del solicitante

Oscar Omar Díaz F. se dedica a cortar cabello para hombre en una peluquería muy conocida en la ciudad casi todos los 7 días de la semana.  El señor es un hombre muy responsable que quiere ofrecer a su esposa e hijos una mejora calidad de vida. El baño que tiene esta en muy buenas condiciones solo que quiere darle mejor vista es por eso que quiere colocar piso cerámico.
texts.en:
The person in the photo is the borrower’s wife. Oscar Omar Díaz F. works as a barber in one of the city’s best known barber shops almost all 7 days of the week. He is a very responsible man who wants to provide his wife with a better quality of life. Although their bathroom is in very good condition he wants to give it a better appearance so he wants to install a tile floor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile flooring.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Flor De Cayo Blanco Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Flor de Cayo Blanco está integrado por 2 socios (Omar e Iris), los cuales residen en la Aldea de Cayo Blanco y realizan diferentes actividades económicas. El coordinador del grupo es Omar Antonio A., tiene 42 años y su familia está conformada por su esposa y sus tres hijos de 19, 17 y 16 años. Omar se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos. Inició su negocio a raíz de su casamiento porque tuvo que salirse de la casa de sus padres y para poder mantener a su esposa tuvo que buscar una forma de hacerlo, así que comenzó a comprar cerdos para destazarlos y vender la carne a pulperías y carnicerías. Una de las ventajas es que es un negocio muy rentable y eso le ha permitido sostener a su familia, aunque con muchas limitaciones económicas. Una de las desventajas es que el mercado está saturado de personas que se dedican al mismo negocio y algunos para vender su producto más rápido lo hacen a un precio muy bajo con el cual no puede competir.  Con el apoyo de este préstamo espera tener las suficientes ganancias para llevar el sustento al hogar y comprar los útiles, uniformes, zapatos  que sus hijos necesitan para ir al colegio. Su compañera de grupo Iris se dedica a la venta de golosinas, es casada y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Cayo Blanco” communal bank has two members (Omar and Iris) who live in the village of Cayo Blanco and carry out different economic activities. The group coordinator is Omar Antonio A., 42. His family consists of his wife and his three children who are 19, 17, and 16 years old. Omar is a pork merchant. He started his business when he got married because he had to leave his parents’ house and had to find a way to support his wife. He started buying pigs to butcher and sell the meat to grocery stores and butcheries. One of the advantages of the business is that it is very profitable and this has allowed him to support his family although with many economic limitations. One of the disadvantages is that the market is saturated with people who do the same kind of work and some of them, in order to sell their products quickly, do so at such low prices that he is unable to compete. With the support this loan gives him he hopes to have sufficient profits to support his household and to buy school supplies, uniforms and shoes that his children need to go to school. His fellow group member, Iris, sells snacks. She is married and has two children

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Vicuñitas De Plata Group

texts.es:
El Centro Focal de GERMAN BUSCH es el penúltimo en haber sido abierto, acoge a cerca cien asociaciones comunales.  “Vicuñitas de Plata” es relativamente nueva, esta en su segundo ciclo, de ocho integrantes siete son mujeres y uno es varón. 

La señora Inez es la presidenta de la asociación, el negocio en el que participa desde hace 10 años, es la venta de comida.  Ella comenta que fue su suegra quien le enseñó del negocio.

Su primera solicitud fue de Bs 1000.-, ahora solicitó Bs. 2500.- en ambos casos, su objetivo era la compra de insumos. Las ventas son realizadas en las Ferias.  Le ayudan en el trabajo sus 4 hijos.

Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta más de Pro Mujer, la señora comenta que la capacitación.

Con respecto a los negocios dentro de la asociación, son variados, entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta  de batidos, venta de comida y ropa usada, chofer y analista de sistemas, venta de tejidos, venta de queso y venta de varios.
texts.en:
The focal center German Busch is the second to the last center to open and it covers near 100 community associations.   “Vicuñitas de Plata” is relatively new, it is in its second loan cycle, and has eight members, seven women and one man.

Mrs. Inez is the president of the association.  The business that she has been in for the last 10 years if the sale of meals.  She comments that her mother-in-law was the one that showed her this business. 

Her first request was for 1000 Bs., now she is requesting 2500 Bs.  In both cases her goal is the purchase of supplies.  She makes her sales in the markets.  Her 4 children help her with the work.

When asked what she likes the most about Pro Mujer, she says it is the training.

The businesses within the organization are varied.  Among them are food sales, sales of milk shakes, sale of used clothing, transportation services and system analysis, sale of woven textiles, cheese sales and miscellaneous sales.

loans.use: Supplies: pasta, rice, potatoes.

loans.name: Dushekan's Group

texts.en:
Dushekan K. is the leader of this group. She is 54 and a widow. She has raised five daughters; four of them are married and live separately with their families and the youngest daughter studies at school.  In 2007 Dushekan’s daughters collected money and presented her two calves. And since that moment Dushekan has been engaged in cattle breeding.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase cattle in order to resell it a higher price after fattening.  In the future she wants to increase the number of cattle and then build a proper shed.

Asyl B. is the treasurer of the group. She is 28 and married. She has three daughters. The first daughter is at school and the others are not yet; they are preschool age (under seven).  Asyl is engaged in cattle breeding and her husband is a private driver. Asyl started to breed cattle in 2005 with the initial investment of 25,000 soms.  She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase two more farm animals for breeding. 

Damira J., 43, is married. She has two sons and a daughter. All the children are students. Damira and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding. They started this activity in 2002. With money received from the loan, Damira wants to purchase two calves in order to increase her herd.

Taalaibek B., 43, is married. He has two daughters and three sons.  Taalaibek and his wife are farmers. They breed cattle and cultivate different fruits and vegetables. With money received from the loan, Taalaibek wants to purchase cattle and then resell the animals a higher price after fattening.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba P. D. M. vive en el barrio La Ceiba D. la ciudad D. Barranquilla, allí tiene una microempresa D. fabricación D. almuerzos y comidas corrientes especialmente D. sancochos,  una deliciosa sopa típica que incluye yuca, ñame, plátano, ahuyama y  papa, al cual se agrega alguna carne D. res o D. cerdo, o gallina o pescado o trifásico que es la mezcla D. tres carnes, o pentafásico si así usted lo quiere. 
El negocio D. Alba P. surgió cuando su esposo, un empleado D. restaurantes, dejó D. trabajar y ellos aprovecharon ese potencial D. conocimientos para aplicarlo a un negocio que  generará ingresos familiares  por cuenta propia. DesD. ese momento le venD. a la comunidad donD. habita y a negocios D. la Cordialidad, una vía principal cercana conformada por muchas microempresas y empresas, cuyos trabajadores se han convertido en sus clientes a los que  también ofrece  su servicio a domicilio.  Este es su segundo financiamiento recibido por parte D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con su credikiva comprará materiales e insumos al por mayor, como arroz, aceites, harinas,zaucar y sal,  para disminuir los costos y dejar D. comprar al menudeo.  Su sueño principal es tener un local ya que en este momento trabaja en la terraza D. su casa   para ser vista por los peatones. Su principal problema es la alta competencia que tiene en  el sector pero que Alba enfrenta con calidad, buenos precios y prácticas apropiadas D. higiene.
texts.en:
Alba P. D. M. lives in La Ceiba neighborhood in the town of Barranquilla.  There she has a small business preparing lunches and set meals, especially 'sancochos', a delicious, traditional soup which includes cassava, yam, plantain, pumpkin and potato to which she adds some beef, pork, chicken, fish or 'trifásico' which is a mixture of three meats, or 'pentafásico' (with five meats) if that is what you like.

Alba P.'s business started when her husband, a restaurant employee, stopped working.  They took advantage of his knowledge and applied it to a business which would create family income and let them be self employed.  From that moment she has been selling to their local community and to the businesses in la Cordialidad, a nearby main road where there are a lot of businesses whose workers have become their customers.  They also offer a home delivery service.

This is Alba P.'s second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use her Kiva loan to buy material and supplies wholesale such as rice, oil, flour, sugar and salt.  This will help her to lower costs as she can stop buying at retail prices.  Her main dream is to have her own premises since at the moment she is working outsiD. her own home so that pedestrians can see her.  Her main problem is the stiff competition that exists in the sector but Alba faces this with quality, good prices and appropriate hygiene practices.

loans.use: To buy material and supplies wholesale such as rice, oil, flour, sugar and salt

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita A. is a married woman who lives in Purok 2, Brgy. Tayawan, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: pig fattening , buying and selling livestock and a farming businesses.  Her husband Jose A. JR., who is 59 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have eight children who are 14 to 37 years old.

Conchita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Conchita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 7th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for her business so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Conchita A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase feed for hogs

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson, a 30-year-old father of three children between the ages of nine and one, hails from Nyamira Town in Western Kenya where he produces beans, tea and milk. His sales are to the government and the local market, and he earns additional income from his retail shop business in the market. He is hoping to have five cows within five years.

Now requesting 30,000 KES, this will be Samson's second from Juhudi Kilimo. His first loan of 20,OOO KES was repaid promptly. While he laments the poor market prices for his produce, he is confident of his ability to repay this loan and eventually qualify for an even larger amount.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Meliton

texts.en:
Meliton A. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. He is 54 years old. Meliton is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Meliton owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Meliton has been engaged in his business for over 28 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Meliton joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meliton has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Meliton is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Meliton from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Karla Liliana

texts.es: Karla Liliana S. B. de 27 años de edad, reside en Colón, en el departamento de La Libertad, ella vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, así mismo vive junto a su único hijo de 11 años de edad. Karla posee una venta de ropa y zapatos para hombres mujeres y niños, la cual comercializa en el centro de Tacachico,  en donde cuenta con muchos clientes a quienes les agrada ir a comprar donde Karla por los precios bajos y la calidad de la ropa. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar ropa y zapatos por mayor de manera que pueda obtenerlos a precios menores, lo cual la beneficia porque podrá obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales se vean reflejadas en la calidad de vida de su familia, la cual es su prioridad.
texts.en: Karla Liliana S. B. is 27 years old and lives in Colon, in the area of La Libertad.  She lives with her husband, who is employed as a bricklayer, and their 11 year old son.  Karla runs a shop in the center of Tacachico,  where she sells clothing and shoes for men, women and children.  She has a good base of customers who appreciate the good prices and quality of clothing.    Karla is requesting a loan to purchase clothing and shoes wholesale, so that she can get better prices.  This will enable her to increase her income and improve the quality of life for her family, which is her top priority.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory, clothing and shoes, for her business

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a thirty years old husband and a father of one daughter and two sons, Fadi's wife has completed her high school education and didn't go to college because she got married and had children.  Now that Fadi's children are older and his wife can go back to school again she started at a university a couple of years ago.

Fadi came to FATEN and took a loan to pay for his wife tuition fees and books that she needs for school.  Fadi's wife wishes to finish school and start working as soon as possible.

Fadi who is a municipality employee appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Jabalia Refugee camp.

loans.use: Pay for wife school tuition fees

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy C. is 22 years old, married and a mother of two beautiful children. Her husband, Daniel Kipruto, practices horticulture and hence produces additional income for the family. Lucy does dairy farming and also poultry rearing in Tuiyo where they live. Lucy has been in this business for six months now and gets a monthly income of KES. 4,000.


This will be Lucy's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to buy one young cow and poultry for egg production. With the income she is going to get, she wants to buy more cows for milk production so that she can sell the milk. 

In the future, she wants to own a piece of land where she can do her agricultural business.

loans.use: To buy a young cow and poultry

loans.name: Yves

texts.en:
Yves is a 25-year-old married man who owns a small shop selling mobile phones. Yves' wife also works and they do not have any children. Yves purchased his business four years ago and chose it because he believed that it would return a solid profit. The store is well-organized and is open from 8 am until 6 pm on weekdays.

This is Yves' first loan and he intends to use the loan to purchase more inventory and hopes to use the profits to eventually become a wholesale seller of mobile phones.

loans.use: Additional inventory of mobile phones

loans.name: Apeafa  Amevi

texts.fr: Mariée  et  mère  d’un enfant, Dame   Apeafa  a 35 ans.  Elle  est née  à  Lomé.  Pour contribuer   au  ménage, elle  fait  la  vente  des  verres  et chaussures  pour   enfant.  Elle  a  commencé  en  2009 et s’approvisionne  au  port  autonome  de  Lomé  et au grand  marché  de  Lomé.  Elle  a  remboursé  déjà  2  crédits  à  Wages.  Elle   demande  un prêt  pour  satisfaire  plus  de  clients.
texts.en: Married and the mother of one, Apeafa is 35 years old. She was born in Lome. In order to contribute to the household, she sells drinking glasses and kids' shoes. She started out in 2009 and she makes her purchases at the autonomous port in Lome and in the large market in Lome. She has already repaid 2 past loans with Wages (Kiva Field Partner). She requests a loan in order to satisfy more clients.

loans.use: To purchase drinking cups and kids' shoes.

loans.name: Anarhan's Group

texts.ru:
В 1994 году, три года после распада Советского союза и начала перестройки, семья Назаркуловых была наделена земельным участком в несколько гектаров. Привыкшие работать на коллективное благо, для Назаркуловых было новшеством начать свой личный бизнес. Анархан Назаркулова, 53 летний лидер этой группы, первой по инициативе своего мужа купила на 2 000 сомов скот для разведения. Так как земледелие – это сезонный источник дохода, животноводство оказалось хорошим дополнением в копилку семьи. Зимнее время – это перерыв для земледела , но у Анархан теперь есть новые заботы о живности. Особенно в зимнее время живность требует особого ухода в отличии от лета, когда скот может ,позаботиться о себе». Супруг Анархан – гидротехник, и у них 15летняя дочь, финансово зависящая о них. Старший 25летнй сын работает в ташкумырском ГАО и в тоже вносит свою лепту в развитие семейного бизнеса. 15летний стаж оправдал ожидания Анархан. На данный момент сельское хозяйство совместно с откормом и разведением скота приносят Анархан около 9 500 сомов месячного дохода. Как и все фермеры, Анархан с нетерпением ждет начала посевов. Покупка удобрений будет ее основной затратой, поэтому она  хочет получить кредит. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
